title: Perfect Hotel for a New York Trip!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay! Clean and nice room, friendly and always helpful staff. No things to complain!
The location of the hotel is excellent. Short distances to the subway and many nearby restaurants.
The next time I'm in New York, I'll be happy to come back. Top price-performance ratio.

title: My new go-to hotel for NYC
text: The owner is very warm and welcoming and treats every guest like a long-time friend. The rest of the staff is excellent as well, always ready to help with recommendations, amenities, directions, or whatever else you may need. The hotel itself is immaculate. The neighborhood outside is very loud but as soon as you enter the lobby you're met with sense of calm and quiet, and this peace is throughout the entire property. The rooms are small but not cramped, clean, and thoughtfully furnished. The bathroom is large, clean, and bright. The shower is hot and has a great shower head. The Manhattan Bridge and train were directly across from our window - you could see them but not hear them. The soundproofing is incredible. Blackout curtains make the room completely dark. The AC works great and is quiet. The bed and bedding was super comfortable in every respect. I have not slept this well in a long time. The hotel is in the heart if Chinatown (but not the tourist area) so you'll get the authentic Chinatown experience and there's plenty of food everywhere. The subway station is a quick 5 minute walk. Little Italy is a quick walk away also. I booked this property based on good reviews and was not disappointed. I will absolutely return to this location for future NYC trips.

title: we can’t wait to come back!
text:
Loved it! Nothing but good things to say about Hotel Mimosa. Staff were incredibly kind and helpful during our stay. We were greeted warmly and given a list of recommendations for restaurants and cafes in the area. We were also allowed to store our luggage before check in and after check out which was so nice! The room was cozy, clean, and the bed was so comfortable. 
Location can’t be beat. Close to transit + unlimited food options.  My partner and I continuously raved about what a good decision it was to stay here. Thank you again for providing us with such a great experience. :•)

the windows are full insolated. all the nessesary for a short period. good people in the front desk

title: Great stay in a super convenient location
text: We had a delightful stay at this gem!  The owner was so gracious and took the time to give us excellent advice and take good care of us.  The room was clean and well appointed.  I enjoyed the European duvet covers and very comfortable beds, big bath towels, and full-sized bottles of shampoo, etc.  They even had all the extra toiletries right in the room so if you were just coming in on a whim, you'd be all set.  Great Chinatown location, walkable to so many cool things!  Also just a short walk to the Grand St. B/D station for easy access to the rest of the city.

title: Our NYC go-to
text: As always - staff is friendly and helpful, the provided restaurant recommendation lists steered us to some great meals, loved the location. Clean and quiet (the train is nearby but the noise didn't wake us up.) Right by the Manhattan Bridge which makes for a great morning stroll - take the Brooklyn Bridge back! Perfect every time we need a city getaway.

title: Solid and comfortable
text: So welcoming, comfortable and professional.  Hot water! Well insulated if not perfectly quiet,  able to sleep despite trains and traffic. Recommend enthusiastically. Great part of town to discover new sights and smells,  less touristy with solid local feel to business.  Thank you.

title: Excellent hotel in New York
text: Excellent hotel. Simple but equipped with all the necessary comforts. The location is strategic. In the area there are many restaurants and some metro stops. It is very simple to reach the hotel from the airport. The hotel staff is very friendly and professional

title: Great Chinatown location to move around
text: Excellent location to move around the south part of Manhattan, close to transportation and to several points of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho. Big bathrooms in the rooms and proper installations in the basement to heat up/eat meals. The list of recommendations to eat and places to visit was very welcome!

title: Lovely place, felt very welcomed and cozy
text: The Queen rooms are small but it was perfect for two people. The list of recommended restaurants and cafes we were given at check-in was super nice, too. Location was nice, lots of spots in the area. Staff was friendly and were kind enough to hold our bags for a few hours after we checked out which was so helpful.

title: Good stay due to lack of cleanliness
text:
The Hotel is in an incredibly good location, close to several metro stops. They left us umbrellas for rain. On the lower floor they have a common refrigerator although there was no coffee maker or chocolate bars as previous clients mentioned, it must be that they have already removed it.
They gave us a map and recommendations of places.
The only bad thing and to highlight was the lack of cleaning of the room, the bathroom was not cleaned for a week since I dropped makeup powder in the sink and it was there throughout our stay. The carpet needed cleaning and the bedside table and beds were very dusty.
Otherwise well.

title: Would rebook, instantly
text: Quintessential New York hotel. Excellent use of space, quiet rooms, comfortable amenities, incredible recommendations for food in the neighborhood. Made my whole trip simpler and more enjoyable to be honest. Also there’s a boba place right next door and it was the perfect mid-afternoon pick me up.

title: Good surprise
text:
The apartment is very comfortable and organized. The service was great and the receptionist was very attentive and helped with all our needs.
The room is simple but comfortable. As our stay was short, it perfectly met our needs.
The region is within easy reach of the Brooklyn Bridge and Financial District

title: Recommend!
text: Better than advertised. Very friendly staff, very clean room, and central location. Very pleased with the staff and their level of hospitality. Possibility to leave the luggage after check out was very appreciated. Absolutely recommend!

title: Simple hotel for a city trip
text:
A simple, clean hotel with good value for money and a very good base for exploring New York. The staff was friendly and helpful. The windows are soundproof, the rooms are clean. I recommend booking at least a twin bed room for two people. We had a queen size bed room on the first night and that was definitely not enough space with luggage for two people.
We would definitely recommend it for a city trip and would book there again!

title: So many great things to share!
text:
So many great things to share! Forster, the location was perfect, minutes walk from everything in Chinatown and Little Italy. The host that welcomed us was kind, supportive of our needs and requests, and gave us great food recommendations and weather updates. The room itself was cozy, with super comfortable memory foam mattress, black out curtains, space heater if needed, and all the little things needed in the bathroom
 Room was super clean, amenities were just right! We are so glad we found this place and know where to stay the next time we visit the area!

title: Noisy
text:
Clean, overall good room.
But it got very stuffy and there was no thermostat.
Also noisy from the train which is right across the street. It is not extremely loud, but it's loud enough to disturb your sleep, a noise machine would help.
Smoke alarm light kept blinking.

title: Very nice hotel in Manhattan
text:
Very nice hotel in the heart of Manhattan! Clean, functional room. Very comfortable bedding. We appreciated the proximity to transportation and restaurants.
The only small negative point is the soundproofing between rooms, but passengers must respect "quiet" hours between 10pm and 8am. The staff are respectful and friendly.

title: Best price quality for NY
text: This is hotel is very good. The room is clean, big , wifi works perfect , staff very friendly . Location very good and safe district. Price per night is honest of you compare with other accommadarions in New York. The staff is available,  always ready to give information and help

title: Best New York City Hotel
text: I have stayed here 3-4 times for business and every time I come here there’s new room decorations, their  restaurant recommendation lists are updated and I always find a new place that I love to eat in downtown New York. If you need big, ostentatious accommodations, Hotel Mimosa is not for you. But if you like coziness, cleanliness, a beautiful staff who are  lovely to speak with, great hotel prices at a great location then look no further.

title: New York
text: Good location, the room was small but clean, the staff was kind and helpful. Breakfast was not offered, but there were many places to eat nearby. The only thing that was a little disturbing was the constant noise of the railway. It was not very loud in the room, but the noise outside was very loud

title: Very nice stay
text: We had an amazing stay ! The room was very nice and the bathroom had everything you might need for a short stay. Everyone at the hotel was very nice. The hotel is very well situated and there are a lot of nice food places in the neighborhood. Thank you for having us.

title: Best hotel experience you will find for the price!
text: The best hotel experience I have had. Walk in off the busy street in the middle of downtown Manhattan and step into a warm, quiet, atmosphere that feels like it’s own bubble. When you walk in reception is extremely welcoming and the atmosphere is cozy and home-like. Room and stay were great, no problems. Just what I needed.

title: Experience Chinatown
text: extremely cute, nice, minimal, soothing, wonderful. i went to not spend time in the hotel, but to rest comfortably at the end of a long day exploring chinatown. the little notes of recommended places they provide are CLASS A! i spend a lot of time in chinatown and learned of many new places from these lists. love mimosa and can't wait to return.

title: A Jewel in Chinatown
text: A quiet, scrupulously clean, and with thoughtful amenities hotel, in the midst of a busy neighborhood. Very courteous, thoughtful staff. So conveniently located in Chinatown, near the Village and near subway. Also the price is very reasonable. A little jewel.

title: A nice, affordable, place to stay in NYC
text: A nice place to stay and a great deal at the price.  It was fun to stay in that part of NYC too.  Easy to find an affordable, good, meals nearby.  We walked over from the Grand St.  subway stop.  The rooms are not big, but there is enough room to get around and a desk to work at.  We also spent most of the day out visiting the city.

title: Preiswerte Übernachtungsmöglichkeit, nicht mehr, nicht weniger.
text: Also einen Beitrag zum NYC-Erlebnis steuert das Mimosa nicht bei. Aber es ist sauber. Die Zimmer sind klein und der Lärm der Manhatten-Bridge dringt stark abgedämpft durch die Fenster. Mich hat es nicht gestört, aber mich hindern auch keine Gewitter am Schlafen.  Die Metrostationen drei verschiedener Linien sind allesamt in 5 bis 10 Minuten fußläufig zu erreichen, so dass man innerhalb kürzester Zeit in alle Winkel Manhattens vordringen kann. Die Rezeptionsmitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Hier wird auch stilles Wasser zum Kauf angeboten, weitaus billiger, als ich es sonst irgendwo gesehen habe. WLAN war in 201 sehr gut. FireTV-Stick konnte problemlos am Smart-TV genutzt werden. Steckdosen waren ausreichend vorhanden.

title: Lovely staff, convenient location
text:
Great location. The staff is amazing and they offer wonderful recommendations in the neighborhood. Highly recommend!

For noise sensitive travelers, the hotel can be a bit loud bc it is right near the train. Maybe bring ear plugs. The noise is better on weekends when the train may have modified service I think.

title: A Real Find
text:
This hotel is really a jewel. Excellent customer service. The rooms are lovely, too. 

The front desk was very helpful, asking us if we needed help finding places to eat. They also were great as we left our luggage for a few hours after we checked out.

title: Top Place in Downtown
text: The room was very tidy and cozy. the employees are very friendly and accommodating. The location of the hotel is absolutely brilliant, right in Chinatown next to delicious food options and not far from the Manhattan Bridge and the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Esta muy bien
text: Estuvo muy bien, básico y sencillo, con lo necesario. Habitaciones pequeñas y funcionales. Limpio y acogedor. El personal muy simpático, hasta te recomiendan restaurantes y cafés en la cercanía. El transporte está cerca. En el corazón de Chinatown.

title: TUTTO PERFETTO, PULITO, GENTILI, PREZZO ONESTO
text: Hotel pulitissimo, il personale è super gentile, il prezzo davvero onesto, a 6 minuti a piedi passa la metro, ed è molto comodo per visitare New York. Ho trovato super interessante anche il quartiere (Chinatown), senz’altro merita una visita per visitare una parte di New York un po’ insolita.

title: A gem in Chinatown
text: A gem of a small hotel in Chinatown.  Our king room was amazingly quiet given the  Manhattan Bridge righht out the window. The blackout curtain kept the room very dark.  Our bathroom was surprisingly spacious, and the water is HOT.  There is no coffee or tea service, but the Fresh Swan bakery directly across the street has inexpensive coffee beginning at 6 am.  We highly recommend!

title: A must visit in NYC
text: This classic New York hotel excels in the details. The value and kindness of the staff here is always outstanding, I have never been disappointed.  It's near public transportation offers great value for a New York City Hotel.

title: Ottima esperienza
text: Pulizia impeccabile, gentilezza del personale, ottima posizione dell'hotel. L'unica pecca è la dimensione della camera (molto piccola). Prezzo più conveniente rispetto alla concorrenza. Consigliatissimo

title: Friendly, clean and an excellent place to stay
text: The hotel was clean, the room was very nice and quiet. The staff were excellent and very friendly. Even though we arrived early we were able to keep our bags there while we walked around and they even got our room ready early for us. If you want to stay in the heart of Chinatown this is the place.

text:

We were able to check in a little early, which was a welcome gift. The room was very clean, simple, minimal and fit our needs to T. We’d recommend the hotel to anyone going to New York.

title: Nice downtown hotel perfect for Chinatown and LES.
text: Room was very comfortable, albeit pretty small.  Excellent price and nice bathroom...again small but fine.  Great location for those visiting Chinatown and the Lower East Side, adjacent to the Manhattan Bridge at the convergence of Division Street and Eldridge.  Very nice front desk staff!

title: Clean quiet safe accommodations and friendly helpful staff
text: This was our first time staying at this hotel as well as in Chinatown.  Clean quiet safe accommodations and friendly helpful staff.  We did a Chinatown food crawl and this is the perfect home base.  Great location.

title: Great hotel in Chinatown!
text: Great find in Manhattan! We had an amazing time in the city and this hotel was a great base for that! Confortable. Clean, affordable, and friendly!  Totally recommend for anyone hoping to visit in the future.

title: Absolutely fab
text:
The reviews were great and what a little gem of a hotel. Very clean, comfortable beds and lovely bedding. A warm welcome from the lovely manager. Would definitely stay here again. Don’t be afraid of first impressions, it’s so quiet in the rooms.
Lovely breakfast place in Chatham Square called Tria bakery.

title: A+ hotel in Manhattan!
text: My partner and I had a great stay at Hotel Mimosa. While the queen room was compact, it was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was surprisingly large. The location is perfect- close to the trains and many food options. We had pleasant interactions with the front desk staff and housekeeping. I’d definitely stay here the next time I’m in the city. Support Asian American businesses!!!

title: Amazing Value
text: Is this a 5 star hotel? no. Is it everything I needed for my trip and more? yes. The location  pretty nice, close to the highway for easy access in and out of city as well as several transit options. In the heart of Chinatown and super close to LES! Felt safe the whole time and the staff are the most kind, friendly, and welcoming people I've seen in a long time. note the rooms are small (who cares your not in NYC to stay inside) and the rooms dont have AC (or heating?), so I would maybe avoid in the heat of summer. Otherwise couldnt recommend more for the price.

title: Sehr gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis, Sauber und Kostengünstig für NYC!
text: Wir waren auf der Suche nach einem guten aber kostengünstigen Hotel in New York, was wir mit Hotel Mimosa definitiv gefunden haben. Wir werden das Hotel auf jeden Fall Freunden und Familie bei einem Trip nach New York weiterempfehlen. Die Zimmer bieten alles, was man bei einem Stadturlaub benötigt, sind zwar eher eher klein aufgrund natürlich der immensen Preise vor Ort, aber sehr sauber, ausgestattet mit einem großzügigen Vanity Kit, Fön, Fernseher. Man kann dort auch guten Gewissens sein Gepäck unterstellen, dieses wird in einem separaten Raum gelagert. Die Angestellten waren überaus freundlich und hilfsbereit, man kann sich an der Rezeption außerdem für nur einen Dollar Wasserflaschen kaufen. Insgesamt waren wir sehr zufrieden mit unserer Wahl und können Hotel Mimosa ausdrücklich weiterempfehlen.

title: Cute little rooms for a good nights sleep in Chinatown
text:
Liked: Super comfy beds, extremely effective black out curtains, food options nearby, location close to LES & bridge to Brooklyn 
Disliked: Room was pretty small, stylistically had the feeling of a dorm room, carpet needs cleaning, thermostat was a space heater

title: Review of Mimosa!
text: Great location and price! Can’t beat both of those. The room was on the smaller side but very clean. Windows are double panel so it cancel out a lot of the noise outside. The bed however is by the door so you will hear noises in the hallway. Overall, I enjoy my stay here and would definitely come back!

title: Nice economical cozy hotel in Manhattan Chinatown
text:
Nice clean cozy rooms for the price paid. The staff need special mention for being very friendly and helpful. Having arrived on a morning flight we were happy to get our room early as soon as one became available. The street in front of the hotel is not busy and so our Uber rides could wait for us. Bottled water at $1 at the front desk is convenient. 
Our only surprise was that wasn't any housekeeping service the 3 days we were there.

title: Great experience and amazing staff
text: An amazing and cozy place to stay in Manhattan! Staff is kind and helpful. Rooms are clean and very well isolated from outside noises. Beds are comfortable. The hotel is not that far from metro stations, little Italy, of course Chinatown as it is located there and the financial district. I’d definitely go back there next time I’ll be in New York! Thank you!

title: Parfait
text:
- Hôtel très bien situé, proche de plusieurs lignes de métro (notamment : métro direct vers l'AirTrain de l'aéroport JFK, facilité de déplacement vers les lieux à voir de Manhattan), ouvert 24/24

- Personnel très accueillant et accommodant (ex. en cas de soucis de carte bancaire), 

- Chambre Superior Queen spacieuse, très bien isolée du bruit extérieur et avec une excellente literie permettant des nuits reposantes,

- Salle de bain également spacieuse avec mise à disposition de savon, shampoing, gel douche et crème pour les mains mais également d'un kit de dépannage (dentifrice, brosse à dents, rasoir jetable) ; à noter aussi : l'efficacité de la VMC et de la pression de la douche!

- Entre autres services : prêt de parapluie (de très bonne qualité) en cas de besoin, possibilité de déposer ses bagages à l'accueil pour la journée dans un local sécurisé (pratique pour profiter pleinement de son dernier jour dans cette ville formidable!)

- Et la cerise sur le gâteau : une liste de lieux à visiter et surtout une liste de restaurants situés à 5 - 10 min à pieds sélectionnés par l'hôtel ; j'en ai essayé quatre, tous excellents !

title: High standard hotel in Chinatown for a great price
text:
So pleasantly surprised by how comfortable we felt here. We only had one night but we were feeling nervous because we had booked one of the most budget friendly hotels in the area. This hotel felt so safe and clean. The rooms, although much smaller than average, were very nice and had all the essentials. Bathroom came with quality soaps, hair product, toothpaste and toothbrush. We really didn’t mind the size, but if that’s an issue maybe call to see if they have larger rooms available. At night, they lock the hotel front door and only let in guests carrying a key which made us feel very assured that we were safe. The staff was very professional and we loved the curated lists for local picks of restaurants and cafes all in walking distance. Chinatown in NYC is truly special and my fiancé and I already decided any visit we make in the future will be at hotel Mimosa. 

For a traveler on a budget, I consider this a 5 star!

title: Would 100% stay here again, great value!
text:
Terrific location, a short walk from two different subway stations. 

Safe feeling! The neighborhood is wonderful, especially if you're into fresh (read: live) seafood. 

The hotel is welcoming with friendly staff and helpful documentation of local restaurants, dim sum spots, and brunch locales. 

This place seems too good to be true, but it's not for you if you're looking for things like: free breakfast, a big lobby, a name brand and hotel points, spacious rooms, a 5 minute walk from Times Square.

title: Good value for money in Manhatten
text: Hotels in Manhatten are very expensive, but the Mimosa has very good value for money. Clean and functional room, good front desk service, middle of Chinatown safe and close to both subway and CitiBike station. I'm usually very sensitive to noise but despite the proximity to the train, it didn't bother me at all due to excellent sound proofing.

title: Low budget high quality 🌈
text: This hotel has absolutely excellent service. Centrally located in the heart of Chinatown. This is a low budget hotel with excellent quality and service. The front desk is extremely helpful and also provide you with a great overview of small but mighty restaurants and bars.

title: Welcoming staff, clean and comfortable rooms
text:
You get top value for what you pay for and then some.

This place is CLEAN! Look forward to a comfy bed and pillows, work desk, smart TV, soap/toiletries, they even had a toothbrush, tongue cleaner, small toothpaste and shower cap. 

Kind staff and great location with everything you need nearby- restaurants but also helpful essentials like pharmacies and affordable groceries nearby. Plus the nearby metro.
On the basement level they provide a fridge and microwave for your leftovers.

Another thing worth noting- this is a trustworthy locally owned business. I have had two experiences with them- a recent stay, and a previous reservation I had to cancel (deposit was refunded with no questions asked). And if there’s an issue, they’ll address it. You can’t always expect that from big chain hotels.

I’d highly recommend staying here. 🙂

title: Hidden Gem in Chinatown NY
text: Very accommodating/friendly staff. Kathy and Daniel or Danny are GREAT as they did there very best for my mother who was a last minute add on. They were able to add in a roll away bed on last minute notice. Small, but provides necessities! They also sell water for $1, which is very reasonable compared to other places. Thank you!

title: Can be noisy at night
text:
As others have said, this is a nice, clean and comfortable budget hotel in a great location. We were impressed to have a view of the World Trade Centre from our bedroom window. The staff are welcoming, and the list of recommended local places to eat is a great idea.

The soundproofing on the windows is excellent. In fact we found it stuffy with the windows closed, so we started sleeping with a window open. You can certainly hear the subway trains on the Manhattan Bridge, but it wasn't loud enough to disturb our sleep. The street itself is very quiet, especially at night.

Unfortunately we did have problems with noise from within the hotel itself. The bedroom doors don't block sound at all and the corridors are quite echoey, so we could hear absolutely everything. The problem with this was that during the night there were frequently loud groups of people talking, laughing and (it sounded like) partying in neighbouring rooms and in the corridor itself. On two of the five nights of our stay there was a lot of noise between 11pm and 3am, so we didn't sleep much at all. There was a sign in the corridor asking for "quiet time" between 10pm and 8am, but people ignored that. At one point (around 1am one night) I complained to the receptionist, who tried knocking on people's doors and asking them to keep the noise down - but I'm not sure they even heard him. The management tried to help, installing a draft excluder at the bottom of our bedroom door, but unfortunately that didn't have much effect.

By the third night here we were desperate for sleep, and even considered checking out early and paying again to stay somewhere else. Luckily there weren't any noisy groups for our last couple of nights and we were able to sleep soundly.

title: Fijn verblijf
text: Hotel Mimosa is een fijn verblijf op een leuke locatie. Je hebt veel leuke eettentjes om de hoek zitten. Het personeel is erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Daarnaast zijn de bedden goed, de kamers wel wat aan de kleine kant, maar prima, omdat je veel op pad bent. Toch is het een fijne plek om je even terug te trekken uit de drukke stad.

title: Great Stay and Will Be Back!
text:
Hotel Mimosa is the Chinatown hotel to stay. Conveniently located, super friendly staff, and CLEAN rooms! 

Windows are double panes so noise is not an issue at night. Hot water for showers and all the necessities you need for a NYC stay!

title: Super recomendable
text:
Dentro de las ofertas de hoteles con baño privado este hotel nos pareció la mejor opción, sobretodo por las buenas reseñas. 
El personal es muy amable y nos respondieron muy bien cuando nos quejamos por ruidos de la habitación de al lado y también al pedir que nos parasen el aire condiconado (no estamos acostumbrados, motivo puramente personal, incluso me subieron una manta). El hotel i la habitación eran correctas y bastante silecionsas, a penas se escuchaba el metro que pasa cerca por el puente. 
Además nos guardaron las maletas el último día sin ningún coste. En la planta inferior hay nevera y alguna maquina expendedora.
En la habitación había muchos amenities (incluso un cepillo de dientes) y también había secador de pelo. 
El internet también funcionaba muy bien y rapido.
No tuvimos ningún problema con la zona incluso por la noche. Aunque quizás no es para todos los gustos, pero no nos ocurrió nada.
El precio, es caro. Pero los hoteles en todo Nueva York son caros, así que dentro del rango de precios, es correcto (de aquí las 4 estrellas).

title: Nice Little Hotel in Chinatown
text:
Conveniently located hotel a short walk from many good restaurants in Chinatown, as well as Grand Street & East Broadway subway stations for traveling further afield. Also for walking over the Manhattan or Brooklyn bridges.
Staff are super helpful, even providing a well curated list of local restaurants, coffee shops, etc. Wouldn't have known to try the Michaeli Bakery or Vanessa's Dumplings without the recommendation.
Rooms are compact, but clean & functional.

title: Perfect Hotel for 4 Day Getaway!
text: Felt super safe, location was really central (subway station around the corner)  and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Luggage storage on day of checkout was especially helpful.  Thank you for a great stay, Hotel Mimosa!

title: Well-equipped and comfortable place to stay
text:
Cozy and comfortable bed, well-equipped and they give a list of recommendations for places to eat in the nearby area.
It's very easy to move through the city as there are multiple Subway lines close to it.

title: Super for a short stay
text:
What a find! For us Brits, hotel prices are crazy in NYC so this was a gem, still expensive mind you. The rooms are small but ok for a very short stay. The staff, location and cleanliness are A+
We loved the local restaurants and the general feel and smells of Chinatown. Keep the good work up Mimosa!

title: Great hotel to stay in!
text: Great hotel! Stayed in the hotel for 5 nights; room was a good size for Manhattan and was clean. There was access to hot water and utensils which was helpful. Close to great food in Chinatown! It is near the Manhattan Bridge/subway so there is some noise and would not be recommended for light sleepers -- I personally did not find an issue. Would definitely stay again; great value for what I got.

title: Great choice on Lower East Side -- walk to Chinatown & Little Italy and beyond
text: Very rapid & welcoming reception desk.  We booked directly by phoning the reception desk about two weeks in advance to avoid "booking.com" type fees.  The reception staff recommended a nearby parking garage, and offer a $5 stamp/sticker to reduce your $45/day rate to $40 which is a good deal on the Lower East Side.  (parking attendants very professional, and the garage is quite clean)  We found the mattress & goose down quilt very high quality.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  Even though you're practically below the entrance ramp to the Manhattan Bridge, the double window panes meant we slept like babies.  Room was sparkling clean, and everything was in great working condition.  Apparently a full renovation took place about seven years ago, so everything is in good condition.

title: Will stay here again
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed in Hotel Mimosa for a short trip in early October. We wanted a safe, clean place in Chinatown and Hotel Mimosa ended up being perfect for us. It had everything we needed for a short two night stay and was within short walking distance of every restaurant we wanted to eat at in Chinatown, as well as a convenient distance from the subway stops. I was worried about noise from outside but our room was soundproofed so well that it wasn't a problem.

All of the staff was very friendly. I appreciated that even though check in wasn't until 4pm and we arrived around noon to see if we could drop off our bags, they already had the room ready for us and allowed us to check in early. It was really nice to be able to drop off our bags and rest up a bit after traveling. They also had an extensive list of places to eat in Chinatown, and although my boyfriend had a list of restaurants to eat at, we still discovered new places on the list and ate at several restaurants solely due to the hotel recommendation. Additionally, once we checked out and were at the airport, my boyfriend discovered he left an item at the hotel room. After calling the hotel, they were able to find the item and ship it back to us.

We will definitely stay at Hotel Mimosa the next time we travel to Manhattan.

title: Love this hotel
text: We love this hotel. The rooms are small but very clean, and the staff is so positive, friendly and helpful; check out the five handout of places for breakfast, coffee, and dinner. Prefer the corner rooms on upper floors. The neighborhood nearby is gritty but super interesting: Chinatown, Lower East Side, Bowery, Soho, Village are all nearby. Art galleries everywhere.

title: Best value for money in NYC hotels
text: We have stayed in hundreds upon hundreds of hotels. And several in NYC.  This is by far for the price and size one of the best. They have done minimalist the best.  As expected the room is tiny. But has everything you need to be comfortable. Luxuriously soft towels. Comfortable bed and pillows. Only thing missing is top sheet for when too hot.  A small desk with lamp and charging station. Lots of room for toiletries in bathroom. A ceiling heater in bathroom and great showerhead.  Amenities included. A handy little unit to hang things snd store small bags.  And a bedside reading light. The double windows keep all of the street noise out. Even the trains. Only thing missing is a full length mirror.

title: Mininalism at its best
text: Minimalism at its best. I would have given 5 stars but took away one star for insufficient flow of water in shower. Otherwise good stay. Quieter than expected knowing there's a train track runs parallel to hotel.

title: Give us the gist of your experience
text: The pillows are the fluffiest I've ever seen... Nice, kind, polite personnel, clean room, cool spot under the bridge, loose non-american vibe. al close as possible to the best bars and chinese restaurants.

title: Good value for money
text: This review is based on the 'superior queen' room. The staff is friendly, the room was clean and the bathroom was good. Although the room is situated across from the elevated metro tracks, the room is sound-proofed to the point that there is almost no outside noise perceptible in the room.

title: Clean, quiet, gem in china town
text: The staff is so nice.  The hotel was really clean.  It’s honestly a gem in china town.  When they renovated it looks like they double insulated the rooms to keep it quiet.  There is like a 7 inch gap between 2 windows.  Great idea!

title: TOP!
text:
Super accueil, personnel très sympathique, aimable et à l’écoute ! 
L’emplacement de l’hôtel est super, à 25-30min max de tous les endroits importants de NY! Je recommande fortement ! Un super hôtel pour passer un très bon séjour !

title: Pleasant Stay
text: I had a very pleasant experience at Hotel Mimosa. They accommodated a slightly early check in, which was most appreciated. I found the beds to be comfortable, and the room was very clean. I liked the location, right in the heart of Chinatown, and even with the train running outside the windows, the room was quiet.

title: Chinatown Gem
text:
What a wonderful surprise! Hotel Mimosa is that perfect budget hotel - simple, clean, safe and with wonderful staff. When I arrived I was greeted with lots of information about neighborhood restaurants which was great because Chinatown can feel overwhelming! 

It’s perfected located for a lower Manhattan experience plus there is easy access to get up to midtown and uptown. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Nice hotel
text: Clean and Nice hotel in the Middle of chinatown. Good bed, a small room but enough if you only sleep there. Good pillows and sheets. Very nice staff that is helpfull. No good restaurants nearby but you can walk a little but and find good ones.

title: Una estancia perfecta!
text: Una estancia maravillosa. Es un hotel modesto en la zona de chinatown. Las habitaciones son pequeñitas pero con todo lo necesario para tener una buena estancia en NY. La ubicación es estupenda y con buena comunicación de metro para llegar a cualquier parte. El personal muy amable y atento. Muy recomendable

title: Very Good Experience
text: Great spot in Chinatown and very close to many great food spots. Hotel staff was friendly and rooms were very clean! Also pretty good soundproofing, as we could not really hear the subway or street noise while we were inside.

title: Great hotwl
text: We were very happy with our stay at Hotel Mimosa.  Staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, and most importantly room was very clean.  Check in and check out very both easy.  Would recommend to anyone and would stay again.

title: Great location, cheap accommodation
text: Very clean modern room, amazing customer service, greeted every time we walked in and out and printed off show tickets. Location wise: two subway stations very close by (grand st 7 mins, east broadway 6 mins) walking distance to cafes and breakfast (Russ and daughters, golden diner),found it quite affordable for manhattan

title: Excellent séjour !
text:
Nous avons séjourné plusieurs nuits à l'hôtel Mimosa. Le personnel a été très accueillant. Dès notre arrivée, plusieurs documents nous ont été donnés avec des recommandations de visites et de restaurants, ce qui nous a beaucoup plus.

En ce qui concerne la chambre, celle-ci avait un petit dressing ce qui nous a permis de ranger nos affaires. La salle de bain était plutôt spacieuse. Notre chambre donnait côté rue mais nous n'avons pas été embêté une seule fois par la circulation. La chambre était bien insonorisée. Nous avons fortement apprécié qu'il y ait la clim vu les chaleurs qu'il y avait dans New York !

L'hôtel est très bien situé: à 4mn à pied de Grand Street et 5/6mn de East Broadway, ce qui nous a permis de nous déplacer très facilement !

Au sous-sol, plusieurs équipements sont mis à disposition, que nous n'avons pas forcément utilisés mais qui sont pratiques comme un réfrigérateur. Nous avons pu laisser nos bagages ne bagagerie le jour du départ ce qui nous a permis de faire encore quelques visites avant notre train.

Le rapport qualité / prix est très bien. Je vous recommande fortement cet hôtel pour un séjour en couple. Nous reviendrons y séjourner avec grand plaisir !

title: Gran viaje
text:
Habiacion pequeña, te realizan la limpieza diaria. Cama comoda.
El baño con todos los complementos.
Buena insonorizacon. Aunque pase el metro por el puente Manhatan.
Buena atencion.
El barrio (chinatown) un poco sucio.
Para comer precios economicos.
Buena comunicacion en metro con todo manhatan.
Repetiria

title: Great stay!
text: We had a wonderful time at Hotel Mimosa. The rooms are very clean and they have enough space. The location is great: Close to the subway and to Chinatown. We used the list we got during check-in to find restaurants and cafés in the area and they were all amazing. We will definitely come back!

title: Lives Up to Its Ranking
text: How can a simple three-star hotel that charges less than $200 for a queen room be the 14th highest-ranked hotel in New York City? By keeping its rooms clean and functioning, by being welcoming and conscientious hosts, and by charging half the price for what any other Manhattan hotel would charge for the same level of service. Plus, the location, right in Chinatown and next door to Little Italy, is a bit gritty, but it's got all kinds of colors and flavors and the restaurant options are as good as you'd think they would be. This place is a hole-in-the-wall gem appropriate for a neighborhood with many hole-in-the-wall gems.

title: Best value in NYC, relatively.
text:
I gave this 5 stars based on relativity. For Manhattan, NYC. The room is quite big. And has a private bathroom, with toiletries provided. Other hotels in Manhattan are more expensive and have a shared bathroom and smaller room. It's clean and professionally ran. And the price was very fair. 
If you are just arriving in NYC for the first time though, you will probably be a bit shocked. The room is tiny compared to normal hotels and there is nothing glamorous about the hotel at all. But as I said, it's all relative, and for value, you will not find a better place to stay than this. I give 5 stars based on value here.

title: Hidden Gem! Seriously - Stay Here.
text: Finding a hotel in Manhattan without having to sell your kidneys is almost impossible. This hotel is an exception. It's clean, well organized, well decorated, the staff is amazing, and the location is a great launch point for basically anywhere. We kept trying to find a catch but there isn't one. The room is very small but that was expected. There is enough room to walk all the way around the bed, a small desk, clothes rack, and a relativity generous bathroom (full tub!). Everyone else at the wedding we were attending spent at least twice as much on their hotel. They were all jealous. We'll be back. Thank you!

title: Great Getaway!
text: Great hotel and staff! Room was perfect for a getaway in New York. Very reasonable price. Right in the middle of Chinatown. Local markets a step away from front door. Very quiet at night. Overall great experience, and plan to stay again.

title: Bonne solution
text:
C'était notre deuxième séjour dans cet hôtel (le premier en 2018). Les chambres bien que peu spacieuses sont bien insonorisées et la literie est impeccable. La salle de bains est bien achalandée et le tout est très propre.
La mise à disposition d'une pièce au sous-sol équipée de couverts à usage unique avec un micro ondes, un frigo et un évier est bien pratique pour éviter de devoir prendre des repas à l'extérieur. Depuis 2018 les prix ont énormément augmentés à NY. Ne soyez pas surpris que bien que vous ayez versé un acompte, qu'on vous réclame la totalité de votre séjour à votre arrivée... Le personnel est discret et courtois mais la machine Nespresso disponible gratuitement pour la clientèle a disparu (snif).

title: Great
text:
Wonderful staff, great location, sound proof windows.
Make sure you try out their recommended restaurants. They are amazing and suitable for every budget. Ranging from delicious hole in the wall snack places to Michelin star awarded restaurants. These recommendations give you an inn to the real NY experience, which made our trip!

title: Ottimo soggiorno
text:
Sono stata solo due notti, ma sono stata davvero bene! 
Staff gentile e disponibile: mi hanno consegnato una mappa dei dintorni ed una lista di luoghi di interesse e dove mangiare (colazione, pranzo e cena). 
La camera era pulitissima; un po’  piccolina, ma per una persona sola è stata più che sufficiente.
Bagno super fornito con asciugamani, prodotti per la doccia (shampoo, balsamo e bagnoschiuma), phon, dentifricio, spazzolino, lametta, pettine e crema per il corpo. 
L’unica “pecca” è che si trova molto vicino alla metropolitana e quindi si sentiva rumore, ma dopo un po’ ci si fa l’abitudine e dopo una certa ora, la sera, passano pochissimo treni.
Posizione ottima, vicino alle stazioni della metropolitana, al ponte di Brooklyn, a Little Italy, Soho ed alla zona del World Trade Center e Wall Street, raggiungibili tranquillamente anche a piedi in una ventina di minuti.
Lo consiglierei e, se dovessi tornare a Manhattan, perché no, potrei anche soggiornare nuovamente.
Rapporto qualità/prezzo ottimo.

title: Great stay
text:
Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Mimosa! The front desk staff are courteous and professional. Helped me store my bags until check in. Convenient location to all of Chinatown and Lower East Side with easy access to subways and buses. Bed and bathroom were clean. Room was quiet and had ample amenities. A/C is centrally controlled however the temperature was always comfortable even in the summer heat. Elevators were quick. Vending machines, ice and hot water is available.

Would definitely stay here again on my next trip!

title: Great experience
text: Enjoyed the stay at Hotel Mimosa! Very welcoming and helpful staff; we corresponded before my arrival to confirm 4am check in and replies came pretty quickly. Hotel is clean and rooms seem renovated. However, the room was very small and all you could do is hang out in bed. Otherwise, room was clean, stylish and had good quality tv! There is a common area with microwave, kettle, fridge (just mark your food), and even w/d ($$). Location is great: 5 min walk to Subway; a lot of sightseeings in walkable distance. All you need as a tourist! Would definitely consider for a stay again!

title: Great Value
text: Great hotel, had all the necessities I needed and was very clean. The only slight thing was the area, which was not a big issue since there was a subway 8 mins away. Would definitely stay there again!

title: Buona scelta ma...
text: È stata una buona scelta per 4 giorni data la vicinanza alle metro. La camera però era piccola, l'hotel inoltre non dispone di un servizio bar né di una coffee station. La zona di Chinatown di sera non è proprio un granché. Staff cortese e disponibile.

title: Lovely, clean, wecloming hotel for a trip with friends
text:
The Mimosa was a lovely place to stay for a trip with friends to NYC. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to other people I know. 
The price was very competitive compared to hotels at a similar level - but what made this place worth it was its excellent standards and wonderful service. We had a warm and genuine welcome on arrival, and each time we returned.  The hotel is spotlessly clean, modern, and well maintained. The bedlinen and towels were clean and good quality. A selection of toiletries was provided and it was nice to have the room serviced each day - something I've noticed is becoming rarer, post-covid.
While the rooms are not large, they are comparable to European city hotels and others I've stayed in in NYC. 
The hotel is situated in bustling Chinatown and there are restaurants, breakfast places and bars all in walking distance. It felt safe and as others have commented, despite being direct neighbours with Manhattan railway Bridge, you can hear NOTHING inside the hotel!  
One thing to keep in mind - the illuminated front entrance is actually on Eldridge Street, at the intersection with Division Street so our taxi driver had difficulty (no GPS / satnav). You might want to check the map before arrival.

title: Great Place tò stay!!!!
text: Great experience here! The receptionists are really nice and helpful. The position of the hotel Is very convenient:you are in the Heart of Soho!!! The location Is lovely, the room very confortabile and there Is. An area with microwave, fridge and vending machine:It Is a good service of you wanna eat somethimg or of you have tò wait for your room. I deeply reccommend the Place!!!

title: Nice place
text: Well placed, clean room, confortable bed, good and efficient windows, excellent commodity, nice welcome; people are very friendly and helpful… it is a perfect place for a stay in NYC! I recommend it+++

title: Friendly, welcoming, clean
text: We had a great experience staying here! The recommendations were amazing, and the staff were so welcoming. The area and so many great spots to eat and was easy to walk to SoHo and nearby subway stations. Our flight also got delayed and they let us keep our luggage there while we got to explore the city more. Overall, an amazing stay!

title: Great Experience at Mimosa!
text: Nice establishment for Chinatown area.  Very friendly staff and clean rooms.  Couldn’t have asked for better experience! Loved their recommendations for places to eat and front desk clerks were super helpful.  Will definitely stay here again if I ever go back to NYC.

title: Great Place!
text:
Hotel was in the perfect location to explore Chinatown and close to metros to explore various parts of NYC.
Hotel staff was extremely courteous & friendly, plus they provide guests with several lists of restaurants  to visit, if you didn’t do your research ahead of time. Definitely recommend Hotel Mimosa! I will be coming back to stay here.

title: Great value and location
text: Hotel Mimosa is conveniently placed in Chinatown, only a few blocks from the heart of the area. The service was delightful and the staff expedited a room clean since I showed up an hour and a half early. The staff was courteous, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area, even going so far as to provide print-outs with recommended restaurants! The rooms are small but quiet and cool which was a godsend considering the average temperature was 95 degrees during my stay. A small fridge for the room would've been nice but the rooms are small enough as is and I don't think they can accommodate a mini-fridge. For a solo weekend trip, I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: Great small hotel. Very good pricing, polite and helpful staff and quiet and comfortable basic rooms. Located in Chinatown, one of New York City's still iconic neighborhoods with easy subway access to the rest of the city.

title: Convenient Stay
text:
Great location near subway and eateries. The room I stayed in and bathroom that I used was a fine size for a solo traveler with enough space. For the most part it was neat and tidy. There were some small stains in the carpet and on one of my towels, but to me they were negligible. One of my towels had a strong smell of bleach, but this was not really a big concern to me either. I do think that if I had asked, the staff would have switched it out.

The staff at the front desk were very friendly and accommodating. You can feel that they really want to make your stay great and try their best to meet your expectations. I was given many lists of great eateries in the area. They varied in price and had a lot of variety.

My room faced the road and Manhattan bridge. You can tell the hotel has put in efforts to greatly reduce the noise. For those who have no trouble sleeping with a fan or AC on, there should be no problem with the noise level. For light sleepers, the rumbling from the train will be noticeable.

The hotel runs on central air so you cannot entirely control the temperature of your room. There is a remote control for additional fans but no way to raise the temperature besides wearing more clothing yourself.

There is a shared space with microwave, vending machine, hot water and cups, and refrigerator at the lower level. The space is kept neat and clean.

Overall a really great experience to stay at this hotel and I do think I would return.

title: Wonderful stay at this very charming hotel!
text: The Hotel Mimosa was a wonderful surprise right here in New York City! The staff is the friendliest we’ve encountered and we super accommodating. They made us feel like family from the moment we walked in. We needed to store our bags before check in and they were so friendly about it. They even have a great list of all their favorite restaurants in the area with details about what items the’ r enjoyed personally. The room was very clean and nice with smart TV so we could access our Netflix account which was great after a long day of walking around. We will definitely be excited to come back and see our new friends at the Hotel Mimosa.

title: Loved the Mimosa
text: We stayed here for a couple nights. Warm and friendly staff, very quiet and nice, clean, cozy room. No coffee makers or microwave but they have a little vending area in the basement with a microwave, hot water dispenser and a cooler for storing leftovers. It's also in a great location--right in Chinatown within walking distance to everything. We decided to stay an extra night! The Mimosa is very affordable in comparison to other hotels in Manhattan, which is definitely a plus. We will certainly be returning.

title: Everything you need on a business trip
text: Right in the heart of Chinatown, this hotel offers everything you need on a business trip. Simple room but very comfortable beds and lovely linen. Toiletries in case you forget yours… which happens! Mostly it’s the warm, friendly staff that make this place great!

title: Lille, fint værelse
text:
Lille værelse (men det ved man jo)  - der er, hvad man skal bruge. Fint badeværelse med ny bruser. Vandet var nemt at justere og trykket var ganske fint. 

Meget lidt støj i forhold til, at man bor i midten af Chinatown og lige ved siden af både vej og togbane.

Personalet var søde og hjælpsomme.

title: Quiet boutique hotel in the heart of Chinatown
text: Incredibly courteous staff that helped me with everything I needed. The rooms are clean, quiet, and very comfortable, and the area is filled with amazing food, including some delicious late night options. Next time I'm back in NYC, I'll be checking availability here. Highly recommend!

title: Une super expérience.
text:
Pour notre première fois à New-York mon copain et moi cherchions un hôtel pas trop chère et un minimum accueillant avec de bons commentaires. 

Le Mimosa est un des rares qui cochaient ses cases, et avec raison ! 

Nous avons passés un excellent séjour, le personnel est accueillant et très serviable, la chambre très propre et toujours très bien nettoyé. 

Le patron est également une des qualités de cet hôtel, sa gentillesse comme les autres employés et surtout sa polyvalence car il parle plusieurs langues. Dont le Français. 

Bref c’est un sans faute, et nous y retournerons avec plaisir !

title: Fijn en kleinschalig hotel
text:
Klein hotel in China Town met zeer vriendelijke eigenaren. 
Pus: betaalbaar, geen geluidsoverlast, goede bedden en prima douche.
Min: airco is niet in te stellen en maakt veel geluid.
Pus/min: centraal gelegen echter wel rommelige buurt.

title: Fantastic service and lovely rooms
text: Great service, lovely beds and well isolated rooms. This was our first time in New York and we were warmly welcomed by the staff. I had some specific requests the first day and I was immediately helped by them. Also: fresh sheets every day. Highly recommended!

title: Best value in Manhattan
text:
Clean and all essential amenities included. I arrived early morning from airport and received by a courteous young man. He kept my luggage so I can enjoy a Brooklyn food tour. I freshened up at a basement toilet and got some hot water at basement pantry. Unfortunately I got a twin room facing the Manhattan Bridge. The hotel double panel the only window but I could still hear the vibration of the subway throughout the night. 
I was worried about safety at night but luckily too jet lag to want to plan late night outings. I do hear loud shouting outside my window after 2am. The hotel is situated at Main Street, so I do think a safer choice in Chinatown.

title: Basic hotel
text: Room was clean but so small it only had room for a night table on one side. Room is quiet but if you open the window for fresh air it is noisy. No fridge, coffee or tea in room. This is hotel at its most basic. They do give you a toothbrush though which in my hotel experience is unusual.

title: A European Boutique Feel in the Heart of Chinatown
text: First and foremost, everyone at the front desk is exceptional (shout out to David and William!), answering questions about the subway, printing out information, giving us lists of nearby restaurants, telling us where we could find a nearby ATM, and ordering a cab as we prepared to live. This is what really sets Hotel Mimosa apart from other places. The rooms are cozy, the beds are comfortable, the shower was excellent, and the price was affordable, considering you are in NYC. Give them a try!

title: Clean, quiet and affordable
text: Although this hotel is right next to the trains on the Manchester Bridge, our room which was facing the bridge was so insulated, we could barely hear it--a very quiet and clean room. The room and bathroom are not so very tiny as expected. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. We liked where this is located, with a lot of small shops and restaurants. Our room did not have a refrigerator or coffee pot, nor does the hotel offer coffee. They do have a shared refrigerator in the basement. This hotel is a great balance between affordability and quality. We intend to stay here again in the future.

title: Simple et efficace
text:
Bien situé (très) proche du métro 
Quartier plutôt sécurisant toujours du monde
Chambre optimisée mais hyper fonctionnelle 
Propre
Accueil super très agréable et serviable
Clim centralisée à fond quand on est arrivés on a demandé gentiment de baisser un peu ce qui a été fait 
Conseils restau et petit dej au top

title: A decent hotel
text: It's a clean, safe and decent place to stay for a weekend trip to New York.  It's no frill hotel-no coffee, mini fridge or microwave in rooms.  Friendly staff is a plus.  It's also very quiet.  Plenty of restaurants in the area(Chinatown).

title: Clean and Tidy Room
text: The room was absolutely amazing, it was small but that didn’t matter, we were there to sleep and relax. Everything was very clean and nicely put together. I would definitely love to stay here again next time I am in town. The front desk worker was very friendly and gave us a list of restaurants in the area for breakfast, coffee, restaurants and dim sum. Great recommendations and there is a boba shop right next door for a quick drink.

title: The greatest littlest hotel in New York
text:
Staff: friendly and welcoming, provided some great places to eat and also provided us with a fan when our room got a bit too warm.

Room: we stayed in room 303, it was small, it was clean and had everything needed for a comfortable stay.  The windows are double glazed to reduce noise and the air conditioning is centralised so you cannot modify this in your room.  Ask the front desk for a fan if you want to control your room temperature as opening the windows with NYC noise isn't a good option.

Location: right on the edge of China Town, next to the Manhattan Bridge, easily in walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry, Financial District and World Trade Centre.  For further afield, you'll find Grand St and East Broadway Subways within short walk from the hotel.

Whilst the hotel is not in a picturesque location, it felt safe and was an excellent affordable option for such a great location on Manhatten island.

I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, we had a great 5 night stay and a wonderful time exploring NYC from here.

title: One glass of (Hotel) Mimosa please.
text: Went to NYC with my gf for 5 days. Our stay at Hotel Mimosa was all that we needed thanks to its location, price point, quality and friendly staff. Its price is great for NYC and its location is superb, close to Brooklyn and between two major subway lines. The beds were comfortable (a little warm) and the room, though small, was everything you could ask for. Only complaint would be that the walls are incredibly thin.. service from the staff was phenomenal as well :) Would stay here again

title: A Gem in NYC Chinatown!
text: We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Mimosa this past weekend! The staff were so kind to us and the hotel is immaculate. The king room was on the small side but it had a comfy bed, a bathtub which my British husband prefers to a shower and a great city view of the bridge. It’s a very cool part of Chinatown to wake up in for sure! The manager gave us lists of hole in the wall places and new finds - he used to be a chef and is a local in the meighborhood so these were NOT tourist traps. We are so grateful to him for giving away those lists. We knew a few of the places already but this gives us way more to explore in the future. We love, love, love Hotel Mimosa!

title: Great Value, Great Hotel
text: My partner and I were in town for a wedding and chose Hotel Mimosa for its reasonable price compared to others in NYC, and I'm very happy that we did.  The person at the front desk is extremely welcoming and very kind. The room was on the small side, but it was immaculate and thoughtfully decorated to maximize the space.  The bathroom included two toothbrushes and single-use toothpastes.  The hotel happily provided us with an iron and full-size ironing board so that we could press our clothes for the wedding.  The next time I need a hotel in this area, I will 100% return to Mimosa.

title: Simple mais efficace
text: Petit hôtel simple mais efficace dans chinatown  qui contre tout attente est très bobo mais accessible en terme de prix . Chambre propre literie confortable salle de bain bien équipée personnel sympathique et accueillant . A 5 minutes à pied du pont de Brooklyn et du métro avec ligne direct vers les principaux quartiers attractif . Dommage qu’il ne propose pas de petit déjeuner mais on trouve facilement dans le quartier

title: Piacevole soggiorno!
text: Piacevole soggiorno. Posizione comoda per visitare la città, vicino all’hotel si trova la fermata della metro . Nei dintorni numerosi ristoranti e bar per la colazione. Camere piccole ma pulite e silenziose. Personale molto disponibile e gentile. Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo, Lo consigliamo!

title: Good experience :)
text: We arrived late at night, the guy at the desk was super friendly and set us up with the room. The room was basic and not to big but clean and everything we needed was present. For the price (relatively speaking, i mean it is New York), definitely great value.

title: Pleasantly surprised! Amazing staff!
text: David was the best! We arrived early (about 2hours prior to check in time) and one of the rooms was ready and the other two shortly after! They give recommendations for everything in the area which is fantastic! Perfect location for exploring on foot! 15 min walk max to all the places we wanted to hit! The train is across the street but barely heard it because of the sound proofing. The rooms are small but perfect in my opinion! VERY CLEAN and I’m a clean freak. I was pleasantly surprised at how accommodating and helpful all the staff was with us being noobs to NY! The shower pressure and hot water amazed my fellow travelers! We will be coming back and appreciate the tremendous service! Very budget friendly!

title: Quick weekend getaway in a great hotel
text: We stayed for a quick weekend getaway. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very clean hotel with nice decor in busy Chinatown. They were happy yo hold out luggage before and after checkout.  The restaurant recommdations were so helpful. Rooms were pretty quiet despite being across the street from the Manhattan bridge. Great location near subways and a short walk to Lower East side. Lots of great local food within blocks. We will return!

title: Choisi cet hôtel !
text:
Un hôtel tout d’abord très bien situé. 
Le personnel est extrêmement gentil et à répondu à toutes nos demandes sans aucun problèmes et avec rapidité. (Encore merci) 
La chambre pour deux personnes avec salle de bain privative est très propre. La chambre est très bien insonorisée, j’ai extrêmement bien dormi. 
Je vous recommande vivement cet hôtel donc la qualité / prix est parfaite !

title: Perfect stay in the middle of Chinatown, NYC
text:
We stayed for 6 nights, and it was great! Though check in time is supposed to be early evening, we were able to drop off our bags at the front desk around 11AM - giving us plenty of time to wander around Chinatown for delicious food. The room is very small; as soon as you walk in, there is a desk against the immediate wall, a queen size bed that takes up the majority of the room, a flat screen TV opposite the bed, and a bathroom. We did not mind this at all since our days were spent exploring, and the hotel room served as a place to sleep and shower. The bathroom had bottles of shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and hand soap for guests to continue using, which was GREAT - LOVE the eco-friendly mindset with that. The hotel is right across the Manhattan Bridge, so you will hear the subway come through multiple times. With the windows closed, it honestly sounded like an AC unit hum. We even slept with the windows open a few nights to cool off, and the sound really didn't bother us. The staff were also super kind and had six lists of places to check out nearby. It was really a great experience.

Our only con: those pillows are pretty cheap. They are thin and feather-filled. We had to stack two to sleep on. Though doable, it was not ideal.

title: Highly Recommend!
text: My stay (2nd time) was fantastic! The staff is very welcoming and the hotel itself has a nice, cozy vibe at a great price point. I also left my crocs in the room and they even noticed I left it before I got home and had it mailed out the same day. Awesome hotel and staff and I highly recommend anyone reading this to give it a try!

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Stayed for three nights with a friend and had a lovely time. It’s cute, modern, and clean. The room was on the smaller side, but we didn’t mind that at all. The bathroom was quite large and the water pressure in the shower as well as the sink was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a bit hot one night (there aren’t individual heating/cooling units in each room) so I asked the front desk manger if he would mind turning the heat down a bit, and he happily obliged. Don’t let the location frighten you; although it’s right next to the Brooklyn Bridge it was actually the quietest location I’ve ever stayed when visiting the city. No honking cars, loud music or screaming drunk people. There is also a subway stop in close walking proximity, so getting around Manhattan and the other boroughs is quite easy. They provided a ton of food etc. recommendations and we had a great cup of coffee at a local spot on their list. The day we were leaving we had a few things to do before getting our car and they allowed us to keep our luggage downstairs while we ran a couple of errands. I will definitely come back and would certainly recommend to any friends. Thank you to the staff at Hotel Mimosa for our enjoyable stay. :)

title: Very Good！
text:
Cozy Hotel with Excellent Value

Having booked here before, I am pleased that my stay has always been consistent in this tiny fantastic hotel.
Room is cozy, with a large-sized bathroom. 
The whole staff here is excellent, sincere, and well meaning in their services.
There’s no hotel designer label here, but it’s arguably one of best in New York with a great cultural vibe.

title: Excellent Value For NYC
text:
Was in NYC for a conference and was looking to avoid the Midtown markup. Hotel Mimosa provides a clean, quiet room, great wifi, and friendly staff at the front desk. Being located in the Chinatown/LES area, the food options nearby are second to none, and access to transit is nice and easy. Really tough to beat it at its price point.

A few other nice touches: The in-room provided toiletries include small packets of toothpaste, which is huge for me, as that is the item I most often forget. At check-in guests are provided with multiple pages of restaurant recommendations, which is very helpful.

Shall I split a couple of hairs? It's an older building with centrally-controlled HVAC, so you do need to call the front desk for AC adjustments. It's close enough to Manhattan Bridge, that some rooms may get some train noise. 

Highly recommended for a solo business traveler on a budget

title: Clean and cozy Chinatown hotel with lovely staff. Recommended.
text: Excellent choice in Chinatown. Room is spotless clean, bed is very comfortable. Excellent bathroom amenities. Receptionist was very accommodating with check-in time and communication. Staff is efficient and very friendly.

title: Treated like a Criminal
text:
Unfortunately, they don't clarify in their policies that any and all adults must provide ID for them to copy and record. This was an issue for us and we were told that even though the reservation holder provided ID at check in as is clearly stated, any and all other adults (maybe they extend this to children too?) were not allowed to enter without going through this process.

Staff was unhelpful and it was unclear if they understood the nuance of the issue. Hope they clarify this policy.

title: Best deal in NYC you’ll ever get
text:
I can’t believe how amazing of a deal this place was. The room IS tiny but it has everything we needed - clean place to sleep, shower, safe, decently quiet, and a TV w/ Netflix. Right in Chinatown and was close to so many great places to eat. 

The staff is absolutely friendly and so accommodating, plus you can’t beat a 12pm noon check out time (we reallly needed it). Plus they gave us detailed lists of where to go and eat, things to see. Held our luggage on checkout day so we could explore some more. Really wonderful people that made our stay that much better.

We stayed for 3 nights but wished we stayed longer.

I am floored about the price and I can’t wait to come back and stay again!

title: Perfect stay
text:
Fantastic hotel with friendly staff, great location, and clean rooms. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be coming back. 

Bonus features
- five pane windows that completely drown out the sound of the subway
- the hotel has a list of recommended restaurants in the area. Highly highly recommend you ask for a copy!

title: Shanghai meets New York
text: I have some Chinese background and as I was researching for a Hotel in New York/Manhatten, I found this beautiful spot. I stood for 5 days and it was an amazing experience. The staff was super helpful and I had the chance to - at least - refresh my Chinese a little bit. I did a lot of walking to get an real impression of the city and the people. But public transportation is also around the corner. So, again just perfect. I will come back and stay for sure in this very charming, authentic and super located place. 谢谢你的款待, Roberto

title: Perfect for overnight stays
text: Attended and event a few blocks away at Sour Mouse and needed a nearby hotel to crash. Don't think I could've found anything better. Incredibly cost effective, clean, extras in the bathroom, comfortable bed. Minimal city noise from outside. Friendly staff. Definitely will come back if I need a room in NYC.

title: My new regular spot in New York
text: I stayed at Hotel Mimosa for a week and it will now be my regular spot when I go to New York. The staff is the friendliest I have had the pleasure of experiencing. They provided a list of all the great spots to eat at in the area. The rate is great. The location is perfect. It’s just outside of soho but in walking distance to so much. I hate spending a lot on hotels because when I travel I like to explore the area and the hotel is really just a place to sleep - Hotel Mimosa is perfect for that. The rooms are a decent size the beds were very comfortable and despite being right near the bridge the windows did a great job keeping the noise out. The only con is that you don’t have control over the temperature in your room. I stayed in February so a cracked window kept the room cool but not sure what it would be like in the summer. I would/will 100% stay again.

title: Charming boutique hotel
text: This was our first trip to Chinatown, and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff were attentive and polite, and answered every question. They even provided lists of locals only restaurants, breakfast spots, coffee joints, and upscale dining. The manager is a charming gentleman who made us feel welcome. If you arrive early, the hotel will store your luggage so you can explore. The room was clean and comfortable - and the hotel provides toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors and lotion - something you don't usually find. Despite being next to the Manhattan Bridge, the hotel's soundproofing allows you to sleep well. I can't recommend Hotel Mimosa enough!

title: Best value hotel in Mew York
text: Clean, comfortable, and with a helpful and friendly staff. Almost too good to be true for $85 in NYC, even if it was off season in February. And there are little things, like being handed upon checking in 4 pages of great restaurants, good breakfast places, and hidden eateries, and extra windows to help block the noise from Manhattan Bridge. Other than being out of Diet Coke in the vending machine, no complaints about this budget gem.

title: Best Stay & Friendly Staff
text: This place was reasonable priced and super clean! Staff was so friendly and helpful during our stay. Also very welcoming at check in and again at check out.  Room was on the smaller side by super cozy with a comfortable bed, tv, desk, and coat rack. I highly recommend staying here while visiting NYC.

title: Fun weekend trip!
text: My brother and I went to NYC for a few days. We needed a quiet space to sleep that's close to everything. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is about a 7min walk from the subway. Very close to everything. We loved staying in Chinatown and got some great food. The employees were super hospitable and helpful. I’ll be back next time I come to NYC.

title: Great location and Clean room
text: The room is super clean and decent. The hotel is located in Chinatown; super convenient. If you like Asian food, this is the greatest place to stay. Overall it has very high value. I would definitely visit this place again!!

title: Another very comfortable stay at Hotel Mimosa
text: This was my fourth stay at Hotel Mimosa and it didn't disappoint. As other reviewers noted, despite the proximity to the bridge, outside noise is kept to a minimum due to excellent soundproofing. The bed is very comfortable; the bathroom is large, and the location is handy to many Lower East Side and other downtown attractions. Most importantly, the hotel team is super friendly and helpful, providing printed lists of restaurants and other nearby attractions.

title: Cheery Chinatown Hotel  :-)
text: Great location on LES in busy & bustling Chinatown. Easy walking distance to Asian Restaurants and also to Little Italy. Clean motel and rooms had all we needed. "Cheap as chips" cafe across the road for coffee & snacks. Hotel staff very pleasant. We loved our stay in Chinatown and would stay at this hotel again.

title: 10/10 perfect stay
text: This place was perfect for our weekend new years getaway! Upon checking in, the welcoming guy at the front desk gave us lists of recommendations of places to eat around Chinatown (and everything we tried was fantastic). The hotel is located right near the Manhattan bridge but the soundproofing is so good you can't even tell until you look outside the window. The room is compact but clean. The hot water gets really hot and our bathroom also had a heat lamp on a timer which was perfect for showering (the bathroom has a tub shower so if you wanted to take a bath you could do that too). There was even a portable floor heater in the room in case you want it to get toasty at night. The hotel is also conveniently located next to multiple bus lines and is just 2 blocks away from the East Broadway subway station.  Also they'll hold your bags if you check out and need a place to keep them for a while (checkout is at noon and our bus leaves at 3 so they kept our bags while we went out for lunch). Excellent location, wonderful staff, clean room, perfect stay. Come here and leave a big tip! Thank you Hotel Mimosa!

title: Decent Place But Inflated TripAdvisor Rating
text:
I opted to stay at Hotel Mimosa principally because TripAdvisor rated it as the 5th best hotel based on all travel ratings.  

Here are things I liked:
1. It is located in Chinatown
2. It's a small hotel.
3. The front desk staff are nice and professional
4. The hotel overall and the room specially are clean
5. Decent shower and bathroom
6. I love that much of the clientele itself seemed to be from various parts of East Asia.

Here are things I did not like:
1. The room was very cold. There was no thermostat to adjust the setting. I called the Front Desk to request to warm up the room, but this did not happen.
2. There is no USB outlet to charge the phone by the bed.  The small table at one side of the bed had a telephone but no ports there to charge the phone. I could not find any visible ports or outlets around the bed either. I ended up pulling out the bed in finding one outlet that had connected to the bed's table lamp and using a free outlet there for hooking up my phone's charger.
3. While the TV includes a bunch of streaming channels, I was surprised that none included ESPN.  

As others mentioned, the hotel itself is kitty corner from the Manhattan Bridge. As a result, you feel the continuous vibration from traffic there. The sound itself was low decibel and never interfered with my sleeping.  It was basically akin to brown noise.

title: Hotel Mimosa clean, affordable
text: We stayed a few days and found the room comfortable and clean at a great price. Plenty of breakfast choices within walking distance as we started our day.  Sound insulation kept traffic noise as if a low distant thunder.

title: Amazing stay - Highly recommend!!
text: Hotel Mimosa is amazing!! We stayed for 5 nights during Christmas in New York at Hotel Mimosa and our stay exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was spotless, had every essential needed, a full sized tub shower and a heat lamp in the bathroom. The bed was surprisingly comfortable too. They even have nice sized smart TV's in each room. Wifi is fast and smooth. The location was perfect, such a nice area of Chinatown. The staff at the hotel were incredibly nice and accommodating. You can't beat staying here for all the amazing qualities this hotel has and for the price and location. If I ever travel to Manhattan again I will absolutely be staying here and would recommend it highly to everyone else.

title: Great place for an awesome time in Manhattan
text: Excellent experience at this hotel! Staff is extremely nice and were able to get us in our room as soon as it was ready after our read eye flight. The room was very clean, bed was comfortable, and great shower with toiletries provided. They gave us a list of reco mended restaurants. Location is right in China town and a stones throw away from little Italy. The room had double windows which insulated all sound from outside and was dead quiet but could look out and see all the hustle and bustle of the town. I plan to make this my go to place to stay when in Manhattan. Excellent value and the staff really cares about your experience!

title: Smal but clean rooms, very friendly and professional staff
text: I stayed here for 1 week mid Dec. This is a great value for money hotel. The rooms were small but well equipped and well maintained. I had several requests from the front desk ( like to book a cab to air port and then pick up one of my amazon packages) and they were very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again if I'm visition NY next time.

title: Perfect for a weekend getaway on a budget!
text: Hotel Mimosa was exactly what my fiancé and I needed for a weekend getaway in NYC. Very clean and quiet room, easy check-in and check-out process, and a convenient location to multiple subway stops. Lots of great food option nearby as well.

title: Best staff, great location!
text: We stayed for 5 nights, & loved every second of it! The staff were all super friendly & helpful, & even though we arrived several hours before checkin, they found us a room to get into immediately which was incredibly kind & generous (& if there hadn’t been a room available they still would’ve stored our stuff so we could get out to experience the city). We loved staying in Chinatown! Also the soundproofing & blackout curtains in our room allowed for restful sleep even right by the bridge, which was impressive. They made storing our bags for a few hours after checkout super easy & convenient, & the many pages of recommended nearby establishments was wonderful. We can’t wait til our next stay!

title: Pleasant Stay
text: What a pleasant experience!  The hotel was immaculate and very comfortable.  Staff were pleasant and helpful. Be aware that the accommodations are modest. For instance, there was no refrigerator in the room. The location is great, however, with excellent restaurants nearby and subway stops within short walking distance.  Highly recommended!

title: A Wonderful Little Gem in Chinatown
