text: We absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Mimosa!  From the prompt and courteous check in, to the detailed recommendation sheets (where to go for breakfast, lunch, dinner, coffee, etc.), to the comfortable, cozy, quiet room -- and all the friendly "hello"s and "see you later"s as we came and went daily-- this place is wonderful.  We were very impressed with the nightly quiet hours and firm no smoking policy.  The hotel is small but lovely -- very clean and new-feeling.  It is close to the raised train, which you can hear but it is so muffled by the double insulated windows that, after the first night, you don't notice it at all.  The memory foam beds were like melting into comfort each night.  The TV was very new and afforded hundreds of channels, plus easy connectivity to our Netflix and Prime accounts, among others. The bathroom is quite ample for the small size of the room, with a full shower that was plenty hot and had great pressure to wash off the city after the end of a long day running around, shopping, eating and having fun.  The room is small but most rooms in NYC are small...it's plenty big enough for two people to move around - two twin beds, a small desk and chair, a second chair, two little nightstands each with a light, and a rack to hang clothes and store a small suitcase.  Also had ice bucket, hair dryer, and a very nice assortment of sundries (large pump dispensers of shampoo, conditioner, body wash; lotion, toothpaste, 2 toothbrushes, a shower cap and a razor!)  We were in easy walking distance of all of Chinatown and Little Italy, with many shops and food options, and easy-to-access metro stops nearby.  A couple people had cautioned us to avoid staying in Chinatown, but we found that to be baloney...if you want some bougie, overpriced, overcrowded-with-pushy-tourists experience, go ahead and stay uptown near Times Square (we know -- we did that last year).  But if you are OK with the less flashy parts of NYC, and you want more of a cultural experience, near areas that are more residential, and more off the beaten path, with fabulous Chinese and cannoli nearby, stay here.  It was every bit as nice as a 42nd Street hotel without the high price and heavy tourist presence.  Of course, as in many places in Manhattan, it's best to get back to the hotel at a reasonable time after dark, and stay on the main and well-lit streets, but as two petite middle-aged women on foot, we never felt threatened as there were always people out and about.  The hotel locks down at midnight and you have to have someone let you in after that (show your key to 24-hour front desk person), and we found that very reassuring.  We highly recommend Hotel Mimosa to anyone who wants a very quiet and pleasant experience for a great value!

title: Very Good
text: Very clean rooms.  Bathroom stocked with bath amenities...nice touch.  Staff very friendly, professional, and helpful with recommendations on restaurants. Easy to load/unload luggage/passenger at Hotel's front door without double parking. Garage parking across the street. Would definitely book again.

title: Excellent Experience
text: Excellent!  Perfectly located and very helpful staff.  Quiet due to well insulated windows. Clean and efficient both room and hotel.  The floor we stayed on had a "quiet time" each night which was much appreciated.

title: Great location, great hotel
text: The location is convenient for most standard NYC tourist attractions. The room was clean, quiet, and well heated. The staff was kind and helpful for both me and my friends. The local restaurants were excellent as well.

title: Short visit to Newyork for Holiday and Black Friday shopping
text: Hotel Mimosa treated us as we are one of their family members. Basics, like clean room, a wide double bed, a helpful and friendly reception were there. Do you have a problem? (any!) They solve it. Location is another plus for this hotel.

title: An oasis of calm in the heart of Chinatown.
text: Our family of 4 enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mimosa during Thanksgiving week.  The hotel is an oasis of calm in the heart of Chinatown.  Rooms are small, clean, and efficient.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  The convenient location served as a good base for our exploration of other parts of the city.  If you're looking for a good value without the "bells and whistles" of a large hotel, the Hotel Mimosa is worth your consideration.

title: Fantastic hotel in a great location with brilliant staff
text: This was a really lovely hotel! On arrival, the staff at reception were so warm and welcoming. They provided us with print out sheets of recommendations for places to eat and drink nearby which was really appreciated. It was very clean, quiet and well located near a few metro lines. It was easy to get into the rest of Manhattan or to Brooklyn for exploring. It was also good value for money when compared with the rest of Manhattan. I wasn't expecting the room to be very big, but it was cosy and included a desk, USB power outlets, a place to hang clothes and a view of the skyline.

title: Best NY Hotel Experience!
text: Enjoyed the entire stay very much - the clean quite room, the central location and proximity to a broad selection of restaurants and bars. In addition the staff was always present and attentive, still friendly and helpful. For a single or couple - this is a great option.

title: Great room in a very interesting part of Chinatown
text: Very friendly staff and comfortable bed. The staff provided detailed information on restaurants in the area and discounted parking nearby. The amenities were simple but adequate, and the room was very clean. Lots of hot water and a rather large tub.

title: Fantastic hotel, location and service.
text: This hotel is a complete gem. In the middle of china town you have quick easy access to most of the major sites of New York. Not far from the subway or plenty of great restaurants. The room is comfortable, warm and with a good bathroom with great water pressure. It’s tastefully decorated with very good internet and facilities. What really sets it apart however are the fantastic staff and management who are welcoming, provide a number of recommendations and cant do enough to help you. The are genuinely excellent and we cant recommend this place enough for your stay.

title: Decent hotel in Chinatown
text:
This hotel is very efficiently run, adequate clean room with good shower. Nice amenities, including toothbrush/toothpaste. Very polite and efficient staff.
Hotel right next to Manhattan Bridge, good soundproofing, but my room had a distinct ongoing rumble from the trains on the bridge, you can feel vibrations in the room 24/7. 
You could ask for a room facing away from the bridge. 
The aircondition/heat cannot be controlled from the individual rooms. 
The area is Chinatown, bordering Lower East Side.
There is no coffee/food available at hotel. 
And Chinatown really has no European/American breakfast options with coffee. 
Coffee in lobby or room would be very helpful. 
East Broadway is the closest subway stop, I recommend not getting off at the Madison Street exit, I did not feel safe there in the evening.

title: Great hotel and location
text: If you are spending time in Manhattan and Brooklyn, the location is great.  Rooms are clean and the bathrooms are well stocked. Close to so many great places to eat and see. Def. would go back and stay there again.

title: Very friendly and nice rooms
text:
it was the perfekt location for our NYC Trip newt to the Manhattan and Brookly Bridge. Staff was very helpful.
The aircondition was a little bit too cold, but they tried to change it as soon as possible.

title: The friendliest staff in NYC
text:
Staff are so sweet and helpful. The rooms are small, but what they lack in size, they make up for in heart. Make sure you check out their recommendations for places to eat in Chinatown, they were all spot on! 

Absolutely wonderful stay. I cannot recommend enough.

title: Very pleasant stay!
text: We picked this perfect location as we were scattering our time in the city between Brooklyn and Manhattan.  The hotel room was surprisingly quiet considering it is located across the street from the Manhattan Bridge. The room and bath were modern, clean and very comfortable. And the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. I have already recommended it to friends and will come back the next time I visit.

title: Clean, tidy, and great value
text: Great little boutique hotel on the doorstep of Manhattan bridge. It's surrounded by the rawness and beauty of NYC and the Lower Eastside (Chinatown and Little Italy). The room was small but perfect for a solo or nomad traveller. Comfy bed, good wifi, and the windows were quadruple glazed so the sounds of the metro crossing the bridge were but a soft rumble. The hotel provided me with a huge list of places to eat which was perfect as I had no idea and I had no issue walking around to all the sights from there. The hotel is definitely value for money.

title: Très bon hôtel!
text: J'ai choisi cet hôtel pour ses bonnes notes sur booking et trip advisor et je ne suis pas déçue ! Très bien situé à Chinatown, parfait pour partir à la découverte de la ville. Chambre petite mais propre et fonctionnelle et très bien insonorisée malgré que le quartier soit bruyant. Pas de restaurant mais large choix dans le quartier. Personnel serviable et souriant. Très bon rapport qualité-prix, je recommande!

title: Ideaal voor stellen die wel in Manhattan willen slapen maar niet de hoofdprijs willen betalen.
text:
Goede prijs/kwaliteit verhouding, met name voor Manhattan. Vriendelijke en behulpzame staf.
Basic kamer maar daar is de prijs ook naar.
Comfortabel bed en schone kamer en badkamer. Prettige locatie voor goedkopere horeca voor locals.

title: Clean and professional
text: Lovely, service-minded people at this hotel. Yes, it's right next to the subway, but the sound-proofing is excellent. No insects spotted during a 3-week stay. Only downside is no mini-fridge in the room, but there's a fridge on a separate floor and an ice-bucket system. Shower was nice, never ran out of hot water. 5 minute walk to the subway. TV has apps for Netflix, YouTube & Twitch. Room temperature and ventilation was also good. Don't expect a nice view out the window :)

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Excellent emplacement dans Chinatown… Service excellent… chambre propre et confortable… il manque juste un coffre pour les affaires personnelles.
Le quartier est authentique et on apprécie la liste des restaurants recommandés du quartier…

title: Great find!
text: We chose this hotel for the reviews and location and were very happy that we did. The cozy room had a view of the bridge and we were concerned about the noise but between the great sound proofing of the special windows and the blackout curtains, we slept soundly. Took advantage of the location and access to public transportation to explore Lower East side, East Village, and  other parts of Manhattan. Staff was always helpful and friendly and the owner gave us some very helpful tips for things to see and places to eat. All his recommendations were spot-on!  We will be back!

title: Good location, clean room, friendly staff
text: I stayed in a superior queen room for 4 nights and found it to be very suitable for what I needed.  The staff were great -  we mentioned that our room was a bit chilly and found extra blankets and a space heater on our return.  The recommendations lists were very helpful (yeeaahhh, House of Joy!).  I didn't find the bridge traffic to be very bothersome.  This hotel is great if you're into spending your day exploring the city and want a well-located, clean, secure, and affordable space to return to.

title: Thoroughly recommend this hotel!
text: Cannot fault Hotel Mimosa, really cute cosy room with all the facilities, extra soundproofing on the windows (the subway is nearby) and blackout curtains, I had the best nights of sleep. Also we were impressed with the list of recommendations given to us by the staff, for local restaurants and breakfast options, they were really useful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. 5 stars!

title: Excellent find
text: Hotel Mimosa is a wonderful hotel and I can not recommend it enough.  Subway is a short walk away and there are plenty of restaurants near by. The staff are very friendly and accommodating.  Beware the rooms are very small but well taken care of and clean.  Area is quite and easy to get a good night's sleep.

title: Quick, Easy, Clean
text: It's a great location in Chinatown next to a ton of restaurants and accessible transit. Very nice staff, easy communication, and perhaps most important, the rooms are clean. Too often, NYC hotels have roaches and that was not a concern. Would certainly book again.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
Hotel Mimosa was SUCH A GREAT CHOICE for our New York City trip!
I, a travel nurse and hubby have stayed in many, many hotels domestically and abroad. Prices start at a couple of hundred per night for modest accommodations in NYC. That is typical NYC. The closer you want to stay in the heart of the Big Apple, the more you can expect to spend. This is why Hotel Mimosa is simply a fantastic find. This place exceeded our expectations and was a smart choice, considering the combination of quality accommodation and service we received. This hotel was the best deal we found in New York City.

The check-in experience was seamless. The staff will even hold your baggage if you arrive earlier than check-in time.  The room they provided us was VERY clean. The bed and pillows were so comfortable that it was easy to unwind every night after a long day exploring the city- and you will explore! Front desk will give you a list of places to dine, drink, and be merry. We used the kindly provided lists of restaurants within walking distance with great descriptions- making it a cinch for us to decide where to go for our meals. Mimosa is very walkable and centrally located to good, inexpensive food spots and cafes. (It is only a block away from an affordable michelin starred restaurant!). The metro station is a mere five minute walk, with a straight shot to or from JFK airport. 

The fixtures in our room were well thought out, creating a reasonably spacious bed and bath.  Although this hotel is directly in front of the Manhattan Bridge, we could not hear any noise at all from outside and we were able to sleep undisturbed.  Hotel Mimosa provides a generous supply of added toiletries for guest convenience and their thoughtfulness did not go unnoticed.  We have suffered in other hotels that have provided less while charging us more. There was no in-room fridge or microwave but there is a fridge, microwave, a snack vending machine and an ice machine at the basement level common area.

Everyone at the front desk was genuinely friendly and helpful, they even arranged a well-priced cab service to take us back to the airport for our departure. If you have any reservations I would say do not hesitate to book! 
We enthusiastically recommend Hotel Mimosa, and we have already re-booked with them for our next trip to New York City next month.

title: Even better than before
text: I've been staying at this hotel for years when I travel to NYC. I love that it's located away from the touristy area, even a few blocks away from the busy part of Chinatown. The neighborhood is pretty quiet. The subway is not far giving you easy access to the entire city. The rooms are always clean and the staff is extremely welcoming. 12pm checkout is a plus. I'm so happy I found this hotel.

title: Perfect for couple on a budget
text:
The concierge was really helpful and gave us prepared lists of places to eat and drink in Chinatown and local area (not just Chinese), bathroom and bedroom had everything you could possibly need, and the grand street subway is only a short walk away. We ended up eating and going out nearby because we liked the vibe of the area. 

Although the hotel is across from the train tracks and not the nicest looking on the outside, we couldn't hear traffic at all and the inside of the hotel is super clean, modern and nicely laid out. 

They don't offer breakfast but give you a list of nice places to eat within 5mins walk of the hotel which combined with the lower price was fine for us.

We will definitely be coming back here the next time we visit NYC, it's hard to find a trustworthy place that's not super expensive!

title: Great Find!
text: The hotel was friendly, clean and a great location for access to the lower East side, Chinatown and Little Italy!  it is next to the Manhattan bridge but we did not hear any bridge noise or traffic inside the hotel!  The staff was great! So helpful and provided a list of interesting places to visit/eat in the Chinatown area.  They also let us store our luggage in the open lobby area all day!

title: Amazing service!
text: Probably one of the best visits to nyc and it had so much to do with location and stay! This hotel is very clean! The representatives at this hotel are very nice and helpful! We got a list of restaurant in the area for all three meals. Very secure, they lock the door to the lobby after a certain time, which I really liked. someone is there checking id to let you back in. Over all I would come back and stay here again!

title: Great service at this nicely appointed hotel
text: This is a very nice small hotel in a convenient location in China Town. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nice with some toiletries provided. The only negative was how the bed was pushed up against the wall on one side. This would not be an issue for solo travel but was not that convenient for a couple. We ended up needing to delay our check out due to an unexpected visit to the local emergency room. When we called, the staff was so kind and accommodating for a late check out. They gave us a chance to rest in the room for a while when we got back before we departed. And they did not charge us any additional fees which was very much appreciated. Would definitely recommend.

title: Welcoming clean, cool stay in hot NYC
text: Our room was clean and cool in the summer heatwave of New York City. In the bathroom toothbrushes, a razor, shower cap and toothpaste. When we checked in we received a list of local restaurants. We ended up going to four restaurants from the sheets and even ended up recommending a restaurant  to my NYC friends. The staff clearly cares about customer service and were very welcoming to me and my boyfriend.

title: Clean, Safe, Great Location
text: I had such a great experience at Hotel Mimosa. My partner and I were looking for a last minute place to stay after a bad Airbnb experience, and Hotel Mimosa was everything we could have asked for and more. I've never seen such a clean hotel before. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were nice and cool despite the humid summer weather. The price was also perfect for us as we were traveling on a budget. I will definitely be back next time I travel to New York :)

title: Absolutely Fantastic Stay!
text: This was my first time traveling to New York, and I have to say, the staff and service at Hotel Mimosa were absolutely exceptional. I felt more than welcome! Upon me and my girlfriend’s arrival, we were greeted by a friendly man who helped accommodate us with our luggage. He then proceeded to give us multiple tailored lists for the best spots in the area, from breakfast places to late night dining fare; every single restaurant that we ended up trying was amazing (and very cost-friendly!). The room we booked was a bit small, but was very clean and the service was top notch. Can’t give this hotel enough high praise.

title: You won't find a better value in Manhattan
text:
Extremely clean gem of a hotel. Just got back from a wonderful weeklong stay. Staff very friendly. Room spotless and they still have daily maid service, which so many places have gotten rid of.

Considering the tremendous noise the subway makes going over the Manhattan Bridge just outside, it's amazing that you can barely hear it in the room. Smart TV lets you login to all your streaming services. Good water pressure and toiletries provided.

Rooms are perfect for solo travelers or two people who know each other well. Maybe not the best for families. My only note would be that the room doors were loud and you could hear everything going on in the hall.

Lots of great places to eat around. Hotel also provides a few good lists with ideas. Easy transit to B,D, and F trains.

Overall, an excellent excellent choice for the value. I will definitely return.

title: Heart of Chinatown
text: One of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had. Amazing hospitality, checked in earlier then expected and lists of things to do around the neighborhood. Within walking distance of everything you can want in Chinatown. If you want an authentic Chinatown experience, this is a definite recommend.

title: Nice place to stay in New York city!
text: Good location for first time NY visit. Room is tiny but very clean. Very friendly and responsible staff. Easy to get any places by Uber or public transportation. Remember to ask reception for the list of good food location in the area if you a new. We will be back.

title: Very Friendly
text: The hotel staff were very friendly, they provided us with suggestions of places to eat in town. The room was small but very clean and quite at night time. The location was perfect to walk or take a subway and explore NY. We would stay here again.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Upon arriving, we were greeted by amazing staff who were incredibly friendly. They offered suggestions for parking and food. The rooms were clean and very quiet. This is a no nonsense hotel and great bang for your buck. I will definitely be staying again.

title: What a great little find!
text: This simple, clean, no nonsense hotel is exceptional for the price! The staff is responsive and friendly. Access to public transportation was a short walk. My daughter and I had a fantastic experience. We would absolutely stay here again!

title: Know what you are paying for…
text: The hotel is average with shoe box rooms that have the bare minimum but the price is correlated.  The guy in the lobby is ok. Just be aware of the noise from the Manhattan bridge nearby. Everytime a truck goes on the bridge, there is a loud noise in the room and if the traffic is important, one gets vibrations in the room…

title: Chinatown Gem
text: Perfect for our 3-day visit! The rooms were very quiet for being so close to the elevated train and the highway. Desk staff were so kind and we especially appreciated the list of neighborhood coffee shops and "hole-in-the-wall" restaurants.

title: Weekend stay
text: Honestly I really enjoyed my stay. Everyone was very nice, the room was clean, the location was great, plus they gave us a sheet that lists lots of local restaurants to try (do check some out)! The rooms are slightly small, however my girlfriend and I didn’t mind since we were exploring the city during the day. Would highly recommend, and I’m very likely to stay here again!

title: Nice hotel
text: Everything was up to standards and according to the price. Really good. Excellent location, well connected with public transport. Local food places were amazing and a great opportunity to live the NYC Chinatown experience. Would totally recommend it. Polite and kind staff.

title: Bien sans plus
text: Vu les tarifs des hébergements à New York, nous avons choisi cet hôtel qui présente un bon rapport qualité prix. L'accueil est agréable, la chambre est petite mais propre. La literie est bonne. L'établissement est bien situé. On aurait souhaité un peu plus comme par exemple la disposition gratuite de petites bouteilles d'eau.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Stayed here with my girlfriend early June. The staff was very polite and the facilities were immaculate, not to mention the great location. My room—the Superior Queen—was cozy and reminded me of my wonderful time in Hong Kong. Would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Hotel Mimosa is the best kept secret in NYC! Stayed here for a business trip during the Tribeca Film Festival in mmm in June 2022. Everything the minimalism traveler needs. No frills. I will stay here again.

title: Великолепный выбор отеля
text: Мы провели месяц в отеле Mimosa. И это было прекрасно. Чудесный сервис. Очень хорошее местоположение. Всего 0,5км до набережной, где можно бегать по утрам. Район безопасный. Рядом много кафе китайской кухни. Есть кофейни, которые работают с раннего утра. За углом- рынок с фруктами и ягодами по очень низким ценам. На ресепшене моментально старались нам помочь при первой возможности.

title: Amazing location, wonderful staff
text: Just to put it this way: when my flights got cancelled twice in a day, I could not have been more relieved that Mimosa had a room free. Just terrific, friendly and helpful staff, and a great part of town.

title: Great little hotel
text: This hotel is small but with charm. Good location in Chinatown. Staff are super friendly and accommodating. They gave a bunch of good restaurant recommendations and quickly responded to our requests. Rooms are a bit small and bed a bit firm for my taste but all in all a good room. Would recommend they add mini fridge and/or microwave to the rooms. But a great choice for a hotel in NYC especially if you are on a budget.

title: Great spot in Chinatown for a trip to NYC.
text: The hotel was clean and quiet.  The front desk team couldn't be more helpful.  The hotel is a bit off the beaten path but close to many subway lines and walking distance to all the sights of Chinatown, Little Italy and the Lower East Side.

title: Hotel Mimosa Was Great
text:
We loved our stay here. The staff is by far the best part. They were super nice and helpful and willing to do what they could to make our stay wonderful. It a New York Hotel, rooms aren’t gigantic, you have room for the bed and a bathroom but they were clean and had everything we needed. You don’t come to NYC to stay in your room all day.

There is a train that goes by but you cannot hear it at all in your room. The rooms are very soundproof. Great place to stay, great value, great people.

Great value for this hidden gem. If you want to travel somewhere affordable but not feel unsafe, this is a great choice.

title: small but mighty
text: Hotel Mimosa was such a charming place!  Rooms are small (as expected in NYC) but very clean.  And so quiet!  Also, they provided a convenient list of recommended restaurants in the area.  Best of all was their customer service - they allowed us to check in VERY early when most other hotels would not likely do that.

title: Great downtown option
text: Small space put to thoughtful use from the lobby to the rooms themselves, which are clean, comfortable, and arranged well in a simple style that balances form and function. Staff are friendly and helpful in a way that feels very customer-centered. Location super walkable and convenient for public transportation. Altogether, highly recommended as a hotel with an elevated approach to the basics.

title: Incredible Staff
text:
The staff were incredibly helpful. We arrived early in the AM because we flew in on a redeye. It was around 9:30 AM when we made it to the hotel from the airport. The staff took our bags and told us that they would get the room ready as soon as possible. They indicated that it would probably be ready around 12pm, and suggested that we get breakfast. They gave us a great list of cafes / breakfast options and offered to text/call me once the room was available. We were able to get our room around 12:30. 

Overall, the hotel is very clean. The rooms are what you would expect in a Manhattan hotel. It is a little hot at night, but not oppressively so.

title: A great little place
text:
If you are looking for somewhere that is clean, comfortable, friendly and won’t break the bank this is the place for you. 

The staff are all incredibly helpful. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend to others who are looking for good quality accommodation at a sensible price.

title: Super-helpful staff, clean hotel in a convenient location
text:
The hotel is located in Chinatown and is 5-7 minutes from subway stations, and also handy for catching the bus. 
The room was clean and well-equipped, with toiletries and towels provided and a kettle available on request. The room was quiet and had air conditioning. 
The staff were extremely helpful and provided help with left luggage, travel directions and recommendations of places to eat and visit and were very friendly. 
I highly recommend Hotel Mimosa! My daughter and I stayed here for a few days on a visit to New York. It was a great base for our visit. We had two comfortable twin beds with ensuite bathroom.

title: Quality hotel with excellent staff
text: This hotel was fabulous. Extremely hospitable and very clean. The linens and towels were so great and soft. Easy access to several subway lines and a quick walk to Chinatown and Little Italy. Tons of delicious places to eat nearby too. It is near the Manhattan Bridge and can get a little noisy outside but they have great soundproofing. We were fortunate to meet the owner David who was very nice and welcoming. Cathy behind the front desk was also amazing. Had a bit of a slip and she came immediately to help. Would definitely stay here again.  Had a wonderful experience. Thanks again.

title: Nice hotel in Chinatown
text: The personal was kind and helpful. It is well located (subway 7 min by feet). We spent 10 nights and we do not regret. Thay gave us a big list of restaurants recommendations, we appreciated.  Until next time!

title: Excellent tiny hotel
text: This is my second or third time staying at the Hotel Mimosa, and I will definitely be going back there when I'm in New York again.  The hotel is small and the rooms are small, but everything is very clean and safe, and the staff is fantastic and friendly.  Very short walk to the F train, and a slightly longer walk to the B and D.  There's a grocery store/deli a block away that is open 24 hours.  Excellent value all around.

title: Best Hotel Experience!
text: If you’re planning to stay in NYC Downtown area I strongly recommend Hotel mimosa. Not only is it a cute and cozy hotel but they have so many restaurants and shopping places nearby! When you come in you are greeted and taken care of, they give you a guide that has all the best eats in the Chinatown area as well as directions on how to get to certain attractions. If you are traveling as a big group 3+ know that it’s small and cozy and that quiet time is 10pm-8am. They we’re all so sweet and nice and the owner was super friendly and helpful!! I felt safe staying here as it is close to the subway stations and there is staff on duty 24/7. Definitely will come again!!! Thank you Hotel Mimosa and your wonderful staff!

title: Friendly, Affordable and Great Neighborhood
text: My wife and I both love this hotel! Of course the room is tiny but who cares, the amazing world of Chinatown and lower Manhattan awaits. The staff is super friendly and the hotel is very clean. The recommended restaurant list is fantastic - be sure to try out some of them. Enjoy this little gem.

title: Great value for NYC in an awesome area
text:
Amazing value for New York. The owners and employees are extreemly friendly and welcome you with nice lists for restaurants in the area. The room is very clean and the beds are nice and even though close to the subway it is quiet in the room. 

The area is really nice at the borde between China Town and Lower East Side. A lot of hip restaurants is in very close proximity and the hotel is perfectly placed to take a stroll to the best neighborhoods in Manhatten or for visits to Brooklyn with bridges just around the corner.

title: Highly recommend
text:
Spotless, quiet room in an excellent location with friendly, welcoming staff. They were also able to accommodate an early check-in.

Hotel staff greeted us with a list of neighborhood recommendations when we arrived, and all of the places we visited were excellent.

title: great value
text: I was a bit nervous staying in a budget hotel in Manhattan after previous experiences, but was pleasantly surprised by Mimosa. The hotel is conveniently located in the LES walking distance from Soho, Tribeca, and the Financial District.  As expected for a hotel in Manhattan at this price, the rooms are on the small side. However, the interiors have been recently renovated, comfortable well appointed. Although my room looked out over the Manhattan bridge, the soundproofing was excellent and I was not disturbed by the sound of the train. The bed and linens were good quality and comfortable. The room even had a bathtub, which was an added and unexpected bonus. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again the next time I am in NYC.

title: Great location, super staff!
text:
Dear Mimosa Team, 
we want to thank you with this review for our great stay at Mimosa Hotel in March! The location of the hotel is very good. It is right in Chinatown and the nearest subway station is only 5-10 minutes walk away. But really outstanding is the staff and the service: helpful, courteous and always a few good tips for us. At check-in, we were also given a list of restaurant recommendations in the area. The room is exactly as described and the beds very comfortable. 

We can recommend the hotel especially because of the staff! 10/10! We will be back again!

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff!
text: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Mimosa! It's near the heart of Chinatown so it has amazing food, and convenient public transport close by. They let me have an early check in and late check out. It was very clean (which was SO refreshing compared to other NYC hotels) and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Carl, Cathy, and Ryan were so great, and even offered to let us keep our stuff stored at their hotel AFTER we checked out. Because of this, we were able to explore the city a bit more before our flight, without worrying about lugging our stuff around! They honestly went above and beyond, and I would definitely recommend and 100% stay again!

title: Great little hotel
text: Enjoyed my stay here. The staff was helpful, check in was easy and they gave lots of good nearby restaurant recommendations. Basic rooms but clean and had everything I needed. They had toothbrushes and toothpaste as well which was helpful. Would recommend.

title: Great Value Stay
text: Hotel was conveniently located next to subway stations and close to a lot of great restaurants and stores. Staff whom I interacted with were all very pleasant and helpful. I arrived early in the morning and was surprised that my room was already available for check in, instead of having to wait until the afternoon. Room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The price was reasonable and affordable compared to other hotels in the Manhattan area. Would love to stay again if I return to the area.

title: Hotel Mimosa
text: A sweet, clean, well-located treasure of a small hotel. The staff are gracious and have an excellent and very valuable list of spots in the neighborhood to dine that was GREAT for us. A little jewel of a place.

title: Awesome!!!  Great value!!
text:
The hotel was in an awesome location in Chinatown close to Chinatown landmarks, restaurants, groceries, bus, and train. 
Recently renovated with sound proof windows so the room is quiet. 
Very clean with friendly helpful staff. Great value.
Highly recommend for solo or couple travelers!!

title: Hotel Mimosa
text: Room was very clean. Staff was very helpful during visit. Great location. 10 min walk to the F train. Very close to the LES. Smack in the middle of Chinatown and near Little Italy. Will return soon!!!!

title: Impecable !
text: Muy buen servicio, amigable y descontracturado. Las habitaciones, si bien son pequeñas están muy bien equipadas. Pasamos solamente una noche y creo que para estadías cortas es fantástico. Implementaron un servicio de desayuno que es por delivery ya que no cuentan con salón para ello. Muy bien ubicado, sobre todo para disfrutar de la gastronomía china y alrededores con otras propuestas culturales. Altamente recomendable!

title: A few days in NY to remember
text: We had a nice breakout of 3 days in NY where we met a long-time friend couple. We all 4 stayed in Mimosa Hotel and are very satisfied with the cleanliness of the hotel and also the friendliness of the staff. It was a little bit hot during the first night and we wish that the air condition could be better. The hotel is situated in the middle of Chinatown providing easy access to Asian restaurants that we enjoyed a lot. We will definitely come back on our next NY visit.

title: Love this place!
text: Hotel Mimosa is so conveniently located, and the staff is so accommodating and kind! Rooms were spotless, though a little small, and sound proof. We’ll definitely be recommending this place to friends and family.

title: Clean and comfortable stay in great location
text: We had a great weeklong stay at hotel Mimosa for our honeymoon. The room, though small, was well equipped with all the amenities you need for a comfortable stay. Staff were friendly and went above and beyond to accommodate for any requests. There are many restaurants, bars and eateries nearby. Subway station is a stones away throw away and provided easy access to Manhattan and Brooklyn alike. We would happily stay again on our next visit to NYC and would highly recommend to other travellers.

title: Great Stay!  - Well located, Clean and very friendly.
text: This is a great choice if you want to be close to the LES.  The neighbourhood is full of great little restaurants and bars within a short walk.  The hotel is very affordable by New York standards - it is in a very clean building with small but comfortable rooms.  The one thing that really stands out is the staff.  This is a small business and the ownership really cares about their guests.  Excellent local recommendations and tips and answers to any questions you might have.  There's great soundproofing so you don't hear the hustle and bustle when you don't want to.  The room was super clean with all the stuff you need.  Certainly recommended!

title: Lovely Stay
text:
We were looking for something inexpensive at the last minute and this fit the bill.  It was a great jumping off point for driving to Brooklyn daily, but close enough to the subway to explore Manhattan or even to walk to the Lower East Side sights.  
We parked at the nearby recommended garage for approx 39 bucks per night, but received a $5 discount by getting our ticket stamped at the hotel. 
The bathroom was large by Manhattan standards. The room was very small, but big enough to move around and store a couple of small suitcases. The bed was very firm, which I know some people enjoy. I did not like it, but my husband loved it. The tv and internet were great.  They outsource room service, including coffee, which we did not use. They gave many great recommendations for nearby coffee and restaurants, all great.  
The employees were stellar and went out of their way to handle any issues, send up an iron, recommend parking and other options. They went above and beyond and seemed quite proud of their hotel.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Very nice!
text: Pretty nice location and staffs!! They located in Chinatown, which is close to many nice restaurants and transportation. The staffs have offered us suggestions for visiting around and is very warm. Definitely would come again!

title: A very pleasant stay
text:
I didn't read much about the hotel before arriving. I was very surprised by the professionalism and friendliness shown by the staff members, and by the comfort level of the room, which was very clean and inviting.

The hotel is located in a very unique spot between east side and Chinatown. There are countless amazing restaurants, cafes and bars in the area, and the staff is always happy to give tips.

Had a wonderful time. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Great feel with lovely staff
text: The staff make this hotel room - they are very nice and welcoming and quick to answer questions, give pointers, direct you to hidden gems in the neighborhood, etc.  My room was small, but clean.  The hotel is right next to the Manhattan bridge so on the street the noise is substantial but the windows are double or triple pane so noise wasn't an issue for me.  Would stay here again.

title: hidden gem
text: Great experience. lovely staff, small but quiet and clean room. Particularly appreciated how well the black out curtains worked. They also provided great recommendations for food and things to do in the chinatown area.

title: Little diamond
text: I came for the weekend to visit my son and was so glad to find Hotel Mimosa. The staff couldn’t have been nicer! The room was clean, the bedding was very comfortable, and the bathroom was updated and supplied with amenities anyone would need. On the day of departure we left our belongings after checkout so we could keep exploring the city and they were happy to store them until we returned. Parking was super easy in a garage just a block away and Hotel Mimosa stamped our ticket and we saved almost $20 on two nights parking. I really feel we stumbled upon a sweet little gem and will definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great weekend!

title: Welcoming, clean and calm, we enjoyed our stay
text: Hotel mimosa is a great hotel. The staff is welcoming, nice and helpful. The room was very nice, clean and calm despite the outdoor traffic. The bedding is also very good. I definitely recommend the hotel mimosa!

title: Clean hotel.
text: Stayed a couple of days in this clean , comfortable hotel in the heart of Chinatown in NY. Suggestion  to provide coffee or at least install a coffee machine.    Close to public transports and restaurants and near Little Italy . Kind and friendly proprietors. Good value for money.

title: Fine budget option but not a boutique hotel experience
text: I’m a little puzzled as to how this hotel is in the top 10 hotels in NYC! It is certainly a fine budget option for a place to sleep (clean and not sketchy) but it is truly bare bones. I think it is a stretch to call it a “boutique” hotel as it has no amenities — no lobby space, not even an ice machine — no coffee or tea — small no frills room, slightly worse for wear bathroom, right next to the bridge with the train running day and night.  I slept fine but did end up wishing I’d chosen something a little more welcoming.

title: We booked a room at Hotel Mimosa based on the great reviews. Here's another great one.
text:
Travelled to NY for a film screening at the Metrograph and booked a room here based on location.
What a treat this hotel is! Small and simple, but super clean and comfortable, and a great price. 
A short walk to the F train, and surrounded by the awesomeness that is Chinatown. Even though the hotel is snuggled up next to the Manhattan Bridge, the room was very quiet.
The front desk gave us an extensive list of restaurants and bars in the area - we'll need another trip or two to eat at all of them. Joe's Shanghai, Vegetarian Dim Sum House, Forgtmenot, Kiki's, Jajaja, Grand Daddy coffee - all super close and delicious.
Definitely will stay here again. Being in this neighborhood was a nice break from the gentrification of most of NY.

title: Great Stay for the Price!
text: Amazing stay for the price! Front desk was helpful, bed was comfy, location was an easy jumping off point. They gave us a list of recommendations for the surrounding area and, while temps are centrally controlled, when I called to ask about an adjustment it was done immediately. Would definitely come back!

title: Clean and great value
text: Very good stay for the price! Room was not big, but comfy enough for 2 persons. Very clean, friendly staff who will give you food recommendations. Location on Manhattan is great, but be prepared for 5-8mins walk from the metro.

title: Stayed for a week, felt like home
text:
My wife and I travelled to New York to attend an art fair at Pier 36. Hotel Mimosa was the least expensive hotel in the area, but don't let the low price fool you. We stayed for about a week and I can't recommend this place highly enough.

The rooms were super clean and the staff were all warm, friendly, and went out of their way on multiple occasions to make our stay comfortable and convenient. 

Their location in Chinatown is surrounded by restaurants in every direction which offered a wonderful cultural experience. On days we were feeling too tired to find a place to eat, we used Door Dash to have great food delivered directly to our room. 

In short, we never wanted to leave.

Thank you for the fond memories, Hotel Mimosa!

title: GREAT LITTLE GEM  IN NEW YORK , LOVELY HOTEL  !
text: We spent 2 weeks as a couple here visiting family in NYC, great spot, rooms are comfortable and SPOTLESS clean :) Bed is super comfortable, amazing pillows ( and lots of them ) , all sheets, bathroom towels all high quality. made us feel right at home in the heart of chinatown. Even when i was here alone a couple of nights felt super safe. Reception and management impeccable, sweet , greatly of help w anything extra, bathroom BIG spacious and ( for NY ) freshly renovated, made me so happy after a long flight. would def recommend and come again ! we slept in the queen room , 2nd floor, NO SOUNDS from outside, not even the train, best sleeps ever.

title: Great stay!!
text: Super cozy and incredibly friendly staff! Hotel is located in walking distance to a lot of great attractions and great food options. We will definitely be considering the Hotel Mimosa for our next stay

title: Lovely hotel
text: Cheapest hotel I could find at short notice and I was amazed at how nice it was. The rooms were cozy and well decorated and the whole hotel had a friendly atmosphere. Great location on the edge of china town, a short metro ride from any of the main sights in Manhattan. Would 100% recommend this hotel and will be staying here again next time I come to NY.

title: Great Stay at Hotel Mimosa
text: Friendly, clean, good value and a great base for exploring New York. The staff are wonderful. Transport to mid town was east - taxi, river boat, subway and Citi bikes. If all you want is a place to put your head down this place is perfect.

title: Great Stay!
text: This hotel was very cozy, comfortable, and clean. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The location is great. It's very close to some great restaurants and spots. I highly recommend this hotel for a cozy stay!

title: Worth a stay!
text:
Check-in was a breeze, front staff always very nice when I came in and out again. 

Room was well furnished though not well sound-proofed. 
Outside, the train noise at night from the Manhattan bridge might be an issue for some, but I found the location very convenient and cozy. Great views of the city over the bridge.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Location. My friend and I were recommended to stay in Chinatown by her cousin who works in NY. He said it was the best area for ease of access between anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn. And he was right! A young guy I had met selling chocolates in the Oculus mall who happened to live in Chinatown (he was white), said the same thing. So big plus to this hotel for location.

Cleanliness. My friend and I were really apprehensive about booking hotels anywhere in NY mainly due to what we heard about NY’s prevalent  bed bug infestations. But seeing the inside of this place, we breathed a big sigh of relief. The beds and the bathrooms were both very clean.

Customer service. My friend and I were also initially apprehensive about customer service. My friend and I both grew up in predominantly Asian areas, we’re used to Asian customer service (mainly restaurants) being a little abrupt and less personable. But Hotel Mimosa exceeded our expectations. Though we always woke up late missing the usual cleaning service time, we were always able to get our room tidied up if we called front desk. We were always able to get extra toilet paper if we asked, extra towels—my friend at 2am in the morning even asked for an extra blanket. We always thought we were being a burden and expected them to either ignore our request or take a very long time to follow through, but we were very wrong. On the phone, the front desk person was always very gracious and a worker would follow through on the task promptly.

So five solid stars for this hotel!!

title: Cozy stay
text:
Just renovated, well equipped, very clean and cosy room.
Staff is really nice and helpful - they provided us with a list of the best Chinatown bars and restaurants.
After check out you can store your bags for the day.
The area Is safe.
Great job guys !!

title: Great location, friendly staffs
text: Clean and quiet hotel with very nice and attentive staffs. Very affordable with walkable distance to China town. Definitely check their restaurant suggestion - we visited a few of the list and the food was amazing. Toiletries were fully available. Will definitely come back for another stay.

title: Nice hotel for extended weekend visit
text: This hotel is very nice and affordable and in a great location if you are willing to walk a bit to get to subway lines. The hotel is updated, clean, and the staff is super nice and welcoming. Our only negative was that the room got extremely hot at night, with seemingly no temperature control available in the room. That combined with a mattress that did not breathe at all made sleeping difficult. Otherwise, we found our Deluxe Queen room (small, but we didn't spend much time in it) more than adequate and it and our bathroom were clean. The hotel is right across the street from the train line but their double windows really do keep the train sound quite faint -- it was not an issue at all.

title: Nice weekend getaway
text: We were just here to visit family for the weekend. The location was very convenient right next to the Manhattan Bridge. Staff had great recommendations for bars and restaurants nearby and were very helpful and accommodating. The bathroom was fully stocked and the free internet was high speed. Definitely planning to come back next time we're in town.

title: Great location, great staff
text: Location is great with easy access to Chinatown and LES. Hotel staff were extremely nice and helpful and had great recommendations for food. The queen room we stayed in was clean and well lit, and included a table with built in USB-3 port and wireless phone charger. Will definitely stay again.

title: Nice little hotel
text: I stayed here when I came for the NYC half marathon. It was a great location to get to the start of the race, back after the race (plus near the course so I was able to spectate a bit also). Location is great and loved the neighborhood. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. Would stay here again.

title: Stylish, Helpful and Well-Located Little Boutique Hotel
text: We loved our brief stay at Hotel Mimosa, in the heart of Manhattan Chinatown. The staff was very sweet and helpful, and the rooms were clean and well-appointed. Walkable to Lower Manhattan and East Village for sure. Would definitely return :)

title: Excellent Hotel Staff
text: The people who work at Hotel Mimosa were the nicest and most supportive of any hotel I have stayed at recently. title: Very clean, friendly & accommodating staff, great location in NYC
text:
I had a fantastic experience at Hotel Mimosa! 

I was welcomed warmly by staff who had some great suggestions for local places to eat. 

The room itself was cute, very clean and well stocked. You are near the train, but rooms have thick double paned glass windows, so I slept peacefully every night - you couldn't hear anything from outside! 

The location was great as there were many subway stations close by and extremely easy to get a taxi/uber in the area. 

I would definitely stay at this hotel again, one of my best hotel experiences in NYC!

title: Friends Trip
text: Great place to stay. Great area. Staff was friendly and rooms were very clean. Would definitely recommend if you’re looking for a place in China Town that is close to a lot a great parts of the city; and easy to navigate.

title: Gran Hotel. Buen precio
text:
A destacar el trato excepcional recibido por el personal en todo momento. Muy atentos siempre. Profesionales y agradables.
El hotel está muy bien, la habitación un poco pequeña, pero eso no es un problema en una ciudad como Nueva York. Ubicado en Chinatown, es perfecto para conocer la esencia del barrio, o llegar andando a Brooklyn, Dumbo, Soho, Tribeca  o sur de Manhattan sin problema. Así como para desplazarte por el resto de la ciudad. Hay dos paradas de metro a 5minutos.
Aunque mi habitación daba al puente de Manhattan, estaba muy bien insonorizada y no afectó para nada al descanso.
En resumen, es un hotel al que volvería.

title: Amazing stay in the heart of Chinatown
text: Can't beat the value you get here, especially with the excellent service, clean rooms, and friendly staff. Staff gave us lovely recommendations, even leaving a note on our door with more specific places for us (after we asked about more) !! They will also hold your luggage after checkout. Very friendly and down-to-earth place that deserves every dollar they get. Thank you Hotel Mimosa!!

title: Perfect spot to explore China town
text: The staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. They allowed us to check in early, let us store our bags before and after check-in/check-out, carried our bags to our room, and provided an umbrella when the weather was bad. The people at the front desk were always extremely charming, genuinely helpful, and easy to communicate with. I will stay here anytime I’m in the area!

title: Loved it here!
text: The location is very convenient for traveling around chinatown. The service here was great! Unlike more expensive hotels I’ve been to, the TV had Youtube, Spotify, free movies, etc! I also liked how they provide you toothbrushes, toothpaste, a razor, brush, lotion, and shampoo, condition, and body wash that smell good! I wasn’t expecting the room to be as small as it was, but you get used to it and my friend and I didn’t really need anything except a bathroom, bed, and space for our luggage. The only downside of the stay was how hard the bed was, but it does the job and you’ll eventually fall asleep. Though it might be more comfortable to sleep on the floor. LOL

title: Not for families visiting typical tourist sites
text:
Ok, so I get why there are so many wonderful reviews, but let’s be realistic here for a moment:

1. Of course you hear the trains coming across the bridge every few minutes, all night long! Other than that, completely silent hotel and area at night. The trains didn’t bother me or my son.

2. The surrounding area IS very sketchy. Please know this. Please see my pictures. I was not comfortable walking around with my young son but would be ok as a couple.  I mean, you’re probably fine, honestly, but, wow, it just looks terrible. So much graffiti . And we passed —daily — multiple unfortunate people sleeping on the street and urinating in public. All that said, had I been there as a young person or just with my SO, I still like the Chinatown vibe. My complaints are meant to be given only for the benefit of other parents taking kids to the city. 

3. Staff is wonderful. Rooms are clean and very, very comfortable. No smells. Would love a coffee pot but otherwise zero complaints with the hotel amenities.  Except maybe one more: I really dislike being unable to personally control my room’s temperature. I found the room to be cold at night.

4. Not sure where all the other reviewers were visiting, but, for us, it really wasn’t convenient to major sites or Broadway. I mean, it’s Manhattan, you can almost always walk to a subway stop anywhere within 10 minutes. But, If you have kids, it’s so much easier to stay midtown or upper west side. SO much easier. Can’t even believe how many people are acting like it is convenient to walk 7 minutes to a subway, wait for a train, probably have to change a train to get to your destination, then walk from that destination’s subway stop. It’s at least 30 -45 min to Broadway during busy times, with kids. We took a yellow cab back to hotel and it was much easier for $24. 

5. Area is not easy to find a quick bite to eat for a finicky, child eater. 

6. The entrance to this place is on Eldridge, not Division. Can’t even see it at night from Division Street. 

Honestly, unless you are a super-cool, hipster parent, find some place uptown to stay with kids for a typical, touristy vacation.  Plenty of cheap hotels out there are the moment. Enjoy the Mimosa if you are young and unencumbered!

title: What a wonderful place!
text: We discovered this hidden gem in Chinatown as a result of an unexpected layover in JFK on a recent trip to London. We were sitting stranded in the airport at 4am, exhausted and feeling a bit despondent, with nowhere to go when we found Hotel Mimosa online. We phoned ahead and asked whether we could check in early (like 5:00am early) and they were so helpful and accommodating, they had a room available and the early check in fee was very reasonable. We immediately hopped in an Uber and within the hour were tucked into a super comfy bed, grateful for a place to get some sleep and safely store our heavy luggage that we’d been dragging with us. The black out curtains and the windows made it easy to sleep - considering it’s right on the street and in the hustle bustle of Chinatown, you’d never know it as it’s so quiet. A few hours later, we were up and ready to take advantage of the days’ layover. The room was great, small but very functional and nice and they went above and beyond our expectations with the toiletries in the bathroom (ie, toothbrushes, toothpaste in addition to nice quality shower gel, shampoo and conditioner). The staff are friendly and knowledgable about the area and they gave us a printed comprehensive list of places to eat with accurate write ups, so if you’re unfamiliar with the foodie scene Chinatown, you can be confident that you’re going somewhere good. The hotel is perfectly situated and most places are a short five minute walk away, so for the 24 hours we had available, we were able to visit several dim sum spots and peruse the wonderful Asian markets. What was initially a disappointment, turned out to be a fabulous side trip and start to the vacation. Hotel Mimosa is awesome and we will definitely go back for another longer stay next time!

title: We'll Be Back!
text: Super clean room and bathroom. Everything looked brand new. The staff is friendly, professional, and very knowledgeable about the area. Perfect place for exploring Chinatown and surrounding areas. So many great places to see all within walking distance.

title: Love Hotel mimosa
text: Je recommande chaleureusement cet hôtel, l’emplacement est parfait pour visiter Manhattan sud à pied ou en métro, le quartier de Chinatown vous dépaysera totalement, ainsi que little Italy à quelques rues. Le personnel est souriant, attentionné et disponible pour vous aider ou vous renseigner. La chambre est propre et très bien isolée. Que du love pour cet endroit !

title: Perfect
text: No issues, perfect for the amount of time we stayed! Hope to come back. Area was also great as there are plenty of food choices within walking distance, as well as a great cultural vibe, being in the midst of Chinatown.

title: Super chill and laidback
text:
The hotel was no-frills, chill, and laidback. Always someone at the concierge, water for sale at a dollar, umbrellas free to use on rainy days. Easy access to the subways and lots of tasty food all around, not to mention OS NYC being in walking distance. They give a list of recommendations for places as well which was fun to look at. 

It was quiet, we used the Wi-Fi, and watched Netflix and YouTube on the TV. 

For what wasn’t perfect, but completely manageable…

We put towels to block the blue light from the telephone and little reading light by our bed.

The water from the sink was either extremely hot or extremely cold. It was an art to get it just right! It was fun though. And hot water is nice.

Some nights were incredibly warm; we would find a balance with opening the windows.

I probably should have brought my own shampoo too, and that’s fine!

Overall this is definitely my go-to now for staying in NYC. It’s affordable, comfy, safe, and in such a prime location. So many places close by!!!

title: Small but clean and excellent service
text: The service at Hotel Mimosa was excellent. The staff is eager to assist with just about any need or request. They were incredibly accommodating and just really nice and easy to deal with. If you're going to be out and about in NYC and just looking for a clean affordable place with fantastic staff, Hotel Mimosa can't be beat.

text: Great experience, clean, new and in a great location. Staff was really nice too. We had to extend our stay because of the snow storm and there was not problem at all. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby in Orchad Street. Totally recommended!!!

title: Very clean and very friendly!
text: Great experience! The hotel was renovated and very clean. The staff was especially friendly and we received a list of recommended local restaurant and „hole in the wall“ places. The multi layer window kept the noise low even so close to Manhattan Bridge.

title: Great hotel!
text:
I was visiting New York for a week and this was the perfect hotel for that. Clean, quiet and with very comfortable beds.
The staff was very welcoming and helpful with all our requests, I would recommend 100%

title: Excellent location and super nice staff
text: This place is perfectly located and close to many sights and two subway stations. The staff was super friendly and helpful. There are many good restaurants in Chinatown. It's only a 25min walk to Wall Street / World Trade Center. Highly recommended!

title: Lower Manhattan gem nestled in the heart of China town
text: Hotel Mimosa is a lower Manhattan gem nestled in the heart of China town. The place was affordable, the rooms were clean, affordable parking 2 blocks away, and the staff were welcoming, pleasant, and offered great dining and entertainment venues near the Hotel.  I truly thank David (Owner/Manager) for recommending an amazing, delicious Chinese restaurant (Authentic Szechuan) that was only minutes walking distance from the Hotel. I 100% highly recommend anyone visiting NYC to stay at Hotel Mimosa.

title: Will Return
text:
Needed an affordable stay in Manhattan, and wasn’t disappointed. Small room, but that is NYC in our budget. It was clean, staff was extremely nice, accommodating, and knew all the good places to eat. Surrounded in bakeries that I’ll dream about for years. 5-7 min walk to two main subway stations, and a half hour walk to many mainstays of Manhattan. (There’s also a lot of busses, but we’re walkers). 
For sure will stay there again.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: While it’s rare that I leave any type of review, I feel it’s necessary to give this hotel and its employees a 5-star review.  Upon arrival and throughout our stay, the front desk was courteous and attentive. The room was recently remodeled and very clean with a spacious bathroom. They provided everything we needed, even toothbrushes. I would add that the hotel is close to the Manhattan Bridge, but we did not hear any noise from it.  We look forward to visiting again soon.

title: Very friendly, accommodating staff
text: We really enjoyed our stay there.  Plus it had a really nice mattress, pillows.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. Also, a very interesting section of the city, Chinatown, and they give you a very nice list of recommended businesses nearby.

title: Hidden Gem!!
text: We had to book last minute because of another cancellation and we were SO surprised by how great this place was. First, the location is absolutely perfect for all things lower Manhattan. Subway is right near by and you can walk to loads of restaurants and bars. Second, the staff is incredibly nice and welcoming. They gave us an amazing list of restaurants and bars (including a secret list of hole in the wall places). Third, the rooms were PERFECT. Incredibly clean, big shower, nice TV, and the rooms were noise canceling so you don’t hear the craziness of the street or train. I have paid triple what we paid to stay here in a “4 star” hotel in soho that was AWFUL compared to this place. This will be without a doubt the place way stay when we visit. Can’t wait to come back!

title: Good price with great service in Chinatown
text: Really friendly hotel staff with newly renovated rooms. We were the first ones to stay in our room, so all the interior was brand new. The room is a good size, with a great size bathroom for New York. Close to Grand Station and within good walking distance to Canal Station. Also close to some of the best places to eat in Chinatown. Even if you get to Hotel Mimosa before check-in, you can leave your bags and they will deliver them to your room when you can check-in which was really nice. The staff make a list of good places to eat and drink around the hotel which is extra helpful. Lucky King Bakery is just a few streets over, is open until 8:55 pm everyday, and has amazing steamed buns. Never had a problem walking around the neighborhood, even after midnight. Hotel is right next to the Manhattan Bridge, but the windows are solid enough that you can't hear it more than a hum when they're closed. What's really nice is that the windows can still open when you want some fresh air and don't mind the sounds of the street. Staff was always behind the desk 24/7 in case you got in very early or very late. Best place I've stayed at in New York City.

title: Hotel Mimosa has the nicest staff
text: I loved the staff, they were very sweet and welcoming. The room itself was comfortable, and although the hotel is right next to a train, the soundproof glass windows let absolutely no sound through. The price was affordable and was the cheapest I could find in NYC that still had a private bathroom and convenient location.

title: Good value for money
text:

title: Wonderful stay, clean rooms, will come again!
text: We were the first guests at Hotel Mimosa after COVID and I had such a great experience! Attentive and helpful staff, really cute rooms and such a comfy bed! It was hard for me to get out of bed in the morning, the beds were so nice. The location is within walking distance of subways, plenty of sights, restaurants and coffee shops. David, the owner himself, had lots of recommendations for nearby haunts and hidden finds. Highly recommended to all visitors!

title: We Loved This Place
text: Fabulous location in Lower Manhattan..... Great customer service... David was at the front desk almost the entire time we were there (Thursday - Sunday) and gave us great recommendations for neighborhood eateries that we never would have known about.  We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great stay at Hotel Mimosa. Like staying with Family.

The main thing I require from a stay is a clean room. And Hotel Mimosa met that need. I will certainly stay here again.

text: We stayed at Hotel Mimosa for the weekend. The room was recently renovated and super clean. Everyone at the desk was extremely kind and helpful. We enjoyed the neighborhood and easy proximity to everything via the subway. title: This place is awesome
text: Hotel Mimosa is wonderful. The rooms are compact but cozy, clean, and thoughtful with large bathrooms. The sound proofing really works, it's pretty amazing. The location is fabulous. The owner of the hotel and all of the staff are incredibly kind and warm with many great recommendations of where to go locally. 10/10 would definitely stay again.

title: PAR-FAIT
text:
Hôtel parfait. Que dire de plus...? Nous avions une chambre qui faisait angle sur rue. Nous n’entendions AUCUN bruit, alors que le métro aérien passait devant notre fenêtre.
Personnel très accueillant, à l’écoute, présent H24. Le patron a même conversé avec nous en français ! 
L’hôtel est très bien desservi par 2 lignes de métro, il y a  7min de marche vers chaque arrêt.
Il y a aussi des arrêts de bus en bas de l’hôtel. Très pratique! Il est très facile de se déplacer à NYC en transport. 
La chambre était propre.
Il y avait un Lit, un bureau, une penderie. 
Aucun problème de chauffage, ni eau chaude.
La salle de bain était spacieuse.
La chambre est petite mais suffisante. Nous n’étions là que pour dormir ou faire une escale pour poser nos achats! 
Nous avions rangé nos valises sous le lit, nous n’avons pas manqué de place. 
Nous ne chercherons pas d’autre hôtel si nous décidons de repartir à NY.
Le quartier est super. Nous avons adoré être en plein cœur de Chinatown.

title: Best accommodation in NYC!
text: We stayed in this hotel for almost a week, the position is perfect as the hotel is located close to tube stations. The standard room was clean and cozy, we loved the furniture details. The staff is very kind and helpful, they recommended some nice restaurants and activities to do in the nearby area. Totally recommended!!

title: Mimosa Wednesdays
text:
I’m new in town. I moved to New York from Los Angeles on January 1st of this year. 
It was a big move so I was too tired to try and find a place I could rent as a studio. Instead I decided to go to my favorite hotel once a week, a place that had won my heart because of its very name, Mimosa, which in Spanish, my mother tongue, means affectionate, loving, cuddly. 

So every Wednesday, in what I’d later call Mimosa Wednesdays, I’d take the train to Grand St., buy trinkets at some store in Eldridge St. and have lunch at 388 Cafe & Deli to later check into the Mimosa Hotel. 
Quickly, Mimosa became my bubble and my office, somewhere I looked forward to going to every week to write and put my ideas in order. 
They have a coffee machine in the lobby, so I’d fix myself a cup, head to my room and write until my head spun. Then, I'd go for a nightly walk around Chinatown, smoke a cigarette in Confucius Plaza or get a massage with a masseuse I had met a few years ago at a now defunct “health center” in Canal St. coincidentally called Mimoso. 

Despite it being a modest accommodation, the rooms are bright, clean and quiet, with amazing views of Manhattan Bridge. Wifi is fast, the bed is comfortable, there’s a working printer in the basement and most importantly: Hotel Mimosa has the nicest, most polite and helpful hotel staff I've ever encountered. They always go the extra mile to make sure I feel welcome. Sometimes they even give me special Chinese teas that they keep in the back ;-)
Last time I visited the hotel was on March 5th, only 10 days before lockdown started. 
Upon checkout, a Chinese woman was trying to get directions to Times Square. I had probably spent the night with the last bunch of tourists allowed into the city. 

Really looking forward to coming back to the Mimosa Hotel! 
Manhattan, get well soon!

title: Would stay again
text:
This hotel was ideal: handy location, great price, wonderful staff. They provided us with everything, even a cheap transfer back to the airport. The location is great for going to Brooklyn Bridge and Tribeca. The staff were really nice and created a pleasant atmosphere in the hotel in general. 

Thank you, Hotel Mimosa!

title: Wenn man in Manhattan Übernachten will ist dieses Hotel schon beinahe muss
text:
Gefallen · Die Zimmer:
Die Zimmer sind sauber aber klein und ohne Schrank. Es gibt eine winzig kleine Kommode und einen Kleiderständer mit 5 Bügel. Das Bett und das Bad sind sehr gut.
Lage:
Die Lage des Hotels ist zweigeteilt. Was die Lage in Bezug auf Manhattan angeht, könnte es kaum besser gehen, da es super zentral liegt und man ganz vieles bequem zu Fuß erreichen kann. Auch Metro und Bus sind nur wenige 100 Meter entfernt.
Die Lage absolut ist aber in Chinatown, was dem ganzen kein Abbruch tut aber direkt gegenüber der Manhattan-Bridge. Auf der Manhattan Bridge verlaufen 3 Strassen und 4 Bahnstrecken. Vor allem diese sind sehr laut. Dafür hat das Hotel sehr gute Schallschutzfenster. Der haupt Nachteil ist, dass man Nachts die Fenster nicht offen lassen kann und auch Tagsüber ist das öffnen wegen dem Lärm fast unmöglich.
Ausstattung des Hotels:
Es gibt Wasserkocher für die Zimmer und Getränke und Snack-Automaten, Trinkwasser, Eis und auch ein Computer mit Wifi im Keller. Das 5G Wifi im Hotel funktioniert einwandfrei.
Das Hotel ist super organisiert. Es gibt Listen für Lunch+ Dinner, Frühstück, Souvenirläden, Sehenswürdigkeiten und ebenso gratis einen Stadtplan.

Nicht gefallen · Die Zimmer könnten etwas grösser sein und es wäre schön, wenn es mehr Möglichkeiten für die Kleidung etc gebe.
Die Manhattan Bridge ist super laut und das öffnen der Fenster daher Nachts nicht möglich

title: Oasis
text: Immediately upon entering the lobby, the background music, decor, and smiling/welcoming staff relaxed us.  Great location a short walk from 2 subway stations.  Tea and coffee available in the lobby.  They provided a list of recommended eateries within walking distance with descriptions, ratings, and walking directions.  Spotlessly clean and bright room.  Very comfortable bed and pillows.  Good shower.  Excellent soundproofing and blackout curtains.  The only thing I would wish for to make a longer stay more comfortable is a tea/coffee option in the room and/or a lounge area apart from the reception area.   Bonus find:  a few blocks from a world-famous skate park underneath the bridge.

If I were to award 5/5 it means they are faultless!! That said, it's a very good hotel for the money charged. 

Pro- 
The F Subway at East Broadway is nearby and handy to link to other stations and the M15 bus runs nearby to go to the Financial District.
The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the tv had many channels. Water was always hot. 

I would recommend that the noise curfew be policed as 2 nights I had other residents making too much noise about 10/11pm.

The room we had was ok for the 2 of us. Relatively basic but worked as a base. 
There's a good French bakery/cafe after the railway bridge across the road, 100m on the left, for takeaway to kick start your day. 

Chinatown is an eye opener as it's authentic to it's culture.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Our stay was perfect ! The hotel is clean and close to everything. And the staff are amazing , so helpful. Made our stay easy .We will come back for sure . Thank u ☺️!!  
And thank u for the candies 😉 , good idea !

title: Great location and friendly
text: The location was good, close to 2 Metro Stations. The hotel was clean and the bed very comfy; blackout curtains were also very good! The staff was extremely friendly and gave us a list of restaurants nearby (tried several and they were all very good!)

title: Best choice!
text: The best choice we could make. Everything settled in details. Nothing to complain about. Clean rooms, great staff and good location. The staff is trying their best to guarantee you have a pleasant stay. I would definitely recommend to everyone.

title: Fantastic!
text: What a wonderful find! The staff were so kind and helpful. Clean rooms, great location near 3 subway stations and the Brooklyn Bridge. Hot drink making facilities in the foyer...and a huge bowl of sweets! We will definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family.

title: Satisfied!
text:
Spent a week in this hotel. 
Room very small and the air gets sticky at night, but all in all clean and worth the price.
Bed is comfy and staff very friendly und helpful.
I like the location, its 5 min footwalk from east broadway. Ive been to nyc 5 times and spent 2 times in Chinatown. Maybe not the best idea for your first trip, but if you know your way around, its actually cool to live in a not so touristic spot. 
:)
Definitely recommending this one!

title: Amazing stay
text:
We had a lovely stay at Mimosa with the most lovely people working there. They gave us the best advice regarding restaurants, routes and insiders tip China-town suggestions! Also the free coffee and tea is a revelation in New York. 
Thanks for the great stay!

title: Very satisfied, would book again
text:
Room was great with a nice bed, curtains that blocked light very well and windows that were good against most of the noise outside. Could only hear the train once in a while. It was a small but very comfortable room, though I would have liked more plugs at the bedside.
There's a heat lamp in the bathroom that I was very happy about.
Location is within 10 minutes walking distance of different metro and bus stops. Neighbourhood was more fun that Midtown, with better and cheaper eating spots. I'd like to recommend Scarrs pizza!
Reception also provided a good list of restaurants around the neighbourhood, was very happy with this.

Not really bad, but it was very hot in the room. There was a fan provided and opening the window made it a lot better. When asked at the reception, they told me that the ventilation that pumped in hot air could be closed as well (though it did make a squeeky sound) so in the end it all worked out fine. Bathroom was icy cold though!
Bathroom could have been cleaner, the age of it is showing. It's not per se dirty, just a bit worn out/old. I think housekeeping changed my towel even though I left it hanging on the rack to dry and reuse, but that's not really a complaint, I guess?

title: Amazing staff
text: Lovley Hotel with the nicest staff, very helpful. Great WiFi, tea, coffee and snacks at reception and a short walk to many NYC attractions. Grand Street and East Broadway subway stops only 6 min away.

title: Very nice little Hotel in Chinatown
text:
Very nice little Hotel in Chinatown right next to the Manhattan Bridge. Perfect location for exploring Downtown Manhattan by foot, 15 min to Brooklyn Bridge, 20 min walk to WTC.  
The room and bathroom where very clean and comfortable, everything provided for a good stay. Free coffee or tea on the reception, very friendly staff. Was a pleasure staying here.

View from my Hotelroom

title: Relación calidad precio inigualable
text: El hotel está en pleno centro de Chinatown, lleno de comercios y restaurantes en los que probar todo tipo de platos asiáticos. En cuanto al hotel, la relación calidad precio es inmejorable, habitación cálida y grande, buenas vistas al downtown y un baño bastante grande. Como únicas pegas (por buscar algunas) es que la calefacción no es regulable y que el baño algunos días no lo limpiaban muy a fondo, aún así, son pequeños detalles que no ensucian la buena opinión que nos ha dejado. Y gracias por ser tan amables a los recepcionistas! Siempre atentos. Volveremos.

title: Perfect location, amazing hospitality, rare find in NYC!
text: One of my best experiences at a hotel so far! The hotel is located in Chinatown, Lower Manhattan, easily accessible to subway stations Grand Street and East Broadway nearby (5 min walk). The M15 bus stop is also approx. a 1 min walk. There are an insane lot of eatery options around the area. Right when we checked in (around 12:30), the hotel staff gave us an available room even though the check-in time is 16:00.
