We were also provided with a list of recommendations to do/try nearby including a recommended list of restaurants in the area. The staff were very polite and always greeted us whenever we came in or went out. In addition, there is a printer which is very handy and a drinking water facility in the basement where you can refill your water bottle. You can also have coffee. All of them are complimentary. The room including the bathroom was clean and the sheets and towels were changed daily. Shaving razors, toothbrushes and toothpaste were provided. We actually received a lot more than we expected for the price and the location.

title: Fantastic place
text: We stayed for a week at Hotel Mimosa and we are very happy with the service and with the staff, they were very friendly. The location is also great! We will definitely recommend this place to our friends!

title: Great Staff
text: Very helpful staff they provided a great listing for breakfast and lunch and bakery. Great for walking distance to China Town and Little Italy. Very clean room and great hot shower. Overall great experience

title: Top Place to Stay in Manhatten
text: We were happy to have found a great value hotel in Manhatten even before we arrived. As soon as we got there we were treated to first class attentive service. The staff here are phenomenal and will have all the advice you need on local food and attractions. The hotel is located in the heart of chinatown, a short walk from the Brooklyn Bridge, with easy subway access to downtown, midtown, Chelsea and the village on the F line. As well as amazing Asian eateries, the area also has some edgy and cool cafes, dive bars and restaurants nearby. Our room was super comfortable with a really good bed and super thick windows and curtains to keep out the noise and light. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in town.

title: Fantastic quality for the price
text: I stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Mimosa and was really blown away with the quality considering the price.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was small and the amenities basic, but most importantly it was CLEAN AND QUIET.  Their restaurant recommendation list was really spot-on, and well organized by walking distance.  I ate at a different spot each night and was consistently pleased.  Also, they offered a very reasonably priced car service to the airport (they do not offer pick-up).  Were their things that could be better?  Sure.  The light switch in the bathroom needed to be jiggled to stay turned off and a couple other little things like that, but nothing that distracted from my enjoyment of my stay.  Can't recommend them highly enough!

title: Lovely
text: Amazing service and staff hospitality. I totally recommend it! The location is also great, very close to cafes and restaurants, as well metro stations.They also provided cheap taxi to the airport. I will definitely go back to the same hotel.

title: Excellent place for visiting New York City
text:
This hotel is super-OK if want to enjoy New York City in a dynamic way (staying there only to sleep at night and beeing outside visiting the City as a tourist or as a worker the whole day).
I really enjoyed the modern style of the structure. Free and strong Wi-Fi. 100% no-smoking structure, which is great!
The receptionists are really helpful, nice and polite. They speak english very well (this is not the case for all the other chinese restaurants and shops around)
The rooms are not big but absolutely ok if you travel alone or with your partner.
There is no breakfast room or restaurant but they have really cheap snack&drink machines, and free coffee/thè in the hall.
The heater system is centralized, but temperature inside the room was perfect!
I did not use the TV, so I don't know which options and channel are available.
Room and bathroom clean and with all you need for a decent stay.
You will find a lot of chinese restaurant (from luxury to fast-foods) in the streets around and a couple of subway stations about 5 and 10 minutes by foot where you can take the main subway lines to Lower/Midtown Manhattan and Brooklyn.
The World Trade Center, Wall Street District and the Brooklyn Bridge are about 20 minutes by foot from the hotel. Chinatown district is very interesting but a little noisy and dirty.

title: Fabulous!
text: A great choice for your New York trip! It’s so central, allows you to get everywhere easily and the staff were soooo nice! Bed was comfortable. It was very quiet and really relaxing. Highly recommend!

title: Tolle Lage, sauber, freundlich.
text: Zimmer eher klein aber gemütlich und sauber, für die sehr kalten Tage steht ein Heizstrahler im Zimmer bereit. Gute Anbindung an den JFK Flughafen und an viele Sehenswürdigkeiten durch die Metro. Freundliches Personal, kostenlos Kaffee und Tee an der Rezeption. Bei Ankunft im Hotel bekamen wir direkt viele Informationen zu Restaurants und Frühstücksangeboten in der Nähe. Gerne wieder.

title: Friendly visit
text: We had a lovely stay at hotel mimosa! The staff do everything they can to make your stay comfortable. We arrived early morning after a long flight and they checked in early allowing us to rest before exploring the city. We loved their list of recommendations for what to eat and visit. We ate around Chinatown and all their recommendations were excellent! The bedroom was comfy and cosy and the hotel in excellent walking distance to many of the sites. We would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a small but friendly hotel in New York!

title: Very nice!
text:
a nice hotel in chinatown. very friendly staff, clean room! manhatten brigde is close, but the 4-sheet window keeps the noise outside. subway and busstations are very close!
we had a great time and recommend the hotel!

title: Excellent Stay. Highly recommend.
text:
I must have read 100 reviews of 100 hotels in NYC before I found Hotel Mimosa. I’m so glad I waited to book until I found this place. It was the perfect stay. 

The room had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. And I could not believe how quiet the whole building was. This was our first trip to New York, and all anyone told me was how loud the city is. Inside Hotel Mimosa, you could barely hear anything beyond the walls. That was so nice to come back to each night. Very relaxing.

But my favorite thing about Mimosa was the staff. They were friendly, kind and always willing to help with a suggestion for dinner or directions or even just holding the door. Plus, they held our luggage for hours after check out while we did more exploring before our late flight.

If you’re looking for a great place to stay, choose Hotel Mimosa. It’s comfortable, yet posh. It’s affordable. It’s near subway stops that will take you everywhere. It’s charming really. I’m so glad we booked it. My husband and I truly enjoyed our stay.

title: Nice location
text: The hotel is very conveniently located. There are several metro stations nearby. Polite and friendly staff. The room is small but clean. Comfortable bed. Free tea and coffee at the reception. An interesting view from the window.

title: Long weekend get away
text: The hotel was in a great location for the activities we wanted to do and see (911 memorial, One World Tower, and Brooklyn Bridge since all of it was within walking distance. The hotel front desk staff are wonderful. They are very nice and helpful with suggestions and answering questions. I would stay here again when I come back to NYC. Rooms are tiny but that's NYC. Very clean.

title: Super Hotel
text: Das Hotel fliegt nur wenige Gehminuten von 2 U-Bahn Stationen entfernt. In der Gegend (Chinatown) liegen diverse Lokale und Cafes, für die das Hotel sogar eine eigene Empfehlungsliste anbietet. Zusätzlich ein Infoblatt wie man viele Sehenswürdigkeiten am schnellsten erreicht. Die Fenster haben 4 Scheiben und bieten damit eine gute Lärmisolierung, was in Manhattan nie schaden kann, vor allem mit Brücke vor der Türe. In den oberen Stockwerken schöner Blick über die Brücke auf Lower Manhatten. Super freundliches Personal. Wasser um 1$ an der Rezeption und am Automaten.

title: Girls Trip
text: My friends and I decided to stay in New York for the weekend after our trip from Africa. When looking for a hotel we wanted something that was close enough to all of the things we wanted to see. I booked Hotel Mimosa through Expedia. Check in time was 4:00pm which is a little late but it worked out. When we arrived I booked the room for two instead of three. The front desk representative was nice enough to offer us a rollaway and switch us to a bigger room. The room was a little tight but that’s NY for you but super clean. They had some essentials already in the bathroom just in case you forgot your stuff and clean thick towels. Our room was still cold despite the heat being increased and Sam from first services brought us a portable heater to help our FL blood. The customer arrive here was amazing. There wasn’t one thing we asked that wasn’t accommodated. Also the free tea, coffee and candy helped. I’m saving this as my top hotel for my next return to NY!

title: Nice location and nicer receptionists!
text:
Considering the quality/price ratio the hotel was clean, the room had very nice views to NYC and it is in a good location and receptionists were really welcoming and helpful.
Also they have free Nespresso coffee!

title: Wonderful, zero complaints
text: Very friendly and helpful service.  Promptly turned down our heat when asked and gave us ton of suggestions of places to eat in Chinatown.  Great location by manhattan and Brooklyn bridges, and the metro - room was clean, comfortable and SOUNDPROOF from the outside traffic.  Would definitely stay again and recommend!  Affordable, comfortable, great location.  Easy choice.

title: Great
text: The hotel is right in the heart of China Town.  It was small, but functional - just like every other hotel room on the island.  The staff was very friendly and helpful - they are there 24/7.  Great price.

title: New Year’s Eve in good hands
text:
Clean, lovely room, and excellent(!) customer service; [unaffiliated] affordable, overnight parking just up the block; free [very good!] tea and Nespresso in the lobby; and the most comprehensive and well-thought out list of local sights and shops (and subway travel info) I’d ever seen, which they themselves compiled. A house rule of No loud activities in the room after 10pm ensured that we had restful sleep

In short...This independent, small business runs a quality place! We were delighted by the experience, and easily recommend this hotel!

title: Genial
text:
Super bien ubicado en la zona de China Town, bien comunicado, dos paradas de metro muy proximas en menos de 5 min.
Habitación y servicio de habitaciones muy limpio. Recepción abierta 24h con gente muy amable.
Servicio de cafe y te gratuito en el lobby.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text:
Great people, great location and clean rooms!

Thankyou Hotel Mimosa for the fantastic service. Really appreciated😁🙌🏽

The location is perfect, full of local Chinese people. You will get a fantastic view over the Manhattan Bridge!

title: An excellent Xmas stay
text: We felt very welcome in Hotel Mimosa. The room was super clean, every day staff changed the towels and toothbrushes. Tea and coffee at will, also a fridge and a microwave were available to us. Many thanks to all the hotel staff 谢谢!

title: Ottima ospitalità
text:
Albergo molto pulito, personale gentilissimo e disponibile. Il bagno completo e superattrezzato: phon, asciugamani, prodotti da bagno, spazzolini per denti, dentifricio, lametta, crema corpo, pettinino. 
Insomma, superfornito. 
Non fanno colazione ma si può prendere caffè nespresso e thè alla reception gratuiti e quando si vuole. 
La zona è chinatown, tranquillissima e metro a 300 metri aperta h24.
Insomma, consigliatissimo.

title: Great Hotel!
text: The people are super friendly, clean rooms, two metro stations within a 5 min walk and the have a nice list of restaurants and bars to visit nearby the hotel. All in all a great hotel to stay while visiting New York. Would definitely recommend!

title: ¡Fantástico!
text:
El personal es muy amable, es cómodo, las habitaciones limpias y amplias y tienes a tu disposición en todo momento café, infusiones y dulces. 

La ubicación es muy buena, a medio camino entre downtown y Brooklyn y a un paseo de la zona financiera. 

Tiene dos paradas de metro a menos de 5 minutos caminando. 

¡Totalmente recomendable!

title: Parfait
text:
Un hôtel très bien situé proche des stations de métro pour rejoindre le cœur de Manhattan.
Les chambres sont très propres et nous ne manquions de rien (gel douche, brosse à dent, rasoir....). Elles sont très bien insonorisées.
La literie est très confortable.
Mention spéciale pour le personnel qui fut top et à l’écoute de toutes nos demandes. 
Rapport qualité prix + que très bon. 
Si je dois retourner à New York sans hésiter j’irai de nouveau dans cette hôtel.

title: Wonderful service, clean and close to subway
text: My girlfriend and I stayed here during the holidays. Every staffmember treated us like kings and queens. The relaxing ambience upon entering the hotel, free Nespresso coffee, clean and quiet rooms and great access to public transportation made our stay absolutely wonderful. We felt very welcome here and loved it! A big thanks to the hotel staff and owner for making our holidays extra special.

title: Estancia Fantástica
text:
Estuvimos 8 noches en el hotel y la verdad que no tenemos ningún tipo de queja. 
El hotel tiene una muy buena ubicación, situado cerca a dos estaciones de metro, que te permiten llegar a cualquier parte rápidamente. En recepción, te dan bastantes recomendaciones de restaurantes y lugares cercanos que visitar y un mapa con las indicaciones para llegar a las estaciones de metro. El tamaño de la habitación está bien, no es muy grande, pero estuvimos muy cómodos y la limpieza se merece un 10! Destacar el maravilloso trato del personal, son todos muy amables.

title: Accomodating and warm! Great deal.
text: Upon entering this "hidden gem" in the evening, we were greeted with warm individualized service. Lists for a variety of eateries, places for breakfast and maps shared with us along with coffee/tea & candy; they were ready to answer any questions.  Right in Chinatown, easy walking distance to 2 subway stations, the Bowery, East Village, Tribeca & Soho, a cozy retreat away from the hustle and bustle of mid-town Manhattan, where we usually stay. Nice change, ready to do it again. Parking car was easy and less expensive than midtown, too. Previously we have stayed in similarly tiny rooms-- this was as tiny. Clean! Very firm bed, great wifi but tv reception was poor. It didn't matter as TV wasn't necessary. Got a kick out of watching Hill Street Blues and Home Improvement. First night dinner at Yunshang Rice Noodle House. Was pleased to be able to easily store our luggage the entire day we checked as we enjoyed the day in Chinatown. Great breakfast at Two Bridge's Diner; the Eldridge Street Museum Synagogue tour with amazing stories and space; in & out of leather and hat stores; Vanessa's dumplings (highly recommend!) and Michaeli's bakery (Israeli style bubka and other yummies). Next time we'll ask for one of the bigger rooms with just a bit more square footage.

title: Great location and super friendly staff
text:
This is a great little hotel in the perfect location for exploring New York, Mimosa is on the edge of Chinatown near the trendy Lower East Side. Absolutely loads of cool places to eat, drink and visit nearby. 
The staff are super helpful and had some good suggestions. The rooms are fairly small but they generally are in New York. The rooms are clean with good toiletries provided, including fresh toothbrushes and toothpaste and a decent hairdryer. 
Complimentary tea, coffee and candy are available downstairs in the lobby. 
The hotel is only 5-8 min walk from two different subway lines. 
Would definitely recommend.

title: Todo excelente
text:
El hotel muy cómodo, nos quedamos con mi familia de camino a Boston. Excelente disposición de las personas que trabajan en recepción cuando necesitamos algo, recomendación de restaurantes, o un adaptador de enchufe, incluso cuando nuestro secador de pelo estaba malo en la habitación!! 
Volveremos sin duda para una estancia mas larga!!

David, regente del hotel muy cálido y nos dio muchos tips para las siguientes ciudades que visitaremos 👍🏻

title: Great stay!
text: The hotel is within walking distance to the subway and near great food spots and bars. It was easy to get anywhere in the city. The reception was very friendly, they had complimentary tea, coffee and candies in the lobby. This was one of the better priced hotels and had all the amenities we needed. I would stay here again.

title: Leisure !
text:
Me and husband stayed for 4 nights 
The staff were very helpful and polite.
The room was nice and clean ,nice shower .
Although Tea and coffee is downstairs 
They let us borrow a kettle and gave us tea and milk ,being British just can’t do without a cuppa!😀
The train station is only a 10 minute walk
the subway quite easy to work out .
The staff were very helpful and gave us all the info we needed on local  restaurants!

Helina

title: More than I expected from the low price per night
text: We stayed on a Saturday night, just one night for a quick trip to the city. We didn’t want to spend a lot of money to literally stay in a room for nine hours while we slept and got ready. I wasn’t expecting much, considering the local and the price. I was surprised by how much this little gem offers. All the toiletries you need are in your bathroom, very clean rooms and linen, also coffee, tea, and little candy snacks in the small foyer. Our night was quiet too, not a lot of sound from outside carried inside. While you are off the beaten path, it is a great area to familiarize yourself with, go ahead and walk around lots to be offered in this area of Chinatown.

title: Very good!!!
text: Small but functional and clean room, in Chinatown and very close to the subway, line F or line D. Friendly staff and free coffee and tea at the reception. At the arrival they gave us a list of places to dine or do breakfast. Nice!

title: Great value for money. Simple but comfy. Nice staff and great location.
text:
Honestly really good for the price ! 
No fuss but comfortable and clean, rooms are not too small and it’s very close to east village and Wall Street. Free coffee and tea at reception and staff good at recommending places to go . 
Could just do with a better bed.

title:
My Holidays in NYC at Mimosa Hotel/
Mis vacaciones en NYC en el Hotel Mimosa
text:
I spend a faboulous holidays week at Mimosa Hotel. In the middle of Manhattan, good, cheap and clean.

Pasé una fabulosa semana de vacaciones en Mimosa Hotel. En medio de Manhattan, bueno, bonito, barato y limpio.

title: Customer service
text: Since the first day I went to that hotel the communication the honesty and the flexibility was there it made me feel like I was at home they were very kind to me and respected and giving me all the informations good and bad I appreciate that I will be visiting that Hotel in the future excellent hotel also an excellent employee I think his name was Kevin excellent employee all the others also the same, good job bravo Zulu...

title: 2 nights in the City!
text: My friend and I stayed for 2 nights in a room with 2 twin beds. From check in to check out everything was perfect! Clean rooms, fast elevator, candy at the front desk. Staff was wonderful, I will definitely be back!!

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
We stayed at Hotel Mimosa for our 5 night stay in New York. Unfortunately my wife became ill when we arrived and needed to have surgery and stay a night in hospital.
The staff at Hotel mimosa could not do enough for us. We had to delay our flight home and they helped us arrange the extra 3 nights we required and they kept the wheelchair we hired behind reception without fuss.
The hotel itself is very neat and clean, in a great location. It’s a great base for sightseeing with good transport links. It’s fantastic value compared to other NY hotels.
Thanks again to all the staff who helped us through a very stressful time, we hope to visit again some day.
Sarah and Paddy

title: Save your money and book here!
text: When planning our December trip to NY we quickly realised staying in midtown Manhattan would set us back 400 average a night. We found this hotel in Chinatown and couldn’t have asked for more. It was half the price, beside two subway stations, walking distance to Wallstreet and the Staten Island Ferry. Staff were super helpful with directions and info on where to eat locally. We booked a Superior room and it was clean and cosy after our long days exploring the city. Save your money and stay in this hotel. You won’t feel like you’ve sacrificed anything. Once you’re comfortable walking (the best way to see the city) and getting the subway you couldn’t ask for more with this hotel.

title: Convenient little hotel in the heart of Chinatown
text: We came here toward the end of summer. It's in a weird 5 way busy intersection so uber stopping was very rushed. There are a couple subway stations within 10 minutes walk so it's very convenient, but the streets in the area are really dark at night since the stores close decently early. Luckily a lot of restaurants do delivery here later at night. The room is clean and cozy! I would come back again.

title: Great Chinatown Boutique Hotel
text: We loved it!  The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was squeaky clean. They did a great job of creating a serene and comfortable environment. Bed was super comfy with nice linens. We really enjoyed our stay!

title: Hidden GEM!
text: Who needs midtown when you can experience culture, amazing restaurants, easily accessibly to transit  and conveniently located to the best of NYC! David and his staff were super informative and always willing to give great suggestion and recommendations. Clean and will appointed rooms with 24 h coffee and tea.

title: Manhatten family trip
text:
We stayed here the first long weekend of December 2019. 

We really cannot find fault with this small but very clean family ran hotel.

The staff are very polite and professional and go above and beyond to make your stay as enjoyable as they can.
As it's not in the main tourist area, prices are somewhat less expensive than uptown, however, the hotel is well placed for the Metro and walking distance to Battery Park for Ellus Island trips and The 9/11 Memorial. 

If you want a great all american breakfast bar head to the Tria Diner  just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Enjoy.

title: Lovely stay in the center of New York!
text:
We had the loveliest experience at hotel Mimosa! 
The staff was so helpful and our room was simple yet included everything we needed. It was our first trip to New York, so I don't know if it's common in other hotels but I was very impressed that they had even provided toothpaste AND toothbrushes, I have never encountered this in other hotels. Especially after a long flight, small things like that can really make such a difference - plus points for that. 
The hotel is located at a relatively noisy corner, however we were not really bothered by it as the windows block the noise quite well. That being said, I also think it's one of the most vibrant and authentic neighbourhoods in the city, so don't miss the opportunity to explore it further. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Excellent rapport qualité-prix
text: Le personnel est très aimable et la chambre était propre. L'hôtel est très bien situé, à proximité du Lower East Side et de plusieurs stations de métro, avec en prime un petit air de Shanghai dans le quartier !…

title: Accueil parfait
text:
La chambre est calme et propre, le personnel efficace et chaleureux. 100% satisfait ! 
L'hôtel est très bien situé (enfin ça dépend où vous allez : c'est au cœur de Chinatown dans Manhattan à proximité du pont de Brooklyn).

title: Holiday
text: Great location, Subway and bus within 5 minuten walk. Lovely staff! Free - Nespresso! - coffee and tea. The bed is a welcome and great place after a long day of walking around NYC. Small but clean room. Highly recommended!

title: Wow ! What A find
text:
Basically booked on the recommendations from TA.
We spent just the one night here before flying back to the UK.
If you're looking for a 'spotlessly clean, comfortable, and run by fantastic hosts' place to stay in the heart of Chinatown.....THIS IS IT !!
From the moment we arrived to when we left we felt like family and were looked after superbly.
Don't be put off by the proximity to the rail bridge...we didn't hear it at night, so never spoilt, what was a great, comfortable sleep.
The area you are in is very much a 'working suburb' and at times you feel like you could be in the Far East. So expect bustle and hustle, but in a good way.
Take the recommendations from staff on where to eat..you wont go wrong...trust me, just tell them what your looking for and they will put you right.
Incredible value for money and would happily go again.
We used their taxi service to get back to JFK - far far better than a yellow cab, and picks you up outside the door..effortless and very good value for money, but note it is cash only.
At the time of writing it cost us $42 + tip
Thanks for a great stay (and hope you get the pods from LIDL sorted...).
Very very happy to recommend, you wont be disappointed....

title: On recommande
text:
Une semaine passée là-bas, l’hôtel est très propre, la chambre est largement suffisante pour le temps que l’on y passe. 
Deux stations de métro proches de l’hôtel permettent de rejoindre le centre touristique de Manhattan en à peine 15/20 min. 
Nous avons apprécié la proximité du pont de Brooklyn et du musée du 11/09 ! 
Rapport qualité/prix excellent et une mention spéciale pour le personnel de l’établissement : toujours le sourire et un mot gentil.

title: An excellent hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Really lovely staff, very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was clean, peaceful and in an ideal location. Would definitely recommend to those wanting to stay outside of the centre. Good subway connections to all of the attractions.

title: Very happy with the hotel
text: There was a very warm welcome on arrival and during our stay. Coffee and tea available at all times in reception so great when you come back on a cold day 😊 about 5-10 mins walk from East Broadway subway station and 10-15 mins from grand street station. About 30 min walk to WTC. The hotel gives a list of food recommendations on arrival and a list of directions to tourist sites. Room is small but very clean. 😊

title: Goede prijs kwaliteit verhouding
text: Een betaalbaar hotel in Chinatown. Vlak bij twee metrostations. Tegenover de Manhattan brigde, maar geen geluidsoverlast door 4 dubbele beglazing. Wat wel fijn was, was dat je het raam wel even open kon zetten om te luchten. Schone kamers, werd iedere dag bijgehouden. Wij hadden een kingsize room, deze was voor New Yorkse begrippen ruim met een lekker groot bed en ruime badkamer. Beneden bij de receptie stond onbeperkt koffie en thee en een grote schaal snoep. Vanaf dit hotel veel leuke restaurantjes op loopafstand. In een kwartiertje lopen in het hippere Nolita en Soho. Maar om de hoek ook leuke ontbijtrestaurants. Ik raad het hotel zeker aan.

title: Superb Hotel
text: Fantastic Hotel, right in the middle of China Town. Very safe to walk around at night. We were out at 2.00 in the morning after going to a Bar!  And Im 64.New Yorkers are VERY friendly and helpful, Loved the Diners and restaurants, don't forget to go to the HOUDINI museum.

title: Comfortable, quiet, friendly, great location
text: This was the second time I stayed at Hotel Mimosa and again it did not disappoint. The front desk team is always friendly and helpful; coffee and tea is a nice plus; a firm and comfortable bed; plenty of toiletries; excellent soundproofed windows so no city noise; and an excellent location.

title: 12 giorni a NY
text: Ho soggiornato con la mia ragazza per ben 11 notti in questo hotel. Posizione ottima sia per bus che per metro. Camera piccolina ma confortevole e soprattutto pulitissima. Pulizie e cambio biancheria venivano effettuati giornalmente. Quartiere molto tranquillo. Staff super gentile pronto ad offrirvi caffè (espresso) o infusi a qualsiasi orario. Staff gentilissimo che ci ha consegnato mappa della città e una lista di punti di interesse nei pressi dell’ hotel con relativo percorso per arrivarci. Rapporto qualità prezzo super. Decisamente consigliato.

title: Super!
text:
A great find in Manhattan. If you're budget conscious yet still wish to stay on the main island, I must recommend this place situated near the mouth of the Manhattan Bridge.

LOCATION
In a very 'real' if somewhat unassuming part of Chinatown, surrounded by great food and lots of everyday activity. Felt like a safe area, no issue walking around at night. East Broadway subway station is very close by, for quick access to all the main sights. The financial district and WTC is walk-able from here if you're up to it.

ROOM
Comfortable and clean, they appear to be fairly recently refurbed/redecorated. Our king room wasn't particularly big, but it's plenty of space to base yourself for an exploratory city break. The bed was great, enabling some healthy and much-needed rest. The bathroom was clean, the shower had strong pressure and ran nice and hot. Also provided were full sized body wash, shampoo and conditioner bottles, as opposed to the mini ones you tend to get. A couple of nice additions were the provision of a disposable razor, toothbrushes, toothpaste and a comb. We were initially concerned about the noise of general traffic and subway trains on the bridge - very evident outside, but once inside, the room was well soundproofed, with extra glazing on the windows to subdue the noise. No problem getting to sleep.

STAFF
A very friendly welcome, and provided good local information.

title: Excellent quality/price ratio
text:
Really friendly staff, they gave us some tips (restaurants, etc) of the surroundings. 

The room was little but clean, the same as the bathroom. 

It is close to subway and the neighbourhood is full of live during day and quiet during night, although you can fins many restaurants to have dinner or have a drink.

title: Very good value in Manhattans lower east side
text:
Exceptionally friendly staff. Clean rooms of good size. Despite location with direct view of Manhattan Bridge surprisingly quiet and comfortable.
5 Min walk from East Broadway M Station and easy Walking to Chinatown.
All in all very good value for Manhattan.

title: 3 days in NYC
text: Friendly staff, clean rooms. Room was not the biggest we've been it, but I'll take clean over big anyday. Room was surprisingly quiet and all quest respected the quiet times. I would definitely stay here again and recommend my friends.

title: Parfait
text:
Parfait pour visiter New York 
3 stations de metro dans un rayon de 5m à pied
Quartier dépaysant 
Si vous prévoyez d aller à Brooklyn c est à juste deux stations de métro 

Hôtel très bien insonorisé calme et très propre 
Personnel très agréable 
Et chambre confortable 
Une très bonne adresse anew York à un budget raisonnable

title: Hotel Mimosa NYC
text: Great spot ! Great Staff!! Close to china town and Little Italy!  Easy transportation on subway . Great value ! Clean room! From check in to check out the staff took great care of us. Suggested restaurants and great local spots when we checked in.

title: Budget friendly Hotel
text:
Perfect place for people visiting New York on a budget. 
The staff were always friendly and available to answer questions, when we arrived they had a little welcome pack pointing out a list of places to eat in the area and how to get to the nearest subway stops. 
The room was clean but very small however as we were out exploring all day this was not an issue. Storage in the room consists of 2 small drawers and a small hanging rail with hangers, the drawers were only big enough for underwear. I piled my t-shirts onto the bottom shelf of the hanging rail and then hung my jumpers and trousers up. I used the end of the rail for coats. Under the bed is big enough for cases, shoes and shopping.
The bed was comfortable and the curtains blocked out the light well, we were on the 5th floor.
The hotel is right next to a subway line so you can hear the trains go by however the soundproofing is thick enough that it didn't keep us awake. They have a quiet policy from 10 pm - 8 am and it was rare that I heard the other guests making noise. 
We travelled with hand luggage only so we used the provided toiletries (shampoo, conditioner & shower gel) which were lovely, smelt like oranges. They also provided toothbrushes, toothpaste and a razor (all wrapped) which we didn't need.
The basement has a little area with a computer and printer (I had to print one trip voucher out) a vending machine and a fridge for storing food (we put some breakfast items in there for when we had an early start one day). They provide a pen and post-it notes so you can label your food.
We always walked to Grand St subway stop (about 5 mins) as it had access to the B & D line which takes you to most of the tourist areas, this means walking past a park where it was lovely so see groups of people doing Tai-Chi in the morning.
On the last day they were happy to lock our bags up so that we could continue exploring until the taxi came to pick us up, they gave me the matching tag so that no-one else could take our bags.

title: Lovely stay in Chinatown
text: Friendly and welcoming staff, provided local restaurant/bar recommendations which was a nice touch. Clean room and bathroom. Located in Chinatown so a good selection of restaurants in the area. Walkable to Broadway, One World Trade and East Village. Located within 7 minute walk of East Broadway and Grand Street subway stations. Very good hotel in a good spot. We will definitely return

title: Great base to explore lower Manhattan.
text:
Friendly and helpful staff.  Compact, clean room overlooking the street and bridge.  Excellent soundproofing means very little noise inside the hotel.  
Near to buses and subway as well as being very walkable to Chinatown, Little Italy, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge etc.

title: Small but super friendly hotel under the bridge
text: If you are looking for more reasonably priced lodging in NYC, and especially if you plan to spend most of your time downtown, Hotel Mimosa will be hard to beat.  The rooms are quite small (to be expected) but the staff goes above and beyond to be helpful and kind.  The subway noises did not bother us (even though we had a close-up view of the Manhattan bridge/train from our window) the blackout curtains did their job, the bed was super firm but comfortable, and everything was clean.  Their kurig style espresso machine was better than most, and we were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go.

title: Nice stay
text:
The room was very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was a good quality and they gave you free toothbrushes, soap and even a shaver. The metro running next to it was not annoying but you could hear it once in while. Clean bed and towels every day and some nice information about where to go in Manhattan. 
The hallway noises were sometimes annoying you did not feel you were in a soundproof private room. 
Overall a nice stay for a nice price/quality.

title: Amazing stay in Chinatown
text: We stayed here for 2 nights post marathon and we absolutely loved it. We could not have received a more friendly welcome and the staff and owner went out of their way to make us feel at home. This is a brilliant location in Chinatown and despite being close to the bridge/railway, we had the best night’s sleep in the city, all thanks to the double glazed windows. Exceptional value for money and loved all the little extras such as the free toiletries, free tea and coffees and of course the reception sweets (candies). The hotel’s recommendations of restaurants and bars in the area were also spot on. We wouldn’t stay anywhere else now when we visit New York as we loved this neighbourhood and this hotel. Thank you so much from your happy visitors from North Wales, UK.

title: Lovely stay
text:
We chose this hotel due to the TA reviews and can confirm they are spot on. The hotel is in a brilliant location for 3 subways and has such friendly helpful staff.
Yes the rooms are small but are well equipped and have such comfy beds and nice linen. We appreciated the great  coffee machine and candy at reception, thank you. We also used the computer and printer for our boarding cards in the basement where there is a kitchen that is well equipped. 
We loved our stay here and will book again. Thank you to all the staff at the Mimosa.

title: Buena localización y Servicio
text:
Lo mejor del hotel es la buenísima localización en Chinatown, ya que se encuentra a 10 min de diferentes estaciones de metro y además puedes ir a muchos sitios caminando de la zona de Downtown, Soho, Greenwich...  
El personal del hotel fue muy amable y nada más llegar nos dieron varios folletos y páginas con información de restaurantes, tiendas y sitios que visitar en la zona. También hay café gratuito para los huéspedes del hotel.
La habitación no es muy grande, pero la cama es cómoda y el baño tiene un buen tamaño y surtido de champú, gel, acondicionador... tiene secador de pelo. 
Repetiría!

title: Good 2 night stay
text: Very high standard and staff were extremely helpful. Could leave bags there as room wasn't ready, when we arrived later that evening the bags were in our room. Did not eat here, cant comment but there is an amazing selection of restaurants, cafes etc within walking distance. The hotel provides a list of anything you could think of in the locality. Location is only a couple mins walk from subway, metro and the normal & hop-on/off bus tour. The value compared to other places seemed good, location etc means a lot. They also arranged a good value taxi to the airport

title: Excellent hotel, dépaysant, confortable et trés bon acceuil
text:
Hotel au coeur de Chinatown, depaysement garanti !! 
Les chambres sont spacieuses et trés bien insonorisées (Quadruple vitrage).
Le personel est trés serviable, differentes sortes de thé sont disponibles à l'acceuil, du café dans la chambre, tout est parfait

title: Trip of 10 days un hôtel mimosa was perfect
text: The hotel is very well located (in chinatown, near to the manhattan bridge) the Room was very clean and quiet, the staff was kindly, everything was perfect, I recommand this hotel, we will come back for sure

title: Hôtel très sympa !
text: Proche du métro, dans le quartier dépaysant de Chinatown, vous serez accueillis avec du bon café ou thé et des confiseries ! L’équipe est au top, les chambres ont tout le confort nécessaire, je recommande !

title: 3 days in New York
text: The hotel is in a strategic area. Close to all amenities and especially the underground station. The rooms are small but cost. Bathrooms have the calefactor so is a pleasure to have a shower. The neighborhood is very noisy from early morning but thanks to the docks glasses you don’t hear a thing! The staff is amazing. You can ask them literally everything and they find a solution. Highly recommend!!!

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Hôtel situé dans Chinatown, en bordure du Mannathan Bridge et de sa voie ferrée. L'isolation phonique des chambres fait qu'on n'entend aucun bruit de l'extérieur fenêtres fermées.
L'accueil est très agréable : nous avons pu déposer nos bagages le matin de l'arrivée et les laisser jusqu'au soir du départ.
Le réceptionniste remet à l'arrivée un grand nombre d'informations (transports en commun à proximité, points d'intérêts touristiques et comment y aller, restaurants, ...)
L'hôtel ne sert pas de petit déjeuner, mais à NY ce n'est pas un problème !
Nous reprendrons cet hôtel si nous retournons à NYC.

title: Quick discovery New York
text: I was only in New York for 2 nights and this stay at hotel Mimosa was perfect for me : good location close from Manhattan and metro stations, clean and convenient room with confortable bed and no noise from outside thanks to doble windows, bathroom with all toilets necessary, and great hospitality of the staff. They gave you all the information you needed and assistance when needed (taxi arrangement, adresses of restaurant, …). I fully recommend this hotel also for the price very honest for this level of service and would like to come back here if I will return to New York !

title: First visit in NY
text:
Our first time in New York. The hotel is set in Chinatown, near the Manhattan Bridge.
Good accessibility by public transport or taxis.
The hotel staff is very kind, helpful in whatever it takes.
Interesting and colorful neighborhood, many restaurants and shopping places.

title: New york
text: the hospitality was impeccable. Such kindness when we checked in and they gave us a list of breakfast places, restaurants around the area and a list of popular tourist sites with how long it took to get there and their opening hours. The room was very clean with a modern design and the room was very quiet, the bed extra comfortable. We stayed at some more expensive hotels before this stay in Boston and this hotel mimosa totally outclassed them in comfort and hospitality. Had shampoo and conditioner, toothpaste and tooth brushes available. Coffee and tea you could have complimentary downstairs. We had a lovely time!

title: 6 Days in Manhattan
text:
We will definitely return to Manhattan and we will definitely stay at Hotel Mimosa again!
A very clean Hotel with an extraordanary friendly staff. We were lucky to have chosen this hotel. 
The Subway Station is around the corner and that is everything you need in Manhattan . Hope to return soon. 
With friendly regards 
Kirsten and Klaus Woköck from Germany

title: dont hesitate to book
text: We have really enjoyed our stay. Very well equipped clean room, most comfortable bed,extremely kind staff. Free coffee and candies, list of restaurant with recommendations prepared for the guests. 5/5!

title: Excellent price/quality ratio, clean and service oriented hotel!
text:
We stayed 6 nights at the Mimosa and we found it absolutely perfect.
Location-wise, it worked out very well: walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, Soho and East Village. 3 metro stations at walking distance.
The staff at the reception was super friendly and proactive:lots of info available, complimentary coffee and tea at reception, computer with printer, vending machine with 1$ drinks, umbrellas to borrow. On our departure day, they ordered a carvto the airport at a very convenient price.
The room size was in line with NYC standards, but very clean and very silent. Lots of toiletries available.
We will certainly go back!!!

title: Fantastic stay
text:
Hotel Mimosa is very good; nice room, very good bed, lovely shower, everything is very clean, friendly employees, subway stations nearby. There are running trains nearby, but no noise, the room is very good isolated.
Very good price for very good quality!

title: Vakantie
text: Gastvrij, schoon, perfecte ligging tov Soho, Bowery en Tribeca. Vriendelijk personeel, elke dag keurige kamers en schone handdoeken. 10 min wandelen naar tribeca, Soho. Leuke tentjes in de buurt. Metro zeer dichtbij. Hartje Chinatown.

title: Fantatic
text: What a gem! On the edge of Chinatown. The staff are very gracious, attentive, and very accommodating. Wonderful stay. The rooms do not have coffee makers or refrigerators, but is tea, coffee, etc in the lobby and a communal refrigerator in the basement, along with an ice machine, computer w/printer and soda/snacks machine.

title: 3 day NYC family holiday
text: Good budget hotel in lower Manhattan. Very freindly staff in the hotel, they help us with everything. The hotel is good located downtown Manhattan. The Hotel offer no breakfast but there are plenty good bakery's around to buy good breakfast. The free coffee, thee and candy in the lobby was very nice. The free umbrella's very helpfull !

title: Delivered A Great Experience
text: This is a no nonsense hotel in Chinatown that I would recommend to anyone who is budget conscious and who knows what they want from their New York experience. Hotel Mimosa's staff had the vibe of generous AirBnB hosts rather than your generic staff at another chain hotel. The rooms were unbelievably quiet, considering they're right next to the train tracks. I'm excited for my next stay there!

title: Very friendly, clean comfortable chinatown hotel
text: We Stayed 3 nites. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our Room was tiny, but clean and quiet. The bathroom was quite spacious. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Expresso and tea in the lobby was a plus. Convenient location. I will definitely stay here again

title: RELACION CALIDAD-PRECIO EXCELENTE!!!!
text: Estuve alojada en este hotel con mi familia del 02 al 09 de Octubre y tengo que decir que el hotel es fantastico. El personal es super amable, te explican todo , sitios donde comer etc... tienen cafetera en recepcion y tambien unos dulces. Tienen servicio de taxi para el aeropuerto que esta muy bien de precio.Tienen tambien paraguas para dejarte y el dia de nuestra salida nos guardaron las maletas hasta la tarde que cogiamos el vuelo.  Las habitaciones son pequeñas pero en Nueva York es normal, no tienen armario solo un colgador para la ropa, y no estaria mal que hubiera una pequeña nevera pero  las habitaciones estan muy bien, tienen secador de pelo, productos de aseo. La zona de chinatown esta muy bien comunicada , al lado del hotel hay dos estaciones de metro, sin duda recomiendo este hotel si quieres gastarte poco dinero, simplemente para dormir y descansar en Nueva York esta estupendamente . Felicito enormemente al personal por su amabilidad y trato recibido. Muchas gracias

title: Sehr zentrale Lage zu einem fairen Preis.
text:
Zimmer war absolut groß genug für zwei Personen, das Bad war sehr geräumig. Zentrale Lage - vieles ist zu Fuß erreichbar. Sehr gut von JFK mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln erreichbar. Von unserem Zimmer im 6. Stock hatten wir einen schönen Ausblick auf das One World Trade Center. Sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Personal.
Da direkt nebenan die Subway über die Manhattan Bridge donnert, ist die Doppelverglasung mehr als sinnvoll und hält den heftigsten Lärm ab. Für Lärmempfindliche sind die Ohrstöpsel sicher eine Lösung für die Nacht ... aber eigentlich ist New York grundsätzlich nichts für lärmsensible Menschen :-)

title: ﻿Impeccable Service
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel for a few nights while my apartment was being renovated.  It’s a small charming hotel with 30 rooms but very big on service. I just loved their attention to detail.  My room was quiet and very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to all.

title: Kommen wieder
text: Sehr freundliches und hilfsbereites Hotel. Die Lage ist sehr gut und die Anbindung perfekt. Fúr alle Anliegen gibt es Hilfe vom Personal. Werden bestimmt wieder kommen. Die Zimmer haben für New York Verhältnisse eine gute Größe und sind sehr sauber.

title: A little gem
text:
This is the 4th time we have stayed in NYC and the hotels are generally a bit of a letdown, especially for the price you pay.  Hotel Mimosa really is a hidden gem.  Don't be put off by the 2 star status, they provide 5 star service.  Rooms are small (but not the smallest we've stayed in in NYC).  Bathroom is reasonably sized with an overbath shower.  (I usually hate shower curtains, but this one was spotless and had magnets to keep it in place.)  There were plentiful toiletries and extras provided (e.g. toothbrushes, razor, shower caps).  
We were in room 206, it is VERY close to the Manhattan bridge, and even with the quadruple glazing, you can hear the subway rumbling past.  I didn't find this annoying, however the soundproofing INSIDE the hotel is poor (if other guests don't whisper in corridors, you can hear every word they say and I heard someone's phone alarm going off one morning).  If other guests are considerate, this won't be a problem.  
Some of the lovely touches:  we were celebrating my hubby's 40th and there was a balloon bouquet in the room awaiting us, such a lovely touch.  There's free Nespresso and tea in the hotel lobby (as well as complimentary candy!), and bottled water can be purchased for $1.  
There's an ice machine in the basement, as well as a communal fridge.  I thought this was fantastic.  
The aircon is centrally controlled and the room did get very warm, even in October.  If you phone reception they will adjust this for you as many times as you wish.  You really feel that nothing is too much trouble.
The closest subway lines are 6 and 8 minutes away (East Broadway and Grand Street).  The hotel provides printed maps and information about how to get to all major attractions from Mimosa.
Staying in Chinatown is really an experience, there are sights, sounds and smells everywhere you go, it is colourful and vibrant, although some parts are run down.
The hotel organised transport back to JFK airport for us, it was a private transfer and cost less than what we paid for a shared ride with Super Shuttle on the way in.  
Would I stay here again?  Absolutely!

title: Escape from tourist traps
text:
A great location in the middle of Chinatown a short walk to subway station and Little Italy.

We arrived at 2am and staff very friendly and helpful from start to finish.  

Booked a taxi back to JFK at $48 which was much cheaper than when we arrived, left our bags with reception and explored more before returning for cab.

Our room was clean and good size. Opposite the Manhattan Bridge and we had no issue with noise.

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Kirill
text: Wonderfull hotel in good place near to main NY sightseeing. Nice friendship staff who could help and advise where and when to go. 5 min walk subway station to the center of Manhattan. We enjoyed our stay.

title: best cost quality
text: The rooms are small, but for these rates in the heart of NYC it's a good deal. Super friendly and helpful, with AMAZING Asian food all around,as you are in the middle of Chinatown, and subway 5 minutes away. If you're looking for a place to sleep and save money for the city, and you will need every dollar, Mimosa fits perfectly. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again

title: Great hotel in Chinatown!
text: My mum and I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mimosa. I had heard stories of box rooms in New York hotels, but was pleasantly surprised by the size of our twin room. It was well-equipped with a stunning bathroom. Our view wasn't particularly good, but we didn't go to New York to stare out of a window. What really made our stay, however, was the friendliness of the hotel staff. They were absolutely delightful, and always happy to talk to us about our day or help us with any queries. The bowl of sweets and coffee machine on the front desk were also a great touch! The location of the hotel ideal for us; a few minutes' walk from the F line Subway, which took us straight to all the action in around 10 minutes. In the opposite direction, Wall Street was a nice stroll away, along with the docks to catch the commuter ferry up towards the Empire State Building. Overall, a cracking stay!

title: Vraiment satisfait
text: Nous avons y séjourné pendant dix jours, nous sommes très satisfaits et vous recommandons vivement. L’hôtel est situé dans le chinatown, dans le sud de Manhattan, très commode pour visiter New York. Les transports en commun sont à proximité, aucune difficulté pour trouver un taxi. Pour visiter wall street, World Trade Mémorial, Brooklyn etc on peut tout faire à pied.  Les réceptionnistes ont très gentils et très serviables. Ils sont à nos écoute. Le fait d’avoir une machine Nespresso à la disposition, c’est un plus. Le lit est très confortable, le ménage est très bien fait tous les jours de nos séjours. Pour aller à l’aéroport, on vous conseille d’en parler au réceptionniste, il téléphone à un chauffeur, on a payé beaucoup moins cher qu’un taxi normal, on peut payer par CB.

title: Best hotel room I ever had in NYC!
text: This was the best hotel and hotel room I ever had in NYC!  The view from my room was fantastic!  I love the fact that the no smoking rule is strictly enforced throughout the hotel, and I also loved the location.  The room and hotel were very quiet and the staff were amazing.  I will stay here next time i'm in NYC.

title: A race weekend
text: A new go to place in the lower East side. Great staff, very friendly and helpful.  This hotel is a diamond in the rough and made me feel welcomed.  Clean neat and well made room with everything you could need.

title: Great hotel Downtown Chinatown
text:
We had a fantastic four night stay in this small and friendly hotel.
Nice touches include bathroom extras like toothbrush, toothpaste and disposable razor.
Rooms were clean and bed large and comfy.
Liked the drinks and sweets(candy) in reception.
We were also given maps and local recommendations for breakfast and dinner.
We will recommend to our friends.

title: City Trip
text:
Tolles kleines Hotel! Sehr sauber und die Lage ist für einen intensiven Stadttrip ideal!
Würden es auf jeden Fall wieder buchen😊

Man ist super schnell bei den Hotspots in Downtown und wenn man das quirlige Leben mag ein toller Spot! Besonders SoHo ist in gehweite und einfach genial.

title: Super Hotel mit tollem Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis
text: Wir waren 6 Nächte im Hotel Mimosa. Entschieden haben wir uns dafür, weil die Bewertungen auf booking.com und tripadvisor.com gut waren. Wir hatten win Doppelzimmer mit Bad mit Badewanne. Das Bett war sehr bequem, die Einrichtung modern, auch wenn das Zimmer selbst nicht sehr groß war. Es war sehr sauber, tägliches Housekeeping. Die Lage ist super, mitten in Chinatown. Lasst euch nicht davon abschrecken, in der Nähe gibt es tolle Restaurants und Diners, man muss es nur sehen wollen, und sehr viel billiger als Uptown. Das Personal war suuuuuper freundlich zu jeder Tageszeit und hatte immer super Tipps bereit. Alles in allem waren wir sehr zufrieden, wenn wir wieder nach New York kommen, werden wir wieder hier übernachten.

title: Excellent stay
text: Extremely friendly and helpful reception staff. Arranged taxi transfer back to JFK at fraction of the cost of our arrival taxi and all worked out perfectly. Driver arrived early, clean, comfortable car, no issues. Hotel in great location for sightseeing, local restaurants, interesting Chinatown markets and stores. A little noisy from the railway but not bad. Very clean with all required facilities. Free coffee/tea in reception all day. Would highly recommend.

title: Cosy Hotel in a Convenient Location
text:
We spent a plesant week here, the location's great for food in Chinatown & easy access to the rest of Manhattan via subway. The only negative I can say is that there is some noise from the Manhatten Bridge, but it never disturbed our sleep.
On the plus side the staff were very friendly & helpful, including giving us some useful pamphlets covering how to travel to various popular attractions & a guide to local restaurants; we tried 4 of these & they were all excellent.
The room itself was clean & the bed comfortable. Whilst there is no catering onsite, there is a coffee machine, vending machine & fridge you can store food in.

title: Short stay
text:
I would describe this Hotel as a boutique hotel. It is quaint and compact but delightful. Room, sheets & towels beautifully clean. Enough sockets, and shower in bath is excellent. Not sure about a plug for the bath, so shower it is! Bath is slightly “sunken” so easier to get in/out.

Not used to quite a compact room, so have bashed my leg a few times on the metal bed corner (not good) but will get used to it before long!

Staff friendly and can’t be more helpful.

Particularly like the sweet dish in reception, which is where you obtain your free teas and coffees.

We have a room overlooking the train line, and they are quite frequent during the day, but not an issue for us and there is double or triple glazing.

All in all, would recommend and definitely choose to stay here again if ever we come back.

title: Friendly and Quaint
text: Everyone woking at Hotel Mimosa was so kind and accommodating. I was given food and drink recommendations in the area upon check in and was welcomed with tea and espresso. The room was immaculate and I felt very taken care of. I definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Great little place
text: Though the room was small it was adequate and comfortable. It was also quite quiet considering that it was right by the Manhattan Bridge was outside our window. The staff were incredibly pleasant, cheerful and eager to help. Upon arrival they furnished us with information on how to get around and what was in the immediate area for eating. They even went across the street to verify that the pharmacy had bus passes available for purchased and arranged transport to the cruise ship terminal for us. It is very close to public transit. The only downfall was no breakfast. I would stay here again!

title: Great three days stay
text:
Location is excellent. Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful. They can’t do enough for you. Room is small but clean and has everything we needed. Plenty of restaurants close by and we even received plenty of recommendations from the owner, David.
Subway station is within 10 minutes walk. F train took us right to middle of Manhattan without changing lines. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Parfait
text:
Ce petit hôtel est très bien situé dans Manhattan, à côté des transports en commun et de toutes les commodités.
L'isolation est assez bonne pour dormir au calme, la literie est parfaite et la salle de bain agréable.
Le personnel est extrêmement souriant et serviable, merci à eux.
Nous recommanderons l'Hôtel Mimosa avec plaisir!

title: Location! Location! Locations!
text: This hotel not only has a great location, but a fabulous staff too.  They go above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  The room is small like all other NYC hotels especially in Chinatown, but it’s clean and comfortable.  We frequently visit NYC and will definitely stay here again.

title: Hidden Gem in Chinatown
text: What a quiet , clean, friendly oasis in the heart of Chinatown.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They even gave a list of restaurant recommendations and an umbrella to take on a rainy day!  Not to mention the Nespresso machine in the lobby.  Will definitely be back.

title: Great overnight stay
text: This is my second time using this hotel in the area and so far my favorite. The atmosphere is wholehearted and the staff is very friendly. I found everything I needed easily in the area and as for the room(s) they’ve all been up to par. Will be using again.

title: Hotel mimosa
text:
Thor was an great hotel and the straff was very Nice and helpsome.
Would recomand this hotel and invierment. 

They had alternativer for food metro system and shopping. We tolk the Train to brooklyn and vent shopping at century2, IT was 6 minutts trainride😀

title: Por ese precio en Manhattan excelente.
text:
Reservamos el hotel a muy buen precio con 10 meses de antelación. Queríamos quedarnos en Manhattan con habitación y baño privado, pero los precios eran desorbitados con las condiciones que nosotros requeríamos. Vimos que en Tripavidsor todo el mundo hablaba bien del Hotel Mimosa y que tenía buenas conexiones con el metro.., y por 9 noches en Manhattan con baño y habitación privada no tenía competencia.
Ya sabíamos que el metro pasaba al lado y que el doble acristalamiento conseguía aislar el ruido..., cierto, no se escuchaba casi nada. También leímos que las habitaciones estaban limpias y que la cama era cómoda.., confirmado.., todo limpio y cama confortable.., descansamos muy bien. El personal del hotel aunque no hablen español siempre nos ayudaron y nos trataron bien.., nos dejaron guardar las maletas, había café y chuches gratis en recepción, nos prestaron paraguas el día que llovió, etc.., buen servicio. La habitación era algo pequeña.., pero normal en Nueva York. El metro está cerca, como a 10 minutos caminando y las conexiones son buenas.
La única pega es lo del aire acondicionado que no se puede regular, apagar o encender.., es fijo. También lo sabíamos antes de hacer la reserva, pero el problema es que dos días antes de viajar cogí un resfriado, y al llegar allí estando enfermo el aire no me ayudo mucho.., mas bien me ayudó a empeorar. Repito que ya lo sabíamos así que tuve mala suerte.
La zona no está mal.. es una zona bastante concurrida y a pesar de las apariencias nunca tuvimos sensación de inseguridad.., eso si, nunca llegamos mas tarde de las 23:00. 
Recomendaría este hotel sin dudarlo ya que en otros sitios en el centro te cobran muchísimo mas, está cerca del puente de Brooklyn y del distrito financiero y a un par de paradas de metro de Times Square.

title: Great hotel, top notch customer service
text:
I stayed one night while on business in the city. The service was exceptional. The staff was courteous and pleasant. 

The room was clean, neat and the bed was comfortable. It was quiet even with a Subway nearby. I would highly recommend Mimosa to anyone who is visiting New York.

title: Very nice, centrally located hotel
text: The room was very tiny, but I think in Manhattan you can't expect anything else for the prize. Unfortunately we couldn't control the air condition, it was nonstop on. Though it was okay because outside it was very loud due to the Manhattan Bridge in front of the building, so that you couldn't really open the windows. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Distance to sbubway station was good (5 minutes to East Broadway), but from there you often have to change train. Canal Street was better, but not so close.

title: Super Preis-/Leistungsverhältnis, sauber, freundliches Personal
text: Das Hotel liegt Chinatown an der Rampe zur Manhattan Bridge. Das Zimmer, welches wir hatten, lag im 1. OG, war hell und sauber, klimatisiert, Flachbildschirmfernseher,  eigenes Bad mit Badewanne, Duschfunktion. Zum Lärmschutz waren zusätzliche Fenster eingebaut. Das Zimmer wurde täglich gereinigt und mit neuen Handtüchern versehen. Im Foyer konnte man sich kostenlos Kaffee (Nespresso) und Tee bereiten, es lagen Süßigkeiten bereit. Die Koffer konnte man vor einchecken und nach auschecken aufbewahren lassen. Das Personal immer freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wir waren sehr zufrieden. Wer Chinatown mag, findet dort eine gute Unterkunft.

title: Good place to stay for several nights
text: Everything in the hotel was pretty good except of 24 hours loud bridge just near the window :) But we did not expect such a good service and place in China town, so it certainly worth its price and I will recommend it to every traveler who do not expect luxury hotel at low price :)

title: Trip to NYC
text: Great staff, room was a little small and there wasn’t a fan in the bathroom. Couldn’t control AC but was kept at a decent temperature. Bed was amazing as well as pillows and bedding. Heart of china town

title: Excellent Stay
text:
The hotel staff were very friendly. We left our luggage after check out and they kept it without charge and even provided us room to change clothes afterwards. 
Room was cosy and very quite - Manhattan bridge is right next to the hotel but the sound insulation was perfect.

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix pour NY
text: Nous venons d'y séjourner en septembre 2019 et nous le recommandons chaleureusement. Situé dans le sud de Manhattan dans Chinatown il apporte un sentiment de sécurité. L'hôtel propose de garder vos bagages en cas de besoin, la chambre est très confortable et bien équipée. On a adoré y séjourner

title: Eccellente
text: hotel in posizione centrale, il rumore esterno non si sente grazie ai doppi vetri, ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo, la stanza era pulita e confortevole, il personale è gentile e disponibile, siamo stati sette notti ed è andato tutto molto bene

title: Super hotel
text:
Chambre tres propre
La literie super .j ai super bien dormi
Draps de bain.savon.shampooing en format grand 
Brosse a dent .rasoir 
Cafe a la reception offert
Hotel bien situe
Personnel sympathique et. A l ecoute 
Je recommende cettz hotel pour un passez un. Bon sejour a nyc
Thank you very much 😊😊

title: Amazing surprise!
text:
I did not expect much from the hotel in tge heart of Chinatown NY. The more I was amazed by Mimosa (...and the neighborhood as well). 
The hotel itself has rather small rooms but well equipped with everything you might need for your leisure stay. 
Kingsize bed, flat TV with variaty of channels, small table well equipped bathroom with amenities like toothbrush, shower gel, shampoo, hair-dryer etc. 
Room have been made up everyday with possibility of towel exchange ( the choice is yours). 
Small issues in our room were solved promptly and smoothly. 

I really did enjoyed my stay there and looking forward to stay there again anytime soon. 

Br

Tomas

title: Excellent Stay
text: The location is in Chinatown but very close to canal street.  It was a short walk.  When checking in we were given a map, a list of recommended restaurants, and highlights of events happening.  The room was clean.  They provided shampoo, conditioner and bodywash in pump bottles.  Wifi codes were on the back of the door.  It was a good stay and will return as it is cheaper than most places.

title: Great hotel, great value
text: My wife and I very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mimosa. The hotel staff were very friendly and the premises clean. As we arrived early, the hotel staff were very accomodating and held our luggage for a few hours while we wandered the city, and when we returned we found our luggage already delivered to our rooms. Our room was a great size for the price, had plenty of the usual amenities, the windows are excellently double-paned so as to reduce outside noise to a minimum, and once you pulled the blinds it was hard to tell you were in the heart of a major city. The hotel's location was central to the Chinatown neighborhood and easy walking distance to Little Italy and the Lower East Side. We'll definitely stay at the Mimosa again should we be in the area.

title: Great stay
text: Great hotel at a very reasonable price. Really close to a lot of recommended places to eat, to subway stations and many key attractions. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, I would stay there again. 👌

title: Amazing experience on Downtown Manhattan
text: This hotel located on Downtown Manhattan is very comfortable and great experience. Hotel staff and environment is great for couple. Local restaurants offer amazingly cheap and varied offers. We loved the place and great connectivity across New York. Holel Staff is very friendly and cooperative.  Complimentary tes and coffee 25x7 is awsome

title: tolles Hotel mit super netten Mitarbeitern
text:
Klasse Hotel in guter Lage in Chinatown. U-Bahn Station ist zu Fuß sechs Minuten weg und auf dem Weg dahin gibt es mehrere tolle Restaurants, wo man gut frühstücken oder auch Abend essen kann. 
Die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Das Hotel an sich und die Zimmer sind sehr sauber. Die Zimmer sind zwar ein bisschen klein, aber, wenn man in NYC ist sollte man sowieso so wenig Zeit wie möglich auf dem Zimmer verbringen.
Im Keller des Hotels befindet sich ein Computer, ein Drucker, ein Kühlschrank und eine Eiswürfelmaschine, die man kostenlos nutzen darf.
Alles in allem ein tolles Hotel, das ich nochmal buchen würde.

title: Zeer goede prijs-kwaliteitverhouding op een goede locatie
text:
Het hotel licht midden in China-town, Downtown Manahattan. 
Natuurlijk moet het je ding zijn, maar als je als je dat leuk vindt dan is dit een absolute aanrader!
Nette kamers, schoon, voor NY normen ruim, goede locatie vlakbij metrostations en fietsverhuur-locaties.

Dankzij dubbel dubbel glas hoor je als je dat niet wilt niets van buiten.
Gratis goede koffie in de lobby.
Lekkere douches.

title: Viaje a NY
text: Hotel limpio y con buenas comunicaciones en metro. Cama muy cómoda y habitación silenciosa a pesar de estar cerca de las vías del tren. Máquina para café gratuita en recepción que se agradece sobretodo por las mañanas. Personal de recepción agradable y colaborador. Repetiría sin lugar a dudas. No me gustó mucho los olores de la zona, pero es Chinatown...no es culpa del hotel.

title: Lovely hotel, best staff
text:
We’ve enjoyed our stay very much. The staff is super helpful and friendly. They managed to set a great atmosphere in this cosy hotel. The air conditioning is very well done. No dryness, no hot nights, just fine. No outside noise and comfy beds. Clean rooms every day, we are happy to recommend this hotel. 
Thank you for having us.

title: Lovely place, good location
text: Stayed here for 5 nights, great area, close to several subway stops. Rooms nice and clean, staff very helpful. Our room was near a operating train line, but didn't disturb our sleep at all. Would use again.

title: Personal muy amable y hotel bien acondicionado
text: Nos alojamos en el hotel 12 días en agosto y todo muy bien. Cabe destacar la sonrisa y amabilidad del personal cada vez que te veían. El servicio de limpieza muy bueno y las habitaciones muy cómodas. La única pequeña pega que puedo poner es que el aire acondicionado es común para cada planta y no lo puedes regular tu, solo pones o quitar la rejilla por lo demás todo estupendo.

title: Very nice staff, nice and clean room! bathroom could be better
text:
The hotel is in good place in Brooklyn, close to the tube (4 mins). The room is not so big but it's clean and with a good bed. 
Couple of things to fix are the centralised air conditioning -> you cannot modify the temperature for your room .
The tiles in the bathroom looks oldish, should be replaced.
The staff is really nice and careful

title: 6 night visit to NYC
text: My brother and I stayed at this hotel for a 6 night vacation to NYC. The hotel staff were very friendly and the rooms were top quality.  The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were well stocked with essentials like toothpaste, toothbrushes, combs and shampoo and shower gel etc. Downstairs had a vending machine which was excellent for essentials and also a computer with a printer and an ice machine.  The shower was very good and there was an excellent supply of towels and cloths.  The staff provided us with lots of useful information when we arrived such as recommendations for places to eat and a subway map. There were also recommendations for good TV channels in the room which was helpful.  All in all Ii would highly recommend this hotel and I would definitely return.

title: Great Hotel, excellent Customer Service
text:
The hotel is located in Manhattan, very clean and the customer service was simply great. Free Nespresso coffe. Very good balance between quality/price.
Rooms were very clean and the view was good too. It's a super hotel to visit NYC

title: Simplemente genial
text:
Es un hotel sencillo pero muy agradable y cómodo. Esta en la zona de chinatown, la cual es segura y tiene mucha vida.
La atención en el hotel impecable y además tienen muchos detalles con los huéspedes como tener café Nespresso y leche gratuitos todos los días (es un regalo para empezar el día) así como toda la información que nos dieron tanto antes de llegar para no perdernos, como al llegar para poder disfrutar de la zona.
Si volvemos a Nueva York sin duda repetiría en este hotel.

title: Good costumer service
text: We had an inconvinience with our room. They were very costumer friendly and offered us a good service with solving this problem. After all we have had a nice stay at this hotel. I would recommend staying here.

title: Great Value in NYC
text: China Town Hotel.  Affordable, clean, many restaurants nearby including Asian, SoHo and lower Manhattan.  We enjoyed our stay for 3 nights, especially the variety of food nearby.  Midtown to see shows, etc. was a bit of a chore because we were not successful with the subway, but this was the ONLY drawback.  I would recommend Hotel Mimosa to a friend and return there again.

title: Hôtel agréable et bien situé pour visiter New York
text:
L'hôtel est bien placé, proche des lignes F et D. Les chambres sont propres et confortables. Le personnel est discret et très accueillant. Il n'y a pas de petit déjeuner dans l'hôtel mais du café et du thé à disposition dans le hall (et plusieurs cafés dans le quartier).
Un petit point négatif : nous n'avons pas trouvé comment régler la climatisation

title: Hotel parfait pour un court séjour à New York
text:
Personnels très agréables et serviables, le véritable plus de cet hôtel.  La literie est très confortable. L'hôtel dispose de tout le nécessaire pour rendre un court séjour à New York confortable, malgré l'absence de petit déjeuner et d'équipements dans la chambre; l'accueil dispose à cet effet, d'une machine à café, de thé et d'une bouilloire et de quelques friandises. Au niveau inférieur, une pièce permet de retrouver les commodités manquantes dans les chambres (glaçons, machines, distributeurs, ordinateur, imprimante).  Le quartier dispose de plusieurs restaurants/cafés pour se restaurer. Tout proche de plusieurs stations de métro (2min pour le plus proche), il est aisé de rejoindre les divers pôles touristiques.

Si on veut être un peu tatillon, il est dommage qu'on ne puisse pas régler la climatisation, seul le sens du vent peut être modifié. Nous avons eu très froid la nuit.

Je reviendrais, très certainement dans cet hotel!

title: Semaine à NY
text:
Nous avons passé 8 jours à NY à l’hôtel Mimosa. Le personnel est vraiment adorable, les chambres sont très propres. Le café est en libre service à l’accueil et un ordinateur et une imprimante sont à disposition. Le quartier de Chinatown est très typique et la proximité des métros permet de desservir les lieux de visite. Brooklyn et le sud de Manhattan se font à pied depuis l’hôtel. 
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour, nous recommandons cet hôtel !

title: Great hotel @ perfect location!
text: The hotel was great: clean, good beds, Nespresso coffee and near nice restaurants and interesting places. Perfect to walk to and from or take subway! Nice people who can advise on where to go. Including lists with restaurants.

title: Good place to discover Manhattan
text:
Warm welcome from the staff: they gave us many recommendations for breakfast and diner 
Just near 2 subway stations. 
Quiet with the double double windows.
You have also  free hot drinks at the reception desk.

title: Great stay
text: Good value for money, great location, friendly staff, unlimited tea and coffee and good internet. Definitely coming back again. The room was small but cozy and had everything needed including cosmetics. Nice and clean.

title: The best value for the price
text:
Great experience. We believe it gives you the best value for the price. The staff was very helpful and informed us of on how to get around the neighbourhood. 
The room was very clean and the hotel is really quiet. The building is located across the street of subway tracks, but the noise is nonexistent  as the windows have double glass. The bathroom is also very clean and with a pair of complimentary toothbrushes. This is very handy as is the usual item someone forget. The wifi is also good. They lend you an umbrella in rainy days. The hotel offers a ride service to the big NY airports with very reasonable fares. Reserve ride in advance. This is a clean and nice hotel, for visitors that spend the day hitting the streets and need a solid place to rest. For breakfast, pool, uniformed bell boy, and all the bells an whistles, check out the Plaza in 5th Avenue.

title: Perfect
text: I stayed in the Mimosa hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The hotel was clean, the room had a Nice view and iT was silent.,clean towels every day and the Subway was only 5-10 min walk. Perfect hotel!

title: Great little hotel in Chinatown
text: Wife and I had a great stay here while we explored the city. Hotel was clean and comfy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was super fun in Chinatown district. Highly recommend a stay here thanks again.

title: Great stay
text:
Small, quiet, clean rooms. Bathroom with toilet, bath and shower + complimentary soap, shampoo and conditioner.
Great neighborhood with lots of good restaurants.
Very friendly, helpful, welcoming reception. Coffee, tea and chocolates at reception.

title: Great Place; Great Value
text: The hotel was well located next to Chinatown. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was clean, modern, and small (it is NYC). They were more than willing to store my bags the day I checked out. Plus, they have free coffee, tea, and fun sized candy. For NYC, it was well priced on the weekend I stayed.

title: Cosy little hotel in Chinatown
text:
A great location, quite comfy and a homely feel.
Rooms were a bit small but the place was clean and fresh. Nice simple bathroom, tidy and practical. 
The AC is centralised so you have to fix the fan on the ceiling.
Tea and coffee machine in the hall at any time.

title: Nice stay in NY
text:
The hotel is located in Chinatown, only 5 min from the subway station East Broadway, and it's a perfect place to stay to visit the city.
The room was very clean and the staff extremely helpful.
I would certainly recommend it to other people!

title: Perfect
text: Perfectly located in Lower East Side, the Mimosa hotel is very clean, quiet despite de location, the welcome is great, staff helpful, full of great advices for food and activities. Tip: don’t Hesitate to use the transfer from/to the airport, about 20$ cheaper than regulars cabs/Uber...

title: Baseball and Sight Seeing
text: Hotel Mimosa is comfortable, clean, quiet and conveniently located.  Staff is courteous and helpful.  Rooms are on the small side, but are good value for price.  Close to bakeries, coffee shops, restaurants, bars and F train.   Hotel Mimosa was a sanctuary for us at the end of event-filled days.

title: Great place, better staff
text:
Lovely hotel in Chinatown, well communicated with the rest of the city.
The staff is awesome, they are really helpful andwill hrlp you with any request or information you may need.
The hotel itself and the rooms are really clean, and made up every morning.
A great place to stay while visiting Manhatan

title: Lovely stay
text: Came to visit New York with my partner for 5 nights and stayed here, lovely little place right next to Manhattan bridge in Chinatown Very friendly helpful staff, clean and maintained rooms. Will definitely stay again!!!

title: Hôtel parfait
text:
Séjour de 5 jours à NYC. Hôtel confortable, propre et près du métro. 
Personnel de l’hôtel discret mais très agréable. 
Le + : l’hôtel fournit une liste de restaurants proches de celui-ci.
Je recommande vivement.

title: Amazing staff members!
text:
We stayed there for 2 nights. All the staff members were so nice and welcoming. Very confident in showing us where to visit on the map, and check-in and check-out were very easy and smooth as well. The room was clean and spacious too.
I'm sure I'll come back someday. Thank you!

title: Great Hotel to Stay at in NYC! 很好的酒店在纽约唐人街！
