text: My friend and I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mimosa! The rooms were simple and very clean. The staff was excellent! They were so genuinely helpful. I parked temporarily in front of the hotel, and they helped me with loading and unloading my luggage. (Just someone needs to stay with the car.) I chose to stay at this hotel because it seemed from reviews to be the best price for a hotel I felt like I could trust to be clean and acceptable. I was not disappointed. I parked at a nearby garage, and I was pleasantly surprised that they said with a stamp from our hotel, we would get a discount. So overnight I think I paid $30 instead of $39. The location in China Town is great. You are right in the heart. Plenty of great food and shopping around. 如果你会讲普通话或广东话，都可以！他们会讲你的语言。

title: Great location, great price, great hotel, great staff.
text: Well connected to buses, metro, even 30 mins walk distance from WTC. Hotel very clean, neat, sound isolated windows, very quiet, helpful staff, great service, definitely a no-brainer for the NYC trip, one of the best options, budget-wise also. Thank you.

title: Amazing!
text:
We really loved this hotel!
So nice people at the reception and always with coffee and snacks for us.. 
Even umbrellas for the rainy night that we had!
The location it's very good, I recommend little Italy for dinner

title: Loved the stay
text: I was very happy with my stay.  The staff was super helpful and friendly! The location was perfect for my vacation needs! The room was clean and had a cool view of the china town action on the street. Honestly the staff is totally worth the stay, five star service!

title: Perfect Stay in New York
text:
Hotel mimosa is a lovely stay with really friendly staff. It is located in the middle of Chinatown. We consider Chinatown a bit dirty with a lot of trash. Not the best location to stay, however the hotel makes up for that. It is clean and has good air-conditioning. Free coffee at the reception is also a plus. A five minute walk to the nearest subway station and 10 minutes by metro to times Square (without transfer).
I would definitely recommend this hotel because it looks like the best price-quality hotel.

title: Another great stay.
text: I had a chance to do a quick trip with friends up to New York City and was so glad to return to the Hotel Mimosa. Found another great restaurant and love trying out the hotel's recommendations. They really do know lots of great food options down here in Chinatown. I really enjoy their large comfortable bed and this time I stayed in their smallest room in the hotel at a price that is quite affordable for New York. Also, the room was quiet. Street noise, if any, is blocked out.

title: It's Quiet!
text: 4 panes of glass in the windows means the nearby el is not heard at all.  Very nice staff, great location, free good coffee and chocolates in the lobby.  The building is solid and attractive with ground floor entrance around the corner from the official address.  For NYC our queen deluxe room was fairly spacious.

title: Well situated / Clean rooms / Nice personal
text: Well situated, clean and very helpfull and kind personal. Ideal for exploring NY. There are many restaurants (chinese and non chinese) around and MTA is easy to reach. You can walk to Brookling bridge.

title: Stay in China town NYC
text: We stayed for 3 nights. Very helpful en friendly employees. Clean rooms. Located in China Town . Near the Subway / train and lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood. Only the WiFi on the 4 th Floor was not working properly. The staff did their best but were not able to solve the problem. I would defnitely recommend this hotel

title: Klein aber fein
text:
Alles in allem eine gute Unterkunft zum fairen Preis inmitten von Chinatown.
Das WTC ist fussläufig zu erreichen. In der Nähe befindet sich die U-Bahn Station Grand Street mit der man innerhalb von 20 Minuten am Times Square ist. Ein kleines gemütliches Frühstückscafé ist in unmittelbarer Nähe (Tour les jours) mir vielen Leckereien zu fairen Preisen. 
Das Zimmer ist recht klein aber völlig ausreichend zum schlafen. Gutes Bett und grosser TV mit Videos on Demand.
Bad angemessen groß. Leider in den Fugen der Badewanne Schimmelbefall. 
Ansonsten immer frische Handtücher und das Bett wurde jeden Tag gemacht.
Klasse isolierte Fenster. Man hört wenig von draussen oder von den Zimmernachbarn. 30 Zimmer auf 4 Etagen. An der Rezeption wird man freundlich empfangen und es gibt kostenlosen Kaffee und Tee,sowie Schokolade.Wasser für1$ ungekühlt und im Keller aus dem Automaten gekühlt.
Tip: Für Transfer zum Flughafen (JFK u.a.)den Service des Hotels nutzen und einen Tag vorher anmelden, haben nur 45 $bezahlt, statt 80$ über Uber.

title: Lovely hotel, great service and great value
text:
Hotel Mimosa is in a great location in Chinatown and is within walking distance of many different attractions, and if you don’t want to walk is around a 5 minute walk from the Subway. 

Check-in was efficient and everyone was really friendly. We arrived around 3 hours before check-in time but our room was ready and we were allowed straight up. We were given a few sheets of recommended local places to eat and a map too. Tea and coffee is available at reception for free. 

The room was a nice size and well decorated, with a surprisingly spacious bathroom. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel is provided along with a couple of toothbrushes, some toothpaste and a comb and shower cap. 

The room looked out onto the street/subway but the noise was minimal thanks to lots of glazing on the window. I sleep with earplugs anyway but I wouldn’t have been disturbed if I didn’t have them. 

There is no air conditioning in the rooms individually but the temperature is controlled by the hotel using a thermostat in the hallway. I did ask for this to be set a little lower one evening as the room was pretty warm but it was fine once done. A heater is provided for the colder months. 

All in all I would recommend a stay here, especially if you want to explore the lower manhattan and Brooklyn areas. In a city where prices are high, this is a good value find.

title: Excellent hotel!
text:
Myself & my sister stayed here for 5 nights last week. A wee gem of a hotel situated in Chinatown and only 5 minutes walk from the metro for accessing uptown Manhattan.

With Battery Park, the Statue of Liberty, Manhattan & Brooklyn bridges, and the financial district only a short trip away, Hotel Mimosa made our sight seeing very easy to navigate.

Staff were very friendly & helped in anyway they could. Room was just what we needed.

Would 100% stay again - thank you for having us.

title: Qualità prezzo ottima
text:
Personale gentile e disponibile, possibilità di spostarsi in aereo porto in trasferta, a prezzi super accessibili. Camere complete di tutto: compreso cuffia doccia, rasoio, spazzolini, dentifricio, sapone, balsamo e shampoo. In pratica qualsiasi cosa potrete dimenticarvi, ve la faranno trovare in camera. Zona tranquilla in Chinatown, a pochi passi dalla metro. 
Ottimo, lo consiglio a tutti!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Extremely friendly, accommodating, clean, comfortable, and quiet. Excellent location. Local recommendations. Free checked bags post check out. Great value in a city where bargains are hard to come by. Will definitely return.

title: Friendly small hotel
text:
Clean quiet stay, room was normal NYC size, staff was very friendly. The Mimosa is right in Chinatown and is walking distance to great markets and restaurants. Grand St Subway stop is about an 8 minute walk and the Mimosa hotel sits across from the Manhattan bridge, the subway goes across the bridge, but I wasn’t bothered by any noise in the hotel at all, although my room wasn’t facing the bridge. 
 I liked this hotel and will be returning,

title: DEcent hotel, friendly staff
text:
Everything works fine, from reservation to check-in, check-out, ...
Hotel is clean and nicely arranged.
The staff is efficient and friendly.
Concerning the room, it is small but well sound-proofed (4 window panes).  I was a bit scared of the metro noise but it is ok in the room.
Internet is fast and stable.
Only minor point, the bathroom tub has seen better days...

title: GREAT PLACE
text:
Great little hotel, near transportation, tons of good food around, & tons of things to do nearby! Also love how they’ll hold your bag before & after c/o! 

Also fantastic housekeeping and customer service! Hospitality was fantastic!

title: Clean, cozy, and quaint...
text: Clean, cozy and quaint. It's worth the value of its dollar. Not many nice  things can be said about any hotel in Chinatown. Hotel Mimosa is the exception. I spent one night for business purposes. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were generous. The hotel staff were very accommodating and they went well out of their way to ensure my comfort and happiness. For a young hotel, they are well on their way to greatness.

title: Very hospitable staff, nice clean rooms.
text: I stayed at the Hotel Mimosa June 6-7, 2019 with 26 other people on a trip to New York.  We booked our rooms online without having been there.  We were all pleasantly surprised at how nice and clean the rooms were.  The rooms are basic, but nice.  There's a large tv with many channels.  There are nice decorations on the walls.  The hotel is near the elevated subway, but noise was not a problem at all.  The windows are all extra insulated.  The air conditioner worked great.  The staff at the front desk were very nice and accommodating.  They went out of their way to help us find restaurants and directions to other places.  I would definitely stay there again..  A real bargain for a nice, clean space.  And there are dozens of great restaurants nearby in Chinatown and Little Italy, within walking distance!

title: Highly recommended
text:
We were there 6 days at the end of March & the beginning of April, and it was a great experience. The hotel was clean, the sheets and the towels were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. Although the subway line (and the Manhattan Bridge) is very close (= the location is great), the room was quiet, and the bed was bigger than in Europe. 
If I'm going back to NYC, I will definitely stay here. Great experience.
Bonus: free Nespresso cafe in the morning :)

title: Excellent accommodations for an awesome price!
text: We had a wonderful two night stay in one of the Superior Queen rooms.  Very comfortable accommodations and well maintained - very clean.  Absolutely top notch staff!  They were always happy to provide recommendations for dining and other activities around the area.  The room rate is unbelievable for NYC!

title: Friendly, caring and very helpful for travellers
text: A surprisingly quiet hotel in Chinatown, a great base for exploring this neighbourhood and easy to get to the rest of the city. I loved their list of recommended eating places, something so rarely offered, and much needed in this particular area where there is so much choice. Also helpful maps for getting to popular destinations. The traveller will feel well looked after here which is a nice feeling and one too rarely offered.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: No better value in NYC!  I took a group of 22 people to the hotel and everyone loved the hotel.  Conveniently located in Chinatown the staff gave us good recommendations for places to eat. Very friendly and helpful staff. You won't be disappointed staying here.

title: Great!
text: Great location, friendly staff. Free coffee (Nespresso), tea and snacks (mini snickers etc.) at the reception are a nice extra. The rooms are not super big, but ours was big enough. Showergel, shampoo and conditioner are included. We brought our earplugs, but did not need them. Our room was on the frontside of the hotel, but the double glass (actually double-double glass) blocked most of the sounds from the street, train, etc. Great breakfast places nearby. Staff was so kind to provide directions and recommendations upon arrival.

title: Sehr empfehlenswertes Hotel
text: Unser Aufenthalt im Hotel Mimosa war ingesamt super. Das Personal ist super hilfsbereit und freundlich. Die Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet und sauber. Auch das Bett war bequem. Der Lärm rund herum hört man im Zimmer etwas aber ich schlafe sowieso mit ear plugs. Die Lage ist etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig mitten in China Town aber gut gelegen um in den Süden oder Norden von Manhattan zu gelangen. Zur Brooklyn Bridge sind es nur ein paar Gehminuten. Wir würden wieder kommen.

title: Super
text:
De kamer was proper. Elke dag kreeg je propere handdoeken. Het bed werd altijd opgemaakt. De slaapkamer is klein maar je koffers kunnen makkelijk onder het bed. Badkamer was groot in verhouding met de slaapkamer. 
Hotel ligt naast een spoorweg maar hier hoor je niets van!

title: Ottimo hotel in New York
text: HO soggiornato la scorsa settimana in questo hotel in Chinatown.  Comodissimo per gli spostamenti. Fermata della metro a 5 minuti a piedi . Rapporto qualità  prezzo ottimo considerando i prezzi della grande Mela. Pulitissimo stanza piccola ma confortevole cambio asciugamani tutti i giorni bagno fornito di tutto compreso spazzolini da ddenti.unico neo la mancanza di un armadio anche piccolo per riporre gli abiti. Te e caffè  disponibili nella hall gratuitamente. Personale di una gentilezza unica.  Consigliatissimo

title: Un ottimo soggiorno a NY
text:
La posizione è ottima, a 5 minuti della linea F che porta alle principale attrazioni (diretta o solo con un cambio). Quartiere animato, si respira la vera NY fuori Manhattan. Lo staff è gentilissimo e disponibile. Ci hanno anche consigliato dei buoni posti per mangiare. La stanza si è piccola ma il bagno l’abbiamo trovato normale e cambiano gli asciugamani ogni giorno.
Un esperienza molto positiva e se torniamo a NY sicuro andremmo in questa struttura! Ve la consigliamo.
L'unico punto un po no era forse l’aria condizionata un po troppo fredda ma ... a NY è cosi; e un po più di pulizie nel bagno sarebbe stato il top (quindi per quello che non metto 5/5)!

title: excellent hotel
text: I stayed here last month while my apartment was being repaired. My room was clean, very comfortable and I enjoyed the hotels great personal service.       Its difficult for me to get around but their location is very convenient and the hotel really knows the different places to eat down here . I found a great new breakfast place and I'm a local. will come again

title: Super pleasant stay
text:
I stayed at Mimosa Hotel one night when I was attending the New York Boro Race. It's located in China Town and it was a short walk to the Race starting point. 

The reception is small, but check in was quick (please note that you'll be asked for a $100 deposit that will be returnedat the end of the stay).

The room itself isn't that spacious, but it's still quite comfortable. The bed was big  and although the hotel is just across the loud Manhattan bridge, it is completely sound proof and you can get a good night sleep.

There's a blow dryer, a large TV and several toiletries. The shower and towels are quite acceptable. You can get a nice complimentary cup of coffee or tea at the reception. 

The staff was attentive and provided us with a piece of paper with lots of local recommendations for food.

Overall, it's a pleasant place to stay when you want the comfort of your own room without paying the large figures typical of New York.

title: Nice place
text: My room was small but modern and clean. The service was great. The people at the desk really made me feel comfortable. Its not such a touristy area, which is great, but you can easily walk to places or to the subway station.

title: Great Hotel at a good price
text: I stayed at the Hotel Mimosa New York, an outstanding little hotel, as I had a big wedding to attend in Chinatown and needed a convenient overnight stay. The staff here are very good and accommodating. They help you with recommendations and car services anywhere. I highly recommend this place, especially if you have downtown events to go to.

title: Avis hôtel séjour de 10j
text: Chambre petite mais très confortable métro à 5 minutes à pieds personnelle très accueillant et toujours disponible pour nos demande, possibilité de laisser nos valises après le Check out pour faire une dernière balade je reviendrais! 😌

title: Hotel mimosa
text:
Awesome little hotel ! A real treasure and great value for Manhattan- the street is a little run down but the location is great for Chinatown/Little Italy and Lower east side . 
Very clean and comfortable- definitely coming back next time

title: best stay in awile!
text:
Dear David and Hotel Mimosa,
Thank you for making us feel at home when we were 1,000 miles away. Even in the beginning before our trip started David made us feel welcomed. Frantically last minute booking our rooms, after I booked I realized I scheduled our trip for the next day instead of the days of our trip("oh no im going to get charged a cancellation fee" is all i could think) once I realized it was "after hours" I called the hotel hoping somebody could help, the staff was friendly and they told me they would leave a detailed message for the manager who will arrive in the morning making me feel a little more at ease. when the morning came I called and spoke to the manager, told him exactly what happened and then told me everything was okay and moved our reservation to our dates we would arrive and there wouldn't be any fees for my mistake(we all know some hotels are "too bad, so sad") When we arrived at Hotel Mimosa David the manager was there and we were very pleased to meet him as he seemed he felt the same! we were offered candy and also hot tea. we spent about 15 minutes in the lobby after check-in talking with David about things to do, see and even places to avoid because of safety(haha) and cant forget to mention they also have a print out of recommended places! AND if it wasn't for David we wouldn't of known they were filming for a new movie right around the corner, so we got to see that! our room was on the front side of the hotel so our view was very neat with the city in the distance, it was the perfect size for me and my husband and the bed was comfy! As we plan our trip for this years trip to NY, hotel mimosa is for sure a place we will stay at again! we will be seeing you soon and thank you again!
-Mr. and Mrs. D'Andre Webb (stayed at hotel mimosa October, 2018)

title: Gem of hotel
text: Wasn’t sure when my agent booked it but I have to say it was amazing little place. Even though train goes by and looks like noisy place it was amazingly quiet! Super nice people and it was very clean and comfortable. Easy to get around and not so touristy. Would stay again. If you want to be down around Chinatown, this is the place.

title: Very Nice hotel
text: The hotel is nicely located, near several metro stations. The people there were very friendly and keen to help us. The rooms were clean and the noise was especialy low for manhattan. Coffee is complementary.

title: Nice
text:
We had a nice stay at Hotel Mimosa. The location was excellent. Although metro was very close to our room, it was not that noisy, so we could sleep well.
The staff at the reception were very kind and helpful. I liked the free coffee at the reception (Nespresso). Free wifi was fast. The room was small but comfortable enough. 
All in all it was a fair value for its cost.

title: Clean, comfortable and always a welcome smile
text: This boutique hotel gets top marks for hospitality. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful, offering tips and providing a whole lot of useful handouts so that we got the most out of our trip. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. They were compact but we fitted in just fine with all our shopping! The subway is a short walk away and a mere 6 stops from central Manhattan. The free coffee and tea at reception meant you could have your morning fix before heading off for the day.

title: Ms
text: Very nice accommodations, great location! The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom toiletries were very good. I would definitely stay again. Nice lobby and friendly staff. In Chinatown but close to lower east side.

title: Great Location and Service
text: The location was so great, so many wonderful places to eat nearby, I had a great walk in the area and my room was so quiet and comfortable. Front desk are the best I've ever experienced as a business traveler from the west coast.

title: no safe
text:
I was staying at this hotel few weeks ago for a short business trip with my co-worker.
I will not come back again.
It is not safe in this area at night and the hotel doesn't have security at the door.

title: Friendly Hotel
text: The Hotel Mimosa is a very friendly family run hotel in Chinatown, a short walk from East Broadway Subway. Rooms are on the small side which is typical for Manhattan. You can be in Midtown within 15/20 mins on the subway and you are 20 minutes walk to Brooklyn Bridge or the Financial district where you will find the 911 Memorial. The hotel has very fast and reliable WiFi plus complementary tea and coffee, (no bar). We felt safe out at night as it is a quiet neighbourhood. We had no trouble during our 5 night stay. The staff are very helpful. They can also arrange airport transfers which I would recommend. I would happily stay again.

title: Great place to stay!
text: The hotel is close to the subway station so it meant travelling into Manhatten was easy. Whem we arrived we were given leaflets on the local restraunts and shops to go to, the ones we went to were never a disappointment. There were free refreshments at the reception and all the staff were welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Cozy clean hotel in a great area and friendly staff!
text: The room was exactly what you need.  A big double bed and clean with great amenities in the bathroom. Room a bit smaller but I have paid more and got even smaller room so I was pleasantly surprised. The staff and the manager David was very friendly and I was happy by their service. Being a big fan of Chinese cuisine I was really looking forward to get som great Chinese food after a hard days work. David gave me a list of local recommendations and this was very helpful. The wifi worked well and I had no problems what so ever. Highly recommended hotel!

title: Great hotel - perfect combination of price/comfort/location
text:
We just stayed with my husband for 6 nights in the Hotel Mimosa and couldnt be happier of our choice. All the staff at the reception was always really friendly and helpful. The room was quite functionnal and we had great nights sleep thanks to the really comfortablle bed (exactly what you need after walking all day). You are at the heart of Chinatown and really close (walking distance) from the Brooklyn bridge, Little Italy, Wall Street and the subway is 5 min way for all the rest ( Time Square was less than 20 min away)
The hotel and room is really clean and although the bridge with the subway was really close to the hotel, the soundproof is amazing and you literally hear nothing. 
You have nespresso and tea available at reception for free and they are really helpful to recommend where to go and what to do. 
Really impressed by the quality of our stay considering the price for a New York hotel.

title: I love this hotel!
text: I’ve stayed at Hotel Mimosa several times. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. The rooms are always clean and the beds are very comfortable. Along with the wonderful, cozy accommodations, I’ve fallen in love with the neighborhood. It’s not “touristy” at all. You are surrounded by local people, food and culture. The base of the Manhattan bridge is close by and you can rent a CitiBike and ride over to Brooklyn in a matter of minutes. The busier section of Chinatown is a short walk where you will find various shops and even more delicious, authentic food, including the famous Chinatown Ice Cream Factory. If you want to visit NYC and experience real NYC life, rather than the manufactured tourist trap that is Times Square, the Hotel Mimosa is an excellent choice.

title: A great find!
text: Hotel Mimosa is a clean and modern hotel in the heart of Chinatown, in the shadows of the Mahattan Bridge. Despite this, we found the rooms were not excessively noisy and slept very soundly. The rooms are compact, but have everything you could need - a decent bed, TV, and a bathroom with bath&shower. There were plenty of towels and toiletries, some hanging space for clothes, a chair and a small desk. There was free tea and coffee in the reception, and plenty of places nearby to get breakfast, including a Chinese bakery right opposite. All of the staff we met were friendly and helpful, which is an important consideration. The hotel is well-priced for New York, and all in all is highly recommended.

title: Nice friendly place
text: We had a very nice stay at Hotel Mimosa. Staying in China Town gave an extra quality to our stay.The staff was positive and friendly. The room was small and simple but free from bugs and clean. Tea and coffee was obtainable in the lobby - very much valued. There was a good WIFI.

title: Good stay in Lower Manhattan
text: The manager was super nice and helpful. Room was just okay, bathroom could be updated. Good location close to metro and bus stops. Close to little Italy and a quick bus ride to Katz deli 😋 it was a good stay all in all.

title: Great hotel, really fair price
text: We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights, which was a fantastic decision. I really liked the rooms' style. Very tasteful. Complementary coffee, tea and if needed very good umbrellas. I can definitely recommend the place. Nice people, good price, professional service.

title: Excellent service, reasonable price
text: Great hotel staff, who offered great restaurant suggestions. Very courteous and friendly.If you want to be in China town, have quick access to the metro and minutes away from Manhattan Bridge, then Mimosa is the place for you!

title: Very Nice
text: The rooms are small but everything you need is there, it's close to a bridge with a train passing on it making a huge noise but the rooms are insulated enough so that you can have a pleasant night. The staff was really nice and always there to answer our many questions. As a first time trip in new York, we were very pleased by this hotel.

title: Very good choice
text: Excellent customer service, staff very helpful and kind ;great premises with cleanliness to a high standard, good location near some of the more interesting attractions. Underground very close. Special price for the cab to JFK.

title: Single Travel in downtown nyc
text: Came in a bit late due to the holiday. The staff was courteous and friendly. The morning stuff could have been more customers service oriented. The wall were not too film . The windows were a bit large and let a lot of light in. Had tondyi to get it a bit more darker in the room

title: Excellent 👌
text: Beautiful friendly hotel, with fantastic views of Manhattan Bridge & One World Trade Centre 😊 Accomodation very comfortable, everything you need for a base to explore New York. Excellent value for money. Staff very friendly. Will definitely be back to stay 👌

title: Great value for money
text: Great staff with lots of insider tips of restaurants and places of interests. They make you feel welcome and help you in all situations. Beautifully furnished, clean and cozy rooms, i loved the bathtub and bathproducts. Close to several subway stations. I would choose this hotel again!

title: Simon plackett
text: Such a friendly hotel, room nice and clean and staff very helpful. Location is good and just a short work to the subway for uptown or downtown, would 100% stay here again. If it's just a base you want then this is perfect

title: Excellent quality-price ratio
text: We visited hotel Mimosa in March and stayed for a week. We had twin room on 4th floor. Room was quiet and very clean. Extra plus for very comfortable beds. We missed more racks on the wall since there was no closet in the room. TV was big enough :) Service at hotel was excellent!

title: Great value for money, very friendly and hospitable staff
text: Great value for money. The staff was very friendly and hospitable. They were happy to keep my bag outside check-in and check-out hours. They have given me a map of lower Manhattan and a list of restaurants and bars nerby. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Had neibghours with loud screaming baby but that was only bad luck. I was tired from sightseeing all day so did’t have truble sleeping. Could hear trains from nearby Manhattan bridge but it was not loud and it did’t bother me.

title: Excellent hotel! 100% would book again.
text: It's a very cute place with lovely, helpful and courteous staff who provided helpful maps and a comprehensive local restaurant guide on check-in. The room was perfect for a short work stay. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were great including an extended range of quality toiletries in the bathroom - toothbrush, toothpaste, razor shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Everything was very clean. Location was excellent for walking to the Lower East Side for my work events. They will gladly store your luggage securely after you've checked out too. Couldn't be happier with my stay!

title: Bel hôtel et personnel adorable
text:
Hôtel très agréable au coeur de Chinatown, à quelques minutes du métro et entouré de commerces et restaurants à très bas prix.
Thé et café sont en libre service à la réception 24/24.
Le personnel est très agréable, serviable et tres accueillant.
Les chambres sont très propres, bien décorées et très confortables.

title: Great hotel
text: We have stayed here twice over the last year and would definitely return again. The location is great, only a couple of blocks away from the subway which is the F train that takes you uptown and to Brooklyn.  The rooms aren't massive, but you're in New York, you're going to be out and about! The room is clean, done everyday. Complimentary drinks are a nice touch too. The staff are friendly and helpful. We look forward to visiting again in the future!

title: Top Hotel in Chinatown NYC
text:
Excellent hotel, super comfy beds. Clean, quiet thanks to double window. Loved the pillows, wanted to take one with me. ;) Complementary coffee, tea and snacks. 
The best is the team, super friendly and helpful. Thanks for such a pleasant stay.

title: New York city concert
text: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for two nights while in the city for a concert. Although the location is a little out of the way, the hotel was great. It was clean, and the staff went out of their way to make you feel at home.

title: Super friendly staff, clean, comfy, & affordable!
text:
First time in NYC - why would you stay in a chain hotel that is the same blandness you can find anywhere else? We were so happy we made the choice to stay at Hotel Mimosa during our NYC weekend. Located in heart of Chinatown, a few blocks walk from the Subway, Hoel Mimosa is convenient, clean, comfortable, and very affordable. The room is small, but that is expected. The bed is comfy and we appreciated the room amenities like the toothbrushes and toothpaste. Also, our room faced the train line, but never heard more than a soft rumble. Very quiet and restful!

 But what really stands out is the helpfulness and welcome of the staff. We immediately felt like honored guests. The weather was iffy and we were offered hotel umbrellas to use. There is complimentary tea and coffee service at checking desk and $1 water bottles (super cheap compared to the $5 Times Square cost of the same). We had a late plane departure and they offered to let us stow our luggage (for free!) at the hotel after check out if we wished.

The hotel staff are serious foodies - definitely rely on their recommendations on where to eat! They gave us a two page list of food outlets which was useful (as well as directions from the hotel to major tourist spots). On check out, we said we wanted steamed buns. Their recommendation was Cheatham St Dim Sum Restaurant which was amazingly good - and cheap! 

We will absolutely stay at Hotel Mimosa again and recommend others to give it a try, too!

title: Actually, 6 stars
text: The Hotel Mimosa is now my "go-to" hotel in New York City. I come to the city three or four times a year and look for a place which is clean an economical. I've stayed in many different hotels in Manhattan, but this is my favorite. It's like a European family inn, and I know by experience. The staff are friendly and efficient. If you need something, they will follow through. You will have a unique experience in Chinatown, because the owner will help you decide where to eat, as he grew up there. He will recommend not only a good Chinese restaurant, but the restaurant which serves the kind of Chinese food which is their specialty. Okay, that's food. As for the Arts, the owner can direct you to what's happening in the city as far as painting, music, opera, theater, etc. And by the way, the rooms are quiet at night, street noises will not wake you up, as often happens at other places in the city. In sum, I can tell you that staying at the Hotel Mimosa will not only be pleasant, but will result in a broader experience of New York than you could possibly have with glossy tourist pamphlets as a guide.

title: Außerordentliches Hotel, in hervorragender Lage
text:
Ich bin seit etwa 48 h aus NY zurück, entsprechend frisch sind die Eindrücke.
Das Hotel liegt mitten in Chinatown, am Zubringer der Manhattan-Bridge. Davon sollte man sich nicht abschrecken lassen, die Fenster sind bestens isoliert. Die Lage ist hervorragend, es gibt zwei Subway-Stationen in der Nähe (East Broadway und Grand Street), mit denen man schnell in Down-, als auch Uptown ist. Auch zu Fuß sind viele Dinge zu erreichen, bspw. ist man in gut 20 Minuten am One World Trade Center und in 30 Minuten an der Wall Street. DICKES Plus für die Lage!
Das Hotel selber ist unscheinbar, wie erwähnt, mitten in Chinatown. Das Personal ist außerordentlich freundlich und hilfsbereit, ich bin selten so nett in einem Hotel empfangen und bedient worden.Bspw. war die Kofferverwahrung am Abreisetag umsonst möglich!
Unser Zimmer lag im 1. Stock und hat für 2 Personen vollkommen ausgereicht. Es war ordentlich, sauber, ohne viel Schnickschnack und bot außerdem noch ein geräumiges Badezimmer mit Dusch-Wanne. Täglich wurde das Zimmer gereinigt und die Handtücher gewechselt.
Alles in allem ein wirklich toller Ausgangspunkt für einen Urlaub im Big Apple, an dem ich persönlich, nichts aussetzen kann.

title: Extremely Friendly and Accomodating
text: We were in the city and wanted to book a last minute stay in and found this gem! Hotel Mimosa was extremely affordable for such a lovely place. Our room was a standard queen with a tub/shower and equipped with toiletries (the shampoo and conditioner left my hair incredibly soft), hairdryer, and cable. The room was a bit small but perfect for our stay. Upon arrival we were greeted with genuine warmth- the concierge even provided us with a list of convenient bars & restaurants with a brief description which I thought was such a personal touch! I will definitely be staying here again and recommend it.

title: Una estancia perfecta
text: Muy buena ubicación, genial atención y limpieza impecable. El personal es súper amable y están para ayudarte en lo que necesites. Te dan incluso una guía del barrio con los mejores sitios de la zona. ¡Recomendado 100%!

title: Little hidden gem
text:
We've just returned from a 3 night stay at this place.  Loved it.  The location is slightly off putting when you get there since you are facing the Manhattan Bridge and it has a train track?  However, no idea how they've done it, but the rooms are completely sound proofed??  It's almost eerily quiet?  Small rooms but this is Manhattan - unless you can afford top $$$$'s most rooms are small? They are small but well equipped and very clean.  The bathroom has more to offer than a lot of larger hotels I've stayed in?  So you get toothbrushes, toothpaste, shower cap, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel?!  The location was fabulous for us as we've been to New York many many times so didn't want to be too central but it is a bit far downtown for maybe 1st time visitors.  You're right in the centre of Chinatown which is fascinating and a short walk to Little Italy and the Brooklyn Bridge
My main recommendation for this hotel, however, is the staff?  They really cannot do enough for you?  My husband was ill and I asked to extend our room for a late check out?  They did it complimentary and offered to get medical help?  We didn't need it but the offer was there.  And they organised a transfer to the airport?  Nothing was too much trouble?  The free tea/coffee on reception was a lovely touch too?  
I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Excellent stay at Hotel Mimosa
text: Great location, affordable price, the staff is super nice and helpful with maps and restaurants recommendations, the room was cute, clean and big enough for two people. I highly recommend this place!!

title: Charming in Chinatown
text: The Hotel Mimosa is a gem. Accommodations are a bit tight  but clean and efficient. Staff are knowledgeable about the area and incredibly friendly and helpful. The bed was surprisingly outstanding, my partner and I both remarked at how great we slept and how refreshed we felt when we woke up. Everything we could've possibly needed was provided. Would stay here again and would highly recommend.

title: Great value for money
text: We has a great time at Mimosa hotel. Super convenient location and very friendly and service minded staff. The rooms are spacious, toilets are well functioning and clean. Looking at the price and comparring to hotels nearby this is a bargin.

title: Cracking find
text:
This was a fantastic find and gave us a great base in which to explore the city. The staff couldn’t be nicer and were extremely helpful in showing us good places to eat and drink as well as quick routes to the subway etc 

The rooms aren’t huge but a Queen Superior is more than enough and let’s be honest it’s a city you want to be out in not stuck indoors. 

£309 for 4 nights was exceptional value.

title: Very perfect
text:
Tout était parfait.
Superbe accueil. Très très gentils
Les chambres au top!!!
Je recommande +++.
Les services sont très adaptés. 
Proche du metro.
Le personnel est toujours prêt à renseigner. 
Petit accueil avec café et gourmandises.
👌👌

title: Fantastic service and great proce
text: We booked into hotel mimosa for a night when our flight times were changed. We were welcomed by the reception staff who could not be more welcoming and helpful! The complimentary tea (PG tips) offered was much needed for a tired Brit! The rooms were basic but were clean and very quiet considering how close to the train line we were. In the morning the staff again were very helpful and happy to look after our bags while we went exploring. For the price this place is a little gem in the heart of China town!

title: An amazing stay... Home away from home
text:
We had a very good time at hotel mimosa. They made us feel welcome and at home. We were greeted very friendly when we checked in and also each time we came back, no matter what time. The front desk staff genuinely seemed to care how our day was and what we did. They gave us great recommendations and helped us out with finding routes to museums and a taxi to go back to the airport. Thanks so much that was amazing!
The rooms were nice. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in and the bathroom was nice and well equipped. Although there is no kettle in the room itself, you have a wide variety of teas and coffees downstairs at reception and can help yourself there. That was a nice touch.
Area is great too. Very close to two stations and next to great restaurants and pubs.
I will indeed recommend Hotel Mimosa to my friends and family and come back whenever I go back to new York. Was really sad to leave!

title: Precious lil' NYC gem
text: I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Mimosa. It's got a great location, with lots of delicious food options around and in the area of Chinatown, which is itself really interesting. The room is tidy and clean, simple and comfortable, but has everything you need. The wifi connection is strong. Downstairs, there's a free flow of coffee and tea. Best of all is the service - very attentive and helpful with suggestions for food, directions and everything else.

title: Fabulous little hotel
text:
First time in New York so was torn between staying somewhere near Times Square or near China Town. So glad we decided on staying near China Town as it was so convenient for us to get something to eat inexpensively.

The hotel was excellent, comfy beds, clean rooms and friendly staff who gave us their personal recommendations for good food. Would definitely recommend to all our friends and family. Hopefully we will also be back for a second visit in the near future.

title: If you are looking for a place in Chinatown, This is the Place
text: Wonderful place to stay while in Chinatown.  The bed was fabulous.  Best sleep I've had in a week.  The management and staff are wonderfully attentive and anticipate your every need.  My wife said it was the best stocked powder room she has ever seen.

title: Nice little hotel.
text: Great location with easy access to the subway. A very nice and helpful staff. Small rooms but very clean. The Manhattan Bridge subway does run near the room we were in but noise is to be expected in a NYC and a little white noise on our phone blocked it all out.

title: Best Kept Secret
text: What a wonderful hotel! Staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, there is a cozy lobby with free coffee, tea and a huge bowl of candies, clean rooms (yes, they are small but the beds are comfy and the bathroom is spacious) stocked with the essentials, within walking distance of great coffee shops, restaurants and more. Oh, and the room rate is very economical! Check it out - you won't be disappointed.

title: Super preiswert, super Lage, super nette Menschen
text: Die Ausstattung der Zimmer ist eher rudimentär, ABER sehr sauber, sehr guter Service, man hat Alles was man braucht. Die Mitarbeiter geben tolle Tipps für Restaurants und Sehenswürdigkeiten in der Nähe.
