Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt und empfehlen das Hotel gerne weiter.

title: Great location, super friendly staff!
text:
Stayed in this hotel due to its location near subways for our first trip to NYC. 

The staff are so friendly and the room is what we needed after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The staff are great and recommend food places nearby. Being in china town all the food looks good! 

Would recommend!!!!

title: Great location and amazing
text: The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The room was definitely a great deal for the price. Would stay here again. The hotel is a bit confused due to the layout of street in the part of nyc.. I believe ther reviewer mention this.

title: Fantastic little hotel
text:
Friendly staff, right in the heart of Chinatown. I don't understand the complaints about the noise  because we didn't hear a thing. 5 minutes from the F train so easy to get around the city. Small rooms which can be expected in NY but didn't feel cramped.

I can't recommend enough.

title: friendly little hotel
text: The rooms at mimosa aren’t massive and I’d suggest getting a corner room with the two double beds that provide a bit more room for not much more. Location is great. You step right into lower east broadway and Chinatown. It is busy, a little noisy but full of atmosphere and plenty of choices in terms of restaurants around. Dave and his staff are super friendly.

title: Friendly staff, immaculatly clean rooms, great experience!
text: My husband and I stayed here for a night while our Queens apartment was being sorted.  The neighborhood is authentically Chinese sans tourism, which was a cool experience in itself.  It really is a hidden gem in a classic corner of the city that still feels like it has the original heartbeat of downtown.  The staff at Mimosa was wonderful and the room was spotless and comfortable, at such a reasonable price.  We will for sure stay her again and suggest it to family when they visit.  Thank you, Mimosa!

title: Great experience:)
text:
We spent 3 nights in this hotel in December 2018 and it was very nice experience.
It's 15 min walking distance from Brooklyn Bridge and 10 min from Little Italy.
Staff is very friendly and happy to help anytime:)
Great place with very nice staff:)

title: Awesome place to stay at awesome staff very clean place
text: Awesome place to stay and I will be back soon very clean place lot of nice restaurants around that area and also a lot of things to do around that area the people that work there are awesome front desk is very kind treat you with nothing but respect and kindness

title: Simple, clean, very friendly staff!
text: I highly recommend this hotel if you’re looking for a very affordable hotel option. The staff is so friendly and helpful, there is complimentary coffee + tea, and the room was exactly what we needed- very clean and cute. Right in the heart of Chinatown. Only 10 minute walk to Soho. Would go back!

title: Great place - particularly if you are familiar with NYC and love food
text:
This place is in a great position on the edges of china town and Lower East Side. There is amazing food on the doorstep and you can walk to a ton of places easily and there's also a couple of close subway stops. 
The longer we were there, we realised how much was around that area. 
The hotel is super helpful and gives you a list of recommended eateries/bars etc which is helpful. The room is larger than expected and comfy beds. There's also someone on reception 24/7 which really helps with odd arrival times.
Literally can't find a single fault.

title: Perfect
text:
I stayed there just for one night.
My room was very clean and comfortable.
The bed as well was very comfortable, with 4 pillows!
The personnel at the reception was very kind and provided me good advices for restaurants.
Last but not least the price is very interesting for a hotel located in Manhattan.
I'll come back!
Thank you

title: Perfect Stay
text:
We really enjoyed our time at this charming and quaint hotel. We were here last year too and the service has been just fabulous. We needed recommendations for a sports bar and a good place for vegan ice cream and they found it! They all work very hard and the hotel’s location is very convenient. The rooms are so clean, and in the bathroom they provide everything you need. Even though we know the area, I notice that their recommendations for places to eat and drink had changed (maybe with the seasons?). Many nice (new) touches since we came last, and we would return again in a heartbeat. 

By Hualin L

title: Goed
text: De locatie was ok. Is een goed hotel om enkel te slapen en te wassen. De metro is dichtbij. Personeel is vriendelijk. Prijs kwaliteit was dit hotel zeker ok. Het is er ook proper. Kamer ligt wel naast de metro, dit is opgelost door dubbele beglazing dus het is te doen. Je hoort het nog maar een beetje.

title: surpresa
text: Nossa ida a NY para a virada do ano não foi previamente programara. Tava tudo muito caro, pouquíssimas opções. Por sorte, conseguimos achar esse charmoso hotel que muito nos surpreendeu. Custo beneficio excelente, tendo em vista a época da estadia. Quarto espaçoso, muito limpo e cama bastante confortável. Arrumação diária impecável. Funcionários atenciosos, educados e eficientes. Destaque para o William, pessoa muito simpática. Embora perto da Manhattan Bridge, isso não foi um problema para nós...... dormimos muito bem. A localização é boa, no entanto, um pouco distante da Times. 1 hora de caminhada mais ou menos.

title: Unforgettable stay!
text:
My fiancee and me had a great stay in the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff,  nice comfortable room, great location near two metro stations and...  free espresso and chocolates all the day,    What's more to ask for???? 

Definitely come back!!!!!!

title: Hotel accueillant !!!
text:
Nous avons séjourné une petite semaine en famille dans cet Hôtel. Nous avions 3 chambres. Celle-ci ne sont pas immenses mais cela nous a suffit car nous avons passé nos journées à l'extérieur. L'hôtel est très propre et bien tenu.Il est situé à côté du métro aérien mais cela ne nous a pas empêcher de dormir.
Le personnel est très accueillant et serviable. Nous les remercions pour leur gentillesse.
Un bon rapport qualité prix pour un passage à New-York. Nous y reviendrons avec plaisir.

title: A real surprise gem in Chinatown
text:
Hotel Mimosa was clean, comfortable, and accommodating. Even though I know the area pretty well, the list of nearby restaurants and shops turned out to be really helpful in a pinch! Modern fixtures and knowledgeable staff! The only thing that threw me off was the rule of having no guests after 11pm, which I didn't know before booking. 

Overall, a lovely, unexpectedly comfortable hotel right in lower Manhattan!

title: Winter vacation in NYC
text: Staff were friendly and welcoming. Offered us hot drinks when we entered. Provided us with a detailed list of recommendations. Room was clean but it wasn’t exactly sound proof. We could hear chatters along the corridor. Nonetheless a place valued for money in the big city.

title: Excellent place
text:
Room was small, however, was very clean. The rooms didn't look worn, considering that the other buildings look quite worn down. Good location in Chinatown and walking distance to the subway stations. Reception was helpful too. You can also ask for taxi to the airports from the reception for a fixed price. 

However, one bad point is that the soundproofing of the rooms can be improved. The hotel is very near to the subway tracks so you could hear the subway travelling back and forth. Also, loud noises from the corridor or other rooms could be heard for example, the beep from unlocking of the room door, others watching tv in their room, etc....

title: Small but well maintained room.
text: We stayed at Hotel Mimosa in December of 2018 to attend a small family gathering. Our room was on the fifth floor, across from the elevated train station and bridge. The room was well insulated, so the muffled sounds of trains going by were soothing. It was interesting to watch bikers as they traversed the bridge. Everything was clean and well ordered, and there was ample water pressure in the shower and sink. The location was a short walk to Chinatown and Little Italy, with restaurants and other stores easily accessible in every direction. The friendly staff was always ready to make our stay pleasant and comfortable. We would definitely stay at Hotel Mimosa next time we are in the area.

title: Great stay!
text:
Good location in Chinatown, 5 minutes away from the subway (lines B, D, F) but not too noisy thanks to the windows. 
Reception provided good local adresses of restaurants and cafes. Welcoming staff.
Very clean room, good bathroom (space and amenities).
Great room for two!

title: Christmas in the City
text: This is the first time we stayed at Hotel Mimosa. We always try to stay in a different area of the city when we visit. I read good reviews online and the price was very good. We were in town for 4 days and 3 nights to see the Xmas sights. We did not spend much time in the hotel since we had full days of sightseeing but the bed was good and bathroom was clean. The staff is super friendly and gave us a list of all the eateries within a 10 minute walk. The rooms are not big but I don’t know that I have ever had a large room in NYC.

title: Lower Manhattan great value hotel
text:
Hotel Mimosa is a Small Hotel in Chinatown Lower Manhattan. We stayed as a group of 4. My elderly parents plus my 17 yr Daughter and Me. Rooms aren't large but like the rest of the hotel are very well presented and very Clean and tidy.
The Staff are incredibly friendly and welcome guests with helpful Lists of Cafe, and restaurant recommendations. Subway station is less than 5 min walk, as well as many interesting walks and destinations nearby. Value for money!

title: Hotel mimosa review
text: I have enjoyed my stay at Mimosa. The staff was very professional, helpful and polite. The location was great with nearby metro station (5mins walk) and a walking distance to many attractions. The hotel was clean and offered a great coffee. I would stay there again.

title: Great stay!
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful had a list of restaurants nearby ready to give out at check-in and then also came up with a hand written list of bars nearby for us which was very thoughtful. Very clean rooms and bathrooms with stocked soaps and toothpaste and toothbrush which was so unexpected it was a wonderful surprise. It's the little things this place did that made the stay extra special! Close walking distance to Chinatown shops and eateries and also Little Italy not too far of a walk.

title: Great hotel in the Chinatown area
text: I was in town for business and chose this hotel because it was an affordable option in the lower Manhattan area.  Rooms are on the small side, but if you are there just to sleep it is not an issue. Front desk staff was super helpful for dinner and breakfast recommendations in the area.  Very close to the main Chinatown area.  2 blocks away from the F train to Brooklyn or midtown Manhattan.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Recomendado al 100%, volveremos sin duda
text:
Mi pareja y yo nos alojamos en el hotel del 2 al 8 de diciembre. Llegamos a la parada de metro de Grand Street desde JFK, sin saber orientarnos todavía en Manhattan, pero no tuvimos problema en llegar al hotel. Se encuentra en Chinatown, con el peculiar aspecto de este barrio conocido de verlo en mil películas, y tal cual lo encuentras, pero llama la atención cuando llegas al hotel que su fachada desentona por la buena presencia del edificio respecto a los colindantes y al barrio en general. Entramos y nos encontramos con una atención, presencia y amabilidad impoluta, propia de cualquier hotel de 4 estrellas en España. Nos dan una guía de restaurantes, recomendaciones, etc. y accedemos a la habitación. Primera impresión de la habitación, si bien no es muy grande (imagino que no podrían mantener estos precios con este servicio y un numero mas reducido de habitaciones mas grandes) no necesitamos más espacio ya que nuestra intención es prácticamente ir a dormir solo. La habitación respecto a limpieza estaba impoluta, tal cual se ve en las fotos que podéis encontrar aquí, con baño privado muy limpio con todo tipo de accesorios de higiene incluyendo maquinilla de afeitar, cepillos de dientes, etc. Las vistas directas al puente del Manhattan por donde pasa muy cerca el metro, pero con dobles ventanas sorprendentemente que aíslan de todo ruido del exterior; descanso garantizado.
Bajamos la primera mañana y si bien es cierto que el hotel no ofrece servicio de desayuno, que nosotros no buscábamos pues nuestra intención era salir a la calle desde bien temprano, su personal tan amable te ofrecen café (los que quieras) que te puedes servir tu mismo en una máquina nespresso. Con esto, nos vamos a la calle y te das cuenta de la buena localización del hotel, a pie  del puente de Manhattan, a 15 minutos andando (o menos) del puente de Brooklyn, de dos parada de Metro que en 15/20 minutos te dejan en el Rockefeller, o a pocos minutos a pié de la zona del World Trade, Wall Street e incluso ferry para la Estatua de la Libertad. Esa misma noche teníamos entradas para los Knicks y pudimos imprimir nuestras entradas en el mismo hotel, que cuenta con un ordenador e impresora a disposición de los clientes sin coste alguno (muy nuevos). Tras nuestra semana en Nueva York, el ultimo día hicimos el check-out y pudimos dejar nuestras maletas en recepción, donde te las guardan y te dan una pulserita con tu número, y ellos mismos las guardan y después te las sacan, con lo cual pudimos aprovechar todo el dia de vuelta (nuestro vuelo salia a las 20.00) por Broocklyn, Chinatown y Little Italy.

Si la experiencia de ir a Nueva York en época de Navidad ya de por sí es increíble, sin duda la localización, servicio, tranquilidad, descanso y gran amabilidad encontrada en el Hotel Mimosa suma mucho en el recuerdo que nos traemos de la Gran Manzana.

title: Great Value in an expensive city
text: Close to Chinatown and the lower east side, this hotel was amazing value. Rooms a decent size for 2, clean and well laid out. Shower fab! Hotel staff very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Subway short walk away. Had an enjoyable stay.

title: Friendly and accommodating staff; pleasant room
text: The hotel is in a good location for Chinatown and the lower east side.  Our queen room was small, but not uncomfortable.  The bathroom was clean and nicely appointed.  Most of all, though, the staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Value
text:
I was a little anxious about staying here given the price - but I was pleasantly surprised. 

Just on the outskirts of china town, close to a subway station - this hotel offers the ideal combination of being relatively cheap in an expensive city and being located close to so many things to visit. 

Well worth staying at.

title: Great staff, quaint Hotel
text: Helpful staff, provided assistance on Parking and  transportation options to various sites. Clean rooms, would highly recommend Hotel to others. They were nice enough to provide me a parking pass while my car was on curb during loading/check-in process.

title: Sin duda, recomendable! Volvería!
text:
El hotel es pequeñito y encantador. Sus empleados son muy amables y atentos! 
Cada dia nos hacían la cama y nos reponían los amenities (cepillo de dientes, pasta de dientes, cuchilla...) el jabón eran dosificadores grandes ( gel, champú y acondicionador). 
Se encuentra cerca de dos estaciones de metro con las que llegas al centro y a las afueras en 20 minutos ! Cerca del puente de Manhattan! 
No disponen de sala para desayuno pero en la misma recepción hay máquina para hacer té y café además de un bol de chocolatinas! 
Disponen de paraguas que puedes tomar prestados e incluso de servicio de taxi al aeropuerto por 40 dólares! Una ganga!! 
Lo único malo es la calefacción que no se pueda regular, pero una ducha lo soluciona! jeje
Añadiriamos como detalle que tengan una báscula para pesar maletas! Nada más! Hotel espectacular para nosotros!
Tuvimos problemas con la tarjeta y el manager nos lo solucionó!

title: Good location and staff.
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in December. We had previously booked another place in Chinatown but changed our mind after seeing bad reviews, and booked this place; we have no regrets.

The good: The hotel is very well-located - it’s five minutes or so from the metro (straight up to some major attractions) and within walking distance of the Brooklyn Bridge and the financial district. The staff are very professional and friendly. They kept our bags safe on our day of departure, and booked us a car to the airport at a good price. There is free coffee/tea and chocolates at reception. 

The bad: You can’t expect much space in a budget Manhattan hotel room, but there could be more storage for clothes etc. There is no room safe - absolutely no reason to think the staff would steal anything, but it’s always nice to have a safe. The room was also cold at times - we told the staff and I think they tried to turn it up, but the heat is controlled for the whole corridor, which might limit things. The area is also quite ‘rough’, but didn’t seem unsafe.

title: VOLVERIA
text:
Hemos estado 10 dias mi pareja y mi hija,excelente ubicacion a 10m andando 2 paradas de sub,zona tranquila y segura...aunque el metro pase cerca no se oye ningun ruido de la calle por su doble ventana,muy amables y dispuestos ayudar,todo un detalle lo que te ofrecen cafe,agua bombones..muy limpio por poner una pega la habitacion un poco pequeña pero enseguida te acostumbras,buen baño.
Sin duda volveriamos

title: Awesome boutique friendly clean hotel neat Canal street
text: All round great and amazing staff. Bed, shower and free WiFi all great. Tea in the lobby 👌🏼 Would definitely come back again! Close to so many great things and staff warm and welcoming! It was a home from home :)

title: Excellent
text: Really great location, service, hospitality, and accommodations! Would definitely stay again. The location makes it super easy to access everything you want in NYC. The room was comfortable and clean.

title: Great spot for a great price
text: We had a great stay at Hotel Mimosa. Room was a good size (bigger than the Hilton we had last time). It was clean, well cared for and the team on the front desk were always extremely helpful. Great location to get about and a great value option. We will be returning.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Myself and my partner stayed 4 nights at Hotel Mimosa and their service was absolutely fantastic. Every member of staff was so welcoming and assisted with every query we had. The room was everything it needed to be, comfy bed, hot shower, clean etc. As a small but key part of our holiday we couldn't have been happier with this hotel.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Fantastic hotel located in the heart of Chinatown which made it incredibly easy for us to walk anywhere we wanted! Especially little Italy. Staff was incredibly friendly and hotel was very clean which is a big thing for me. If I decide to take a trip to NYC again i would definitely stay here again.

title: Very Nice Stay
text: We stayed at Hotel Mimosa for 5 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. Rooms are clean and functional. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Location is ideal for NYC adventures. Highly recommended!

title: Compact, clean, cosy and quiet
text: I stayed at the Hotel Mimosa for 3 nights on a recent stay to NYC to celebrate my daughter’s 25th birthday.  We shared a twin room with a bathroom on the 3rd floor.  The hotel was clean, conveniently located, and unbelievably good value.  I did not book an expensive hotel as all we were going to be doing there was sleep, but the hotel exceeded our expectations by some way.  The staff were friendly, helpful and informative.  The room was a great temperature, with comfortable beds and quality bed linen.  The bathroom had everything you needed, including toiletries and was spotless.  Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay again.  My only negative comment would be that the bedroom did not have a mirror - not a big deal in the big scheme of things! And the free coffee, tea and chocolates in the foyer more than made up for this!

title: Excelente relación precio-calidad!
text: Nos alojamos 8 noches con un grupo de amigas en este hotel y todo estuvo perfecto. Buena ubicación, el subte está cerca y en 15 minutos se llega a Times Square, la zona se sentía segura. Las habitaciones son confortables aunque un poco pequeñas, pero nos arreglamos muy bien, todo muy limpio, camas súper cómodas, el baño de un buen tamaño, todo bastante nuevo. El personal es sumamente amable, siempre dispuestos a ayudar con una sonrisa. Buen wifi y en el lobby siempre había disponible café, té y chocolates. El hotel se encuentra frente al puente de Manhattan, a pesar de que se podría esperar escuchar mucho ruido, esto no es así gracias a que las ventanas tienen doble vidrio y el ruido es apenas perceptible, no nos molestaba para nada. El servicio de coches para traslado al aeropuerto es muy conveniente. Volvería sin dudar.

title: Budget hotel in Chinatown that makes you feel like home!
text: My girlfriend and I (from NJ) had a wonderful one-night stay here while in town for an event on the Lower East Side. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly, and the room had everything you needed - even a view of the Freedom Tower! The location is in the heart of Chinatown, so make sure to explore the authentic cuisine. Don't forget to make the quick walk over to Little Italy as well for a cannolo e espresso!

title: Great Hotel in China Town
text: Really enjoyed staying at the Hotel Mimosa. It is right in the heart of China town and perfect for business or leisure. The staff were really friendly and the room sparkling clean and comfortable. Will definitely be booking to stay here again when I am next in New York.

title: Strongly recommend
text: Excelent 3star hotel located in a heart of China Town. Clean, with all the necessary and expected equipments, high quality wifi, and last but not least extremely nice and helpful staff. They really tried to make my stay very special. Helped me solving my problems, like finding a good tailor nearby, when I urgently needed it, or showed me where to find Tai Chi classes in the nearby park. Great coffee at the reception, and I will emphasize that again, wonderful staff.

title: A real Manhattan experience without the £££
text:
A great 5 night stay here. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The free tea/coffee from Reception each morning was a nice touch. They were always on hand to offer directions, maps, suggestions or just a quick chat. A 5-10 min walk from a couple of subway stations so easy to get around (we used East Broadway most).

The rooms (Superior Double) whilst small were bigger than we were expecting - cosy but big enough for 2 people with 2 big cases! Newly refurbished so really clean, tidy and modern with a huge comfy bed. Bathroom was also good quality too. Room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and bed made.

I'd read about the proximity to the train line before I'd arrived so kept an open mind. From the outside it is VERY loud when they pass. BUT, being honest, the noise from the room is really not that bad - more a distant, low rumble. And our rooms faced the bridge.

You'd have to be an incredibly light sleeper for it to affect you. There's a noticeable effort with windows/glazing in the room to soundproof. They have earplugs at reception - I asked for a set on the first night but didn't end up using them. After a day of walking and exploring; you'll sleep.

There are a lot of restaurants nearby in Chinatown but you're also not far from Lower East Side and also Little Italy. Also a lot of really good (and cheap) bars nearby easily found on Google Maps - Whiskey Tavern and 169 Bar to name a couple.

Overall it was an excellent stay in an area I would have not really have considered previously but is definitely worth a try if looking for value for money and a different part of Manhattan.

title: A great find.
text: Great little hotel at a handy location. Rooms are spotless, comfy and surprisingly quiet given proximity to the bridge.. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel for a visit to NYC.

title: Great Manhattan accommodation on a budget
text: We spent a week at Hotel Mimosa and found the staff to be more than friendly and helpful, the complimentary tea and coffee facility was a nice touch and as well as umbrellas for the customers to use when the weather turns for the worst. We personally used the Grand Street Subway (two or so blocks uptown) which seemed to have a more convenient service to Midtown. The room was adequately appointed, nice and quiet given the proximity to the Manhattan bridge (right over the street) and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept on. Being on the top floor we could see across to Lower Manhattan by night which was a lovely view to arrive to on our first night. It was a great place to stay and would recommend for anyone.

title: Outstanding experience
text: People here is beyond kind, they have complimentary tea and coffee. I arrived 2 hours earlier of the checkin hour just to leave my baggage but my room was ready. They suggest me good places to eat, I visit one pizzeria they suggest me and was the best pizza and wine ever in NY.

title: Awesome hotel and super friendly service
text:
Great location, sound proof windows, very warm greeting by the staff upon arrival. 
Room is petite but very comfortable, outlets in all places. It’s got the high standards of a hotel is Asia - they provide tooth brushes!

Love this place, thank you Mimosa.

title: Experience
text:
Fantastic, friendly and comfortable hotel to stay at.
Staff are extremely accommodating and make sure your stay is enjoyable
Best sleep of our lives, not too loud which is rare for NYC
Late checkout 
Keep up the hard work

title: Perfect location
text: No bad suprises, everything went perfect, staff is very friendly and helpfull. Hotel location is perfect. I suggest to use Grand Street subway station instead East Broadway. Faster connection to midtown.

title: A nice clean and quiet hotel
text: This hotel is located in Chinatown close to a subway. It was clean, peaceful and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but absolutely fine for our purposes. There was free tea and coffee at the front desk as well as free wifi in the room. We'd happily stay there again!

title: Surprise Gem in the Middle of China Town
text:
We were looking for a few nights stay at an affordable hotel in downtown NYC, and the Mimosa suited our needs perfectly. It is located in China Town, close to the subway, with Brooklyn Bridge and ground zero in walking distance.
Great food nearby, helpful staff, easy to get around and very safe. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Mimosa Hotel
text:
Excellent place to stay for a short trip in New York. Room very clean, Staff helpful and courteous. The staff helped to maximise and plan our days in the city.
Loved the kitchen/utility room in the basement with vending, washer/dryer, coffee, ice ECT.

title: What we wanted...
text: I’d read so many reviews on Trip Advisor prior to our three night stay in New York, I felt I knew the hotel inside out before we even arrived... Room was very neat and tidy and what I expected in terms of size.  The trains on Manhattan Bridge could be heard through the night albeit a reduced dull sound that didn’t affect our sleep too much. The sound issue that did affect us (and brings the score to a 4 not a 5) was the internal noise.  We could hear TVs in other rooms and as our room was opposite the lift we could hear when that was in operation from within our room.  Other than that slight issue, great customer service from all staff we encountered, everyone seemed happy to help. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends. Great value.

title: Hotel pulito e ben gestito
text: La struttura si trova nel quartiere China Town. Di solito questo quartiere viene sconsigliato per soggiornarci, ma abbiamo voluto provare, spinti anche dal prezzo modesto per il periodo di capodanno. L'hotel era gestito ovviamente da cinesi. Offrivano tè o caffè caldi a qualsiasi ora della giornata, ed il personale era disponibile a qualsiasi spiegazione, anzi una mattina la ragazza della reception ci ha letteralmente accompagnati alla fermata dell'autobus. Il wi-fi era gratuito e nella nostra stanza il segnale prendeva egregiamente. La pulizia delle stanze era nella media.

title: Minimalizm z fantastyczną obsługą
text:
Hotel położony w centrum Chinatown. Blisko do kilku stacji metra, 15 -20 minut spacerem do Brooklyn Bridge. Niedaleko są tory kolejowe lecz w ciągu nocy nie miałyśmy problemów ze snem gdyż okna są wyciszone.
Fantastyczna obsługa, pomocna we wszystkim, zawsze uśmiechnięta. 
Pokój mały ale wystarczający, dobrze urządzony. Łazienka duża, dobrze wyposażona. 
Recepcja oferowała codziennie kawę i czekoladki w nieograniczonej ilości, bardzo umilało nam to poranki.
Dziękujemy za mile tam spędzony czas.

title: Absolutely outstanding! True attention to customers
text: Remarkable gem in Chinatown, perfect spot to discover New York from, very close to Brooklyn Bridge and the Financial District. The rooms are furnished very nicely, with chic wooden beds, tables and eco leather chairs, bed was big and soft, room was spotless, cleaned every day, the bathroom was big, and included all necessary toiletries in big quantities, and beyond. The staff was remarkably polite, helpful and kind at any time, what was truly an excellent touch was a message for a fire drill excersise for one of the days, translated in the languages of all of their guests currently at the hotel. This hotel is a true gem, absolutely worth every dollar. Great job!!!!

title: Durchschnittliche Qualität
text: Das Hotel hat uns sehr enttäuscht. Wir hatten ein sehr kleines Zimmer ohne jeden Comfort, es war kein Schrank da und das Bad nicht wirklich sauber. Wir haben für den selben Preis in Midtown Manhattan schon besser gewohnt. Das einzig positive Erlebnis in dem Hotel ist das nette und freundliche Personal. Als Plus das sehr saubere Bett, das aber eigentlich selbstverständlich sein sollte.

title: Weekend in NY
text: I took this hotel since it was less expensive than most of the hotels in Manhattan and I didn't want an hostel. I was very pleased to see the room which was perfect for the price I paid (clean, twin beds as requested, bottle of water, warm shower, no noise...). The arrival and departure staff were very nice and helpful (took picture of us, kept our luggage during the day, gave us coffee and sweets). I highly recommend it.

title: Hotel Mimosa Review
text:
We picked this place because price was very reasonable for NYC rates. I originally rated Hotel Mimosa 5 stars on Google, but changed it to 4 because room service did not replenish our drinking cups and toothpaste on our 2nd day. Although I must admit, most hotels do not supply guests in their rooms with toothpaste, razor, shower cap and toothbrush.

The room is very small. They do not have a closet to hang clothes. Instead, they have a small rack. Wi-Fi is good, room is clean. Water bottles are sold for $1 and coffee is served free at the front desk. Front desk staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

Location is in the heart of Chinatown across from the train tracks. Outside can be deafening when the trains drive by. Inside, you can hardly hear them. Nearest subway is about 3-4 blocks away.

title: Wonderful Place!
text:
We really enjoyed this hotel. We try and stay in a good spot close to Manhattan and we came to Mimosa this trip. The staff is wonderful, location (next to Chinatown) is safe and friendly. Walking distance to World Trade and things in that area. Also VERY close proximity to walk both Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridge! Also close to Metro. 

Room is small (normal NYC size), but right, amenities great, very clean, and just five stars in my book. We will most definitely be staying here on our future trips. Thanks Mimosa!

title: A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Chinatown
text: We have only positive things to say about this sweet hotel in the heart of Chinatown.  We were able to check in early and the room, although small (since space is at a premium in Manhattan), had everything you could want in a modern hotel room.  The bed was super comfortable, the linens felt good against our skin, the water was hot, the water pressure for the shower was excellent and best of all, in a bustling city like NYC it was surprisingly quiet. The staff were super helpful and friendly with a Nespresso machine in the lobby night and day.  And the candy bowl was always brimming with the best wrapped candy bars!  We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to any travelers visiting NYC.

title: Does the job!
text:
Hotel mimosa is set in the heart of China town. Upon arrival (we were two hours early for check in) we were told our room was ready therefore we could check in immediately. 
The hotel has lift access and free tea, coffee and chocolates in reception (which we definitely made use of!) 

The hotel was exceptionally clean. Our room albeit small had everything we needed from a comfy bed, to fully stocked supplies such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, toothpaste I could go on and on! 

Our bed was changed every day, and our room cleaned also.

The only reason this hotel has lost a star is because our room was next to the train line and therefore the noise was rather loud - including throughout the night. My partner is a heavy sleeper so it did not bother him but I was woken a few times by the trains. 

The hotel is in a fabulous location with very easy access to Central New York! A subway station is a mere three minute walk down the road making links to and from the airport very nice and easy!

title: Great staff, very clean and convenient location
text:
Todella hyvä hotelli Chinatownissa, 2 metroasemaa muutaman minuutin kävelymatkan päässä. Erittäin siistit huoneet jotka siivottiin joka päivä, hyvät sängyt. Ystävällinen henkilökunta. Ei aamupalamahdollisuutta, mutta kahviloita ja aamupalapaikkoja löytyy paljon hotellin lähettyviltä. Hiljainen huone vaikka manhattanin silta ja metro kulkevat vastapäätä.

Excellent hotel with good location (close to subway), rooms were small as usual in New York and basic but really clean! We stayed for one week. Very friendly and helpful staff. Overall very happy with our choice, would definitely stay here again.

title: Recomendadisimo!
text: Estuvimos una semana con mi pareja en el hotel mimosa. Volvería sin dudarlo. La ubicación es muy accesible, a dos cuadras está el subte. Es un hotel limpio, cómodo, con buena cama, excelente ducha, dónde se puede descansar tranquilo luego de todo un día de caminata en la ciudad. El personal es muy amable, y aunque no tiene desayuno, los huéspedes tienen a disposición café y chocolates en la recepción, sin ninguna restricción. Nosotros habíamos hecho unas compras por internet, las mandamos al hotel, y el personal nos recolectó las cajas sin problemas, y las dejaron en nuestra habitación, con mucha amabilidad. Sin dudas, volvería al mismo hotel.

title: Quiet, clean, great staff, great value!
text: Hotel Mimosa is very clean, and as others have noted, it is nice and quiet. The staff are friendly and very helpful. This is a great value for the price! Rooms are small (it's NYC), but perfectly nice. Under-rated location, too. Chinatown is a very nice place to stay in NYC, especially if you want to see downtown/Business District or Soho or Greenwich Village. Give it a try! I will be back.

title: Buon hotel, ottima posizione
text: Hotel a Manhattan, precisamente a chinatown, a 5 min dalla fermata della metro East Brodeway che ti collega praticamente a tutto. Per spendere un po' meno, ma restare in una posizione ottima è l'ideale. Pulizia della stanza buona, personale gentile. Considerando che se uno va new york punta a restare il meno possibile in hotel a mio avviso è perfetto.

title: MIGLIOR RAPPORTO QUALITÀ PREZZO A MANHATTAN
text: Il miglior albergo in rapporto pulizia/costo/qualità di tutta l'isola, personale molto gentile e disponibile, servizio di navetta per JFK, stanza pulita ogni giorno con cambio di asciugamani, wifi potente e stabile, vicino a qualsiasi metro e si può andare facilmente ovunque, ALTAMENTE CONSIGLIATO

title: Holiday at Hotel Mimosa
text: Well what a great way to start off our trip. The moment we walked into Hotel Mimosa we felt instantly welcomed. The gentleman at the desk provided us with detailed information on how to get the subway and recommendations on where to eat and different cuisines. This was fantastic as we had never been to New York and trying to find your way around China town is like a maze. Every morning the staff said hello and asked if we needed any assistance, when returning for the night the staff again full of smiles welcomed us back. Any question was never too hard and the staff always helped in anyway possible. The rooms are fantastic and cannot fault the hotel and the wonderful staff. When leaving we noticed last minute that a pair of shoes we had bought werent the same size. Again with there nothing to hard attitude, the lovely lady at the front desk offered to exchange them herself and post the shoes to us at our next destination. Wow what great customer service. Highly recommended and we will definitely book with Hotel Mimosa again in the future.

title: Alles was man braucht und günstig
text: Ein für Manhattan recht preiswertes Hotel in der nähe von der Brooklyn Bridge und dem Financial Distrikt. Wenn man etwas Ausdauer hat, kann man Süd-Manhattan von hier aus locker zu Fuß erkunden. Die Angestellten an der Rezeption sind freundlich und helfen gerne weiter. Das Hotel liegt in Chinatown, dass ist sicherlich nicht jedermanns sache, aber wir haben uns hier sicher gefühlt. Das Hotel ist sehr gut gegen Schall von der Straße isoliert. Einzig der Zug von der Manhattan-Bridge ist deutlich zu hören.

title: Nice and very good quality/price
text: Very convenient and clean hotel with a friendly staff. Nice bedding and clean room, We were a little concerned being to close to Manhattan Bridge and the noise,but the noise almost was noticeable during night hours. Close 15  minutes walk to 911 memorial and WTC, closest subway line F at East Broadway station about 5min walk.

title: So quiet, such nice sheets
text: We were a bit worried when we realized we were across the street from the Manhattan Bridge, but thanks to the airport-grade windows (4 panes of glass!) we never heard the cars or the subway trains rumbling over the bridge. The hotel is on a fun corner in Chinatown, 2 minutes walk from the bars and restaurants on Division Street. The staff were friendly and genuinely helpful, the room was spotlessly clean, and the bed was great. They even had free WiFi and live soccer on TV! I really have no complaints; this place is really good value. And we'll be back.

title: Bell’albergo a chinatown
text:
Ho pernottato qui una settimana ad agosto, hotel con personale molto cortese e abbastanza vicino a due fermate della metro pratiche per raggiungere i luoghi di interesse principali a Manhattan.
La stanza è piccola (come si trovano a New York di solito) ma provvista di tutto e con le finestre insonorizzate per evitare di sentire i rumori esterni, la camera è pulita.
Ottima soluzione per chi vuole avere un punto di appoggio a Manhattan e non ha bisogno di particolari comfort in camera ma solo di uno spazio pulito e in buona posizione a un prezzo ragionevole.
Aggiungo che non ho avuto problemi a fare il check-in nonostante non avessi una carta di credito ma solo una di debito (cosa non ovvia negli USA dove normalmente serve una carta di credito).

title: Bom preço para a cidade
text:
O Hotel tem um bom custo benefício. Fica localizado em Chinatown, próximo a ponte do Brooklyn e a três linhas de metrô, porem duas fecham aos fins de semana, mas nada que atrapalhe. No entorno há diversas opções de mercados e restaurantes, em sua maioria asiáticos.

O pessoal da recepção foi sempre muito simpático, inclusive com dicas da cidade.

O quarto era pequeno, porém muito limpo e confortável. A cama era ótima, o banheiro estava sempre limpo, e era bem silencioso durante a noite.

Recomendo.

title: Ottimo hotel
text: Ottimo hotel moderno ,siamo rimasti 3 notti , personale disponibilissimo attento e minuzioso , stanze pulite , servizi impeccabili è stato un piacere soggiornarvi sicuramente lo consiglio . Per il bagno ci sono gli accessori completi quali spazzolino da denti , dentifricio, lametta, shampoo e bagnoschiuma, pettine . Alla reception sempre disponibile e gratuita una macchina da caffè nespresso con tanto di cialde

title: Convenient location
text: We selected this hotel specifically due to its convenient location within walking distance to some government buildings where we had business. It was on the edge of Chinatown on a busy and noisy street, near the approaches to the Manhattan Bridge, and opposite the elevated train line, but fortunately it was surprisingly quiet. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and happy to arrange cabs or other car services, and to give directions. No tea/coffee in rooms but available, free of charge, in the lobby. The room was fairly small but adequate for our needs, clean, and with air conditioning, TV and WiFi. One major disappointing aspect was that on two days of our four day stay, on returning to the room in the afternoon, despite leaving a room-makeup sign on the door, the room had not been made up. We called reception and they quickly sent some staff to attend to this, but we did not appreciate having to lurk outside in the corridor while it was being done. Nevertheless, it was reasonable value for the grade.

title: Amazing little gem in Chinatown
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in June and would definitely recommend/return. 24/7 reception, friendly staff, comfortable bed, free WiFi, air conditioning (which was very much needed), and so close to East Broadway subway station it was ideal. We didn’t have any issues with noise, despite the fact I’m a light sleeper - we were facing the subway line and outside it was really noisy, but in the room it was a quiet rumble. The room wasn’t huge, but had everything we needed. The bathroom was well stocked and the whole area was really clean. When we were waiting for a quick rain shower to pass one evening and the guy on reception came and offered us a brolly to take with us. I would also definitely use their car service to go back to the airport, set price and cheaper than cabs. Due to traffic issues, the journey back to Newark took us about 2.5 hours and the fee was still $61, whereas the journey in a yellow cab from the airport which took about 45 mins cost us $85!! Speak to reception to book...

title: Clean, quiet and fantastic location
text: We stayed at hotel mimosa for a week in june 2018 and were very happy with the hotel.   The room was very clean and surprisingly quiet given the proximity to the Manhattan bridge.  The staff were wonderful and it was very easy to access other areas of the city because of the nearby subway lines.  We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

title: Great little hotel in bustling Chinatown
text: We were happy with our choice of this hotel. The room was nicely furnished with a modern look even if it was slightly on the small side. I prefer small hotel rooms to pricey ones anyway. Everything worked well and customer service was superb! There was complementary tea and coffee available at the reception.

title: Inexpensive with a down-side
text: Room was small but clean, and at a good rate. The down side is that there are two sides to the hotel. The one I stayed in faces the subway tracks coming off the Manhattan (?) bridge, just a block away. The rumbling of the morning commute kept me from sleeping any longer. So up and out to see NYC! I think that only a heavy sleeper could have slept through this.

title: Solo stay - first time in NYC
text:
I stayed at Hotel Mimosa for two nights in early June for a solo adventure in the big city. The location is excellent-within 5 minutes of walking, you’re able to get to two different subway stations. The room was clean and simple decorated which I enjoyed. Given all the craziness in Chinatown, I was pleasantly surprised that I couldn’t hear any of it in my room. Sometimes a little rumbling from the train running in the bridge, but it was not enough to wake me up. The staff was the best though-very friendly! I dropped my bag off about 6 hours before I could check in, and they held it and brought it to my room when it was ready. 

The neighborhood is unique and this hotel was a clean, safe space to return to each evening. I’d stay here again.

title: Great Hotel in Chinatown
text: The Hotel staff were extremely friendly, polite and helpful.Location next to the Manhattan Bridge, a slight rumble could be heard from the trains on the bridge at night but not enough to effect my sleep as there is decent double glazing.Just a short walk to the subway which gets you into Midtown in about 15 mins or so.Rooms were immaculately clean and the on suite bathroom was lovely with a decent shower.In the basement there is a vending machine and a laptop with printer.Complimentary tea and coffee is supplied in the reception.Would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent hotel, great location, friendly staff!
text:
My husband and I spent May 19-21, 2018 at Hotel Mimosa for our 20th Anniversary. Staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. They made us feel like part of their extended family! 
The mini chocolate bars and espresso machine at the front desk were a nice treat. 
Our room was clean, bright and modern and the size of an average bedroom, not large but not tiny. The washroom was larger than expected and very clean. 
The location is great (about a 20 minute walk to places we wanted to go) and close to subway stations if you want to go uptown. I highly recommend booking the car service through the hotel for airport transportation (affordable and very efficient). 
This will be the only place we stay whenever we visit NYC!

title: Good hotel in Chinatown
text:
We were happy with our choice of hotel. The room was nicely furnished with a modern look even if it was slightly on the small side. I prefer small hotel rooms to pricy ones anyway. Everything worked well and customer service was superb!

There was complementary tea and coffee available at the reception.

The air conditioning could not be turned off for the night and was too powerful so I got a sore throat each night. The Manhattan Bridge is very close so it is a bit noisy. Maybe not the best choice if you're a light sleeper.

title: Vriendelijke medewerkers
text: Prima hotel aan de rand van Chinatown. De medewerkers waren erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Met de metro is bijna alles wel goed bereikbaar, maar zelf lopen is goed te doen. Kamers waren prima. Goede bedden.

title: Value for money, comfotable room, Good location
text: Front desk associates were very welcoming and friendly. Room was small, lighting was a bit dull, but it was adequate for our needs. Room / bathroom were clean and bed was very comfortable. Location was good. Brooklyn bridge was at a walkable distance. Statue of liberty, 9-11 memorial was also close. We had to take china tours (TakeTours) the next day. The pickup point of tours was very close to the hotel (just 5 mins walk for 75 Chrystie Street pickup). This made it super easy for us to check out from the hotel and walk to the pickup point with our lugguage.

title: Really enjoyed our stay!
text:
Myself & my husband stayed at this hotel in September. To be honest, we booked a cheap deal on flights & when we tried to book a hotel, the prices were through the roof due to the UN General assembly. The Mimosa was one of the few options in our price range apart from hostels & rooms with shared bathrooms.

We ended up splitting our NYC stay between the Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca & the Mimosa as there was literally NO availability in NYC. For me, the Mimosa blew the Hilton out of the water! 

The area was bustling during the day, but peaceful at night. It felt safe to walk around at all times. It is right by the Manhattan Bridge, but we barely heard a sound from the traffic & trains. A slight murmur at most. The location was maybe a little bit out of the way of major attractions, but plenty of travel options nearby.

The staff on reception were lovely & very helpful during our stay.
The room itself was modern & functional. The beds were extremely comfortable & we slept like logs. The bathroom was spotlessly clean & the water pressure in the shower was fantastic. The decor in the hallways does not match the actual rooms & not to my taste.

I thouroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a budget hotel in New York.

title: real gem in Chinatown
text: Stated for 4 nights.  Staff very welcoming and couldn't have helped us more.  We stayed on the recommendation of a friend who had also stayed her.  Room small but we had everything we needed.  Free tea and coffee downstairs.  Room clean and bed very comfortable.  Great location for exploring.  We would stay here again.

title: Great little hotel!
text: Definitely going back next time - it was clean and comfortable and great location in Chinatown. The rooms are very small, but typical for a smaller Manhattan hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downside is the noise from the trains on the Manhattan bridge but really not that bad . Great hotel for a budget traveler!

title: Parfait pour un séjour à NY
text: Un accueil chaleureux avec les nouveaux propriétaires, pour les chambres avec salle de bain sont réduites au minimum. la propreté est au RDV et vous aurez droit à un café Nespresso le matin à l'accueil. Parfaitement situé dans le quartier de chinatown cela vous permettra de visiter Manhattan avec des bouches de métro à proximité de Financial district et de little Italie. n'hésitez plus avec un rapport qualité prix excelllent. good travel

title: Rent och fräscht, trevlig personal
text:
Hotellet låg bra till i det lugna China Town. Rummen var rena och kändes moderna och fräscha. Rummet var litet, men sängen stor, det fanns knappt plats att öppna sin resväska på golvet. Precis utanför ligger Manhattan Bridge där tågen går hela tiden. De väsnas en hel del, men vi vande oss snabbt.

Personalen var trevlig och hjälpsamma, de tipsade om både matställen och shopping och hälsade alltid glatt när man kom och gick. Receptionen bemannad dygnet runt.

title: Leuk hotel in het hartje van Chinatown
text:
Hotel Mimosa is een klein hotel dat recent gerenoveerd is en dat merk je, alles is kraaknet.
Het hotel is gelegen in het hartje van Chinatown recht tegenover de Manhattan Bridge en dat hoor je natuurlijk al heeft dit ook zijn charme. Ook al zijn de ramen goed geïsoleerd, toch hoort men de treinen s'nachts over de brug rijden. Ik had er zelf geen probleem mee. Mensen die licht slapen kunnen misschien beter een kamer aan de achterzijde vragen.
Het onthaal is hartelijk en het personeel is steeds zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Je kan er zelfs een lijst krijgen met leuke restaurantjes  in de buurt en die zijn er in Chinatown in overvloed.
Ook al is het hotel gelegen in Lower Manhattan, toch is het door het vlakbij gelegen metrostation een goede uitvalbasis om zowel Manhattan als Brooklyn te ontdekken.
De kamer is netjes maar zelfs voor New Yorkse normen klein. Zo heb je bvb geen plaats om uw koffers weg te zetten of uw kledij weg te leggen op een klein hangrekje na. Dit is het enige minpunt. De badkamer is voldoende ruim en voorzien van verzorgingsproducten waaronder zelfs tandpasta, tandenborstel en een wegwerpschermesje. In de lobby is er steeds gratis koffie en thee te verkrijgen . In de kelder staat een vending machine waar je drinken, snacks en zelfs pijnstillers kan kopen.
Het hotel is absoluut een aanrader, zeker als je een ander New York City wil zien

title: Simple but perfectly adequate and pleasant stay
text: We were staying for 5 nights as tourists in New York. The location is good, in Chinatown, easy to walk to Soho/Lower Eastside/East village/Financial district but more of a long walk/subway to get to midtown area. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was small but perfectly adequate with good bathroom- cleaned and fresh towels every day. You could hear the rumble of trains at night given the proximity to the railway but it wasnt loud enough to disturb our sleep. Given the low price this is a good choice for anyone wanting a basic but clean and friendly hotel.

title: Amazing hotel and wonderful staff!
text:
We had the pleasure of staying here twice in the last few months, and truly enjoyed it.

Their guest services were excellent for the price, the staff went out of their way to help us in anything, booking restaurants, finding memorable New York experiences, etc., just like a classic European hotel. 

The rooms we had were spacious, very New York in decor, quiet and ultra-clean. Super comfortable bed, amazing shower. The housekeeping are here practically all the time, very good people. The wallpaper in the hallways are out of this world, you wouldn’t expect it…. we chanced upon a fashion shoot one afternoon, so chic, and they were shooting a french music video on the street and roof. 

When we checked in they gave a choice of customized guides to parts of the city and hand drawn maps, we really liked their cool service. Perfect location just in the middle of things too, the LES, Chinatown, and the hotel is a few minutes from the train. Finally, we loved free espresso around the clock. It was great experience staying at Mimosa

title: Great stay in Chinatown
text:
This was a solid hotel. I was surprised at the quality of service. This seems like a new hotel; everything seemed new. I didn’t try their breakfast so I can’t comment on that. But they did have coffee and tea at the front desk for free. The only thing is that they are very sensitive about guests’ movement after 10pm, which is okay. However, it felt very paternal when my partner and I would leave the hotel at 12am/1am to go out. We couldn’t leave as freely as we would like. This is a small family-run hotel so keep that in mind.

The area is Chinatown — lots of cheap food and nightlife/art galleries nearby in the Lower East Side/Little Italy/Soho. It’s always next to lots of public transportation so it’s very easy to get around. 

Rooms need some fresh remodeling but the rooms were clean and we were given soap, lotion, toothpaste, toothbrushes, razors and fresh towels. It’s definitely a solid choice.

title: Melhor Custo-benefício
text:
Fiquei hospeda no hotel por 10 dias. Essa hospedagem superou minhas expectativas, achei EXCELENTE. 

O pessoal que fica na recepção sempre estavam muito receptivos para qualquer solicitação ou esclarecimento.

Meu quarto era no terceiro andar e virado para avenida, eu não tive problemas com barulhos, sobre o barulho dos trens que passam no metro bem próximo, não me incomodou em nada, de noite quase não passa trens. Esse quesito achei bem tranquilo. 

Tudo estava muito limpo e organizado. Tinha arrumação nos quartos todo os dias.
Achei a cama confortável e grande (em vista da foto).

A localização do hotel no bairro é muito boa, relativamente perto de estações do metrô (East Broadway / Delancey St - Essex St) é possível caminhar para qualquer uma das duas tranquilamente. 

O caminho do metrô para o hotel de noite me pareceu seguro, quase todos os dias chegava depois das 23h no metrô e caminhava até o hotel, o bairro fica meio vazio, mas me passou uma sensação de segurança. 

A localização é ótima, se tiver disposição dá para fazer muitas coisas a pé. 

O hotel também oferece uma lista de recomendações para fazer as refeições nas proximidades do hotel, achei bem válido, utilizamos algumas indicações e foi ótimo. 
A melhor recomendação que eu achei, devido a falta de café da manhã no hotel, foi o café da TOUS LES JOURS no endereço: 7 Division St. Super perto do hotel. Vale a pena conhecer lá - Dica: Muffin de Blueberry.  

O banheiro sempre estava limpo, toalhas trocadas todos os dias, também ficava a disposição Shampoo, condicionador, hidratante, escova de dentes, pasta de dente, gillette, pente e secador. 
Chuveiro ótimo. 

Um ponto negativo do bairro é que muita coisa fecha "cedo", inclusive muitos restaurantes, então não deixe de sair para comer depois das 21h, o pessoal das cozinhas geralmente encerram os pedidos por volta das 22h.
*Na saída do metrô na estação Delency St - Essex St tem uma pizzaria NEW ROMA PIZZA, fecha ás 23h e aceita só dinheiro. Valeu a pena passar por lá quando eu precisava comer depois das 22h. 

Espaço no quarto:achei que é do tamanho suficiente para duas pessoas, com malas grandes e um pouquinho organização dá pra se acomodar com muita facilidade. 

Me hospedaria aqui novamente com certeza, atendimento excelente com melhor custo-benefício. 

OBS: Minhas fotos são do dia que deixei o hotel, então o quarto estava meio bagunçado.

title: Lovely little hotel in Chinatown!
text: Welcomed at check-in by a very courteous staff who continued to be very attentive and hospitable throughout our stay here. Small room but more than enough for two. Modern touches, minimalist style with very functional space e.g. multi-dimensional clothes rack instead of a closet which works well. All that you require for grooming and a good night’s rest. Roomy bathroom, comfortable bed and very clean and well kept. Housekeeping staff is quite efficient and accommodating. Dining mainly Chinese with some western fare within walking distance and close to transit for access to other amenities. Nice place, nice people. Worth staying here, will stay again.

title: Clean, quiet, great location
text: PERFECT place to stay on our 4-day trip to NYC. The staff was so helpful, the room was clean and quiet (and a great size compared to so many tiny places we looked at for the same price), and the location was ideal for incredible food and drink, in Chinatown, lower east side, and beyond (plus numerous subway stops within 5-10 min walk). We've already booked a return trip for next month!

title: Clean and well priced.
text: We needed a single night stay at a reasonable price in New York. Hotel Mimosa was clean, easy to find and the staff was so pleasant. Check in was convenient and they have city guides for everyone. Room had a cool view of Freedom Tower and it was very close to the bridge. Perfect for exploring the area.

title: Lurad av hotellpersonal !
text:
Vart så lurad av personalen när vi bokade våra resa tillbaka till flygplatsen.
Vi hade en voucher och alltså redan betalat med shuffelbuss till flygplatsen.
Vi pratar med personalen och visar vår voucherbiljett och de ska bara boka bussen.
Samma dag vi ska åka så kommer det en svart bil som plockar upp oss och vi reagerar inte direkt utan sätter oss i bilen för att ta oss till flygplatsen (första gången i NY) men när vi kommer fram så vill chauffören ha betalt 60 dollar för resan, vi försöker förklara att vi redan har betalat han är chinese och det är väldigt svårt att förstå honom, han får ringa hotellet, men de säger att de har gjort rätt och vi måste betala och även ge honom tip. Så fruktansvärd arg och besviken på våran sista dag.
Så var riktigt övertydlig med personalen om ALLT.
Kommer absolut aldrig att rekommendera detta hotell.

title: Basic but very nice hotel
text:
We stayed in Mimosa for 6 days. The hotel is basic but quite nice, clean and very well-located in New York. Chinatown is a fascinating place by itself. It is not the cleanest part of Manhattan so to say but here you can find a lot of budget cafes with Asian food, shops with unusual goods and the cheapest souvenirs in the city. The rooms in the hotel are small but cozy, with comfortable beds. Note that you will not be able to eat a proper meal in the room, because there is no space for that. You can get free tea and coffee in the reception. You can hear some noise from the busy streets outside but it was not so bad. 
We had to open the window because of slightly moist air in the room but it was not a big issue. 
The staff was friendly and helped us a lot with giving us directions and organizing taxi, which was cheaper than the NY yellow taxi. All in all it was a positive experience.

title: All you need
text: Nice and clean Hotel in Chinatown with very friendly staff. It‘s located close to the F train in a vivid neighborhood next to Little italy and nolita. You can walk to a few sighs like Brooklyn Bridge and 9/11 Memorial. Absolutely fair prices for NYC and all you get.

title: Cozy, clean, comfortable
text: I was only in New York two nights for a conference at a nearby law school, and chose Mimosa based on reviews and proximity. It turned out to be a great choice. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, even providing a list of restaurant recommendations in the surrounding area. My room was small but clean and comfortable, and the building appears recently renovated. Although the hotel is right by the Manhattan Bridge, my hotel room on the second floor had no problems with street noise. I had a great stay and would stay again if in the area.

title: Great place and friendly Staff
text: Nice size hotel in Chinatown. Two subway stations both within a 5 min walk. Room has double windows so can’t hear a thing outside. Good size bed with still space to move around the room. Bathroom good size too. Free WiFi but no mini fridge in room. Staff was EXCELLENT! Offers free coffee,tea,and candy plus reception is open 24/7. Would highly recommend for a weekend stay in NY.

title: Incredibly helpful staff
text: The staff were so incredibly helpful. Unfortunately I fell ill while staying in the hotel (nothing at all to do with the hotel). They called a doctor for me and then went out and bought me snacks and drinks without me even asking, and they would not take any money for the things they bought me. So very kind.

title: Awesome hotel
text: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Mimosa,  Dec 2-4, everything in the hotel is brand new, owners took over within the last year & completely remodeled the whole place, we usually stay in midtown when we go to the city but decided we wanted to try something different & we feel like we discovered a whole new world, even though we have been to Chinatown many times before, staying right there is a good experience, we honestly hated to leave the neighborhood, everyone at the hotel really makes u feel welcome & r very appreciative of ur stay with them, there r just so many things to see & enjoy within 10-20 blocks of the hotel, my wife honestly thought she may feel a little uncomfortable staying in Chinatown but it will be on the top of r list for r next visit to the city, specifically Hotel Mimosa, try this hotel & u won't be sorry.

title: Great location, clean, very nice rooms
text: I stayed here for 3 nights after a work trip. I am picky about cleanliness and I was very happy with this hotel. The location was also great. It’s in China town and a very easy walk to the lower east side, several fantastic restaurants, live music venues, and bars. There are train noises, so may not be ideal if you are a light sleeper, but I found the hotel to be very serene and comfortable compared to it’s very busy surroundings.

title: Try something a little different
text: Mimosa is a small hotel in Chinatown, with small serviceable rooms, immaculately clean, and a friendly and informative staff. The location is great - close to the F train and several other lines and buses. Mott Street, Delancey, the fascinating small streets of Chinatown- all great places to shop, eat, and wander. I️ had never stayed in this part of Manhattan and I️ will definitely return to the Hotel Mimosa.

title: Perfecta situación y perfecto precio
text:
He estado una semana con mi pareja en el hotel la mimosa , iba con miedo , pero me sorprendió para muy bien , está cerca del puente de brooklin de la ciudad financiera , de little italy.
Está muy LIMPIO y los trabajadores son muy amables.
Te reciben con una sonrisa además de ayudarte con cualquier tipo de duda , yo no me lo pensaría y volvería al mismo hotel .

title: Friendly gem of a place!
text: We primarily booked this because the price was so good in comparison to other places.  However, we are very glad we did as it is a lovely place.  The reception staff are very friendly and extremely helpful.  We picked their brains on several occasions and my friend would go down to reception each morning to get our coffee and they would gladly pass the time of day with him.  Our room was light and on the spacious side of small, but we never felt like we were tripping over furniture.  The only niggle we had was trying to work out the TV as we had to make sure the cable was on.  Maybe they should have left instruction for idiots like us?  The beds were so comfortable that sleep wasn't a problem.  Manhattan Bridge is very close and I was afraid when we booked that it might be noisy, but you don't actually notice the noise of the subway.  On checking in, we were given a hand drawn map showing the immediate area with the way to the subway which was excellent and well used as we got lost in Chinatown more than once.  The hot drinks are always available in reception along with friendly conversation.  We didn't use the vending machines downstairs, as we only ventured down there once, just before we left.  Reception ordered a car for us for the airport which was considerably cheaper at $40 than the cab we took from the airport which was around $60.  I can't recommend this enough if you are looking to stay in Lower Manhattan.

title: Basic , clean hotel
text:
I stayed at the Mimosa Hotel two nights and I have to say that it is a basic but confortable hotel.
Located in the heart of Chinatown, close to the train passing by: I was afraid it was going to be a noisy place but, thanks to the double glass windows, it was ok.
The room was small but confortable. Nice bathroom.
TV with cable . No safe deposit box.
The hotel is clean and staff attentive and helpful.
A bit pricey for location and quality

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità - prezzo! Consigliato!
text:
Sono stata in questo hotel 7 notti e mi sono trovata benissimo.
Personale gentile e sempre disponibile, posizione ottima (a 5 minuti a piedi dalla metro East Broadway e 10 min da Canal Street).
La stanza accogliente, pulita e con spazi vitali.

Ottimo rapporto qualità - prezzo.

Lo consiglio a chiunque!

title: Good value for money
text: This hotel is in Chinatown and we stayed for 3 nights. We order things from Internet and shipped to the hotel. They keep everything for us. The service is excellent. The guys at the front desk are very nice with service mind.

title: Perfect! - DON'T listen to bad reviews
text:
Don't listen to the bad reviews, about the bad rooms etc - it's been updated since then and has great decoration, good air con, no noise and is clean! 
From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by an extremely welcoming team - David the manager gave us a handmade map of the area and the best places to eat, where to get the subway and which train it was. They took our bags and told us to come back 30-60 mins later which we did. The hotel room was lovely! Nice decor, very clean bathroom - comb, razor, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shower gel, shampoo was all provided! Great shower, VERY quiet room which was pleasantly surprising as the hotel is literally next to Manhattan bridge - you couldn't hear anything apart from the hum of the trains on the track at about 6am which was fine for us as it was barely noticeable. Air conditioning was perfect. ice machine, vending machine, microwave, sink, paper cups, hot water, clean fridge, computer, printer was all provided the bottom floor in a room which is open from 7:30-22:30 - very convenient! 
Always greeted by the very kind reception staff when we came in or out of the hotel. Every time we went out for the day, we would come back to an empty bin. 
The night before we went home David told us about their taxi prices to the airport (JFK) and it was $40, whereas when we came it was $62 including tip! So it was a lot cheaper and convenient as they organised it all for us :-) 
The surrounding area of Chinatown is very authentic and friendly, did not have a problem at all . We felt very safe there and everyone got on with their own thing.
Overall, I think this is a brilliant place to stay in New York, worth the money and would 100% come again.
David was very interested in us and the UK, asking us where is a good place to stay, and loved having good conversations with us - thank you David for having us - thank you ever so much!

title: Nice place to explore new york
text: The location of the hotel is great to see both manhathen and Brooklyn bridges and see the famous china town in NYC. All the staff in the front desk are very friendly and helpful. If you prefer to get cars dropping you here and there they have a good connection to help you that at reasonable prices. The only shortcoming is the room size but that doesn't matter much as room is clean and washroom is reasonably wide. Above all most bus companies are with in a distance of 5 minutes of walk if you plan to make excursion or trips out of NYC. Consider the property for your next NYC trip

title: Hotel is in Chinatown but in walking distance to start of Lower East Side
text: The front desk staff if friendly and helpful. Rather small rooms. No refrigerator or microwave. Not even a iron or ironing board in the room, but you can get one from the from desk is desired. There is no free parking nearby, but hey, this in NYC. What did you expect. There is a subway station is walking distance. The beginning of the Lower East Side is also in Walking distance. The hotel is in Chinatown so there are many Asian restaurants in the vicinity. The area is kind of smelly from scraps and other trash from the restaurants and other businesses.

title: Una muy buena opción económica para NYC
text: Si buscas una opción económica alrededor de los 150 USD por noche, esta es una muy buena opción en el barrio Chino de Manhattan. Esta bien ubicado cerca a los Puentes de Brooklyn y Manhattan en el Lower East Side. Tienen una muy buena atención, esta cerca del Distrito Financiero y del WTC. title: Great stay
text: This hotel we thought would be a bit below standard, but the room was neat and bathroom sufficient for a few nights. Great value for money when you are out and about all day and need a comfy bed and warm bath! Nice to be close to Manhattan Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge and area is so interesting to explore
