title: Ótimo custo-benefício e localizacao
text:
NY e bem cara, principalmente em julho. Este hotel tem um dos melhores preços de hospedagens, principalmente para quem como nos pretende passar mais que 5 dias. 
Pontos positivos: 
Localização: Possível ir a pé ao memorial 9/11. Estação de metrô (East broadway) ha 2 quadras do hotel. Está na "cabeça" na Manhattan bridge e próximo a Brooklyn bridge. Rapidamente você pode ir de metrô para qualquer ponto da cidade ou voltar de qualquer ponto da cidade. 
Segurança:
Tanto os quartos quanto a região se mostraram seguros a nos. E andamos muito a pé em horários diversos.
Hospedagem:
Quarto médio e limpo. Cama confortável. Isolamento acústico externo excelente (ficamos no 405). Chuveiro com água quente e forte. Amenidades: pasta e escovas de dentes, barbeador, pente. O hotel disponibiliza microondas, máquina de gelo, máquina de venda de bebidas (não alcoólicas), computador e impressora no piso C, e máquina de café na recepção.
Refeições:
Diversos restaurantes ao redor do hotel. Chineses, gregos, pizza, lanchonetes. E o bairro litte Italy bem próximo.
Pontos negativos:
A acústica interna do hotel não é muito boa para quem tem sono leve. Nosso quarto foi privilegiado, mas é possível sim ouvir Bayer de porta e vozes nos corredores. Creio que principalmente para os quartos mais centrais.
O horário de entrada e saída da hospedagem também não ajuda muito para quem chega cedo. No nosso caso nosso voo foi noturno e não tivemos problema, mas o horário de entrada e as 16h e se chegar antes disso e bom torcer para conseguir um check-in antecipado.
Ha muitos restaurantes, mas nem todos ficam abertos até tarde. E os supermercado são bastante direcionados ao público chinês. Se você não for chinês, sugiro, como nos, ou comer antes de voltar ao hotel ou comprar sua comida de onde estiver e trazer. Outra coisa, alguns restaurantes tem cardápio exposto na frente só em chinês.
Não tivemos café da manhã no hotel e este é um ponto difícil na região. E bom se organizar para ter algo para comer no quarto ou sair para comer na cidade porque na região é difícil encontrar café da manhã "convencional".
Dica: atravessando a rua a direita de quem sai do hotel tem um restaurante bem simples de esquina onde todos os pratos custam 5 dólares. Adoramos a comida. E farta e saborosa.

title: Great place to stay!
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but clean. You do not need a fancy room in New York. Rooms are just for sleeping because there is so much to see and do. I would recommend them highly.

title: Great location
text: We spent 4 nights here while being in the city for the 5 Boro Bike Tour.  The location is perfect for walking and exploring the city; we were easily able to walk to the 9/11 memorial and to explore the waterfront and financial district.  The hotel is at the entrance to the Manhattan Bridge which allowed​ me to do a morning run across this bridge and then to return on the Brooklyn Bridge - fantastic.  Being in the heart of Chinatown was fascinating.  The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful.  The rooms are small, but clean.

title: Grata surpresa
text: Apesar de minha primeira opção não ter sido o Mimosa, fui realocada lá, pela agência de viagem, de última hora. A experiência, no geral, acabou sendo muito boa. O hotel é uma delícia, com um staff super atencioso e quartos bastante confortáveis e limpos. A localização também é legal, pois fica a 5 minutos da estação East Broadway, que leva a Uptown rapidinho. O único ponto negativo é que a região, apesar de ser bastante agitada durante o dia, tem poucas opções de supermercados, farmácias ou lojas abertas durante a noite. De todo modo, voltando a NYC, não hesitaria em me hospedar no Mimosa outra vez.

title: No frills
text: Cheapest place I could find in NYC; actually cheaper than Airbnb these days. The room is bare bones, but adequate. Basically clean, except for some mold on the shower tiles. You get a private bathroom. The staff is basically friendly. My biggest concern is that the hotel is right next to the bridge and subway lines; but the windows are specially made and I had no trouble sleeping (although I hate noise at night). The TV was, again, adequate. No coffee machine in the room; bring your own soap. But safe and quiet - the only two things I need - so I would say if you don't care about anything else, certainly adequate.

title: Clean Room in Chinatown
text:
Check-in starts at 16:00.  But, we were lucky to be able to check-in at around 13:00 after a long flight.  Hotel staff were polite and helpful.  Hotel is located iN Chinatown - not the best location but convenient way to
get to Manhattan as the subway (East Broadway) is only two blocks from the hotel.  Free coffee at the lobby.  Friendly staff.  Hotel was secure.  Room was clean and quiet.  A few amenities i.e. toothbrush, paste and shaver.  Mostly Chinese stores in the area but found a nice breakfast place - Dimes nearby.  Option for hotel transfer either bus or car available.  Had to check-out at noon.  They kept our bags while we did a 3 hour last minute tour in Manhattan before our flight.  Value for money in NYC

title: Light sleepers should avoid
text:
This place wasn't terrible (see positive aspects below); however, a lack of sleep due to noise probably made it worse than it seemed. While thick windows minimized the quintessential NYC street clamor, the door to our room did little to block out the noise from the corridor. This either kept us awake during the night or woke us early in the morning. It was like staying in a noisy youth hostel.

Constructive criticism for management - maybe investigate ways to reduce the noise from every door loudly slamming shut?

Additionally, both our cards to the room failed on numerous occasions, requiring us to go downstairs to reception to get replacements, and over 4 days the cleaners did little more than make the bed (e.g., the full trash can was emptied maybe once?).

Positives: The shower was terrific (hot with great pressure). The location is great, within walking distance to a number of subway lines, Soho, Little Italy and the Brooklyn St Bridge.

title: Worst hotel ever.
text:
Ok so this was a 93 dollar priceline special so what should we expect. The room was like a broom cupboard and smelled of smoke. There were numerous cigarette burns in the night stand and people were smoking pot in adjacent rooms and the smell was awful. The front desk staff just kept repeating that this was a non smoking hotel and did nothing to make things better. 
The temperature of the room was like a dry sauna and when we complained they said they would turn down the central air but then in a few hrs it was too hot. You could not open the window because the noise of the subway cars was too much. 

Do not stay here if you want to do anything other than crash after a party

title: God placering på oplevelsesrejse
text:
Min kæreste og jeg skulle fejre nytår i NYC. Det var første gang for os begge på Manhattan. 

Hotellet i sig selv er ikke fancy, der er lidt sjovt tapet og området i sig selv er måske ikke det hyggeligste!
Dog følte vi os trygge! 

Personalet på hotellet var meget venlige og hjælpsomme! Rigtig god service og altid smilende! 
Værelset var ikke så stort,men der var alt det nødvendige!! Hotellet ligger lige ved en jernbane, hvilket måske kan give gener for nogen! Vi var dog på ingen måde generet af det og fik god nattesøvn på trods heraf! 

Det fungerede perfekt som base for vores rejse! God placering i forhold til metro - nemt at komme omkring! Det vi sparede på overnatning blev brugt på flere oplevelser 👍🏼☺

title: God base for en NYC storbyferie
text:
Meget venligt personale tog imod os 26. December. 
Hotellet ligger omkring 150-200 meter fra nærmeste metro, så det er nemt at komme rundt på hele Manhatten.  
Hvis man er meget følsom overfor støj, vil man kunne opleve gener fra jernbanen som ligger meget tæt på hotellet. Det var dog ikke noget som generede os under opholdet og vi kunne nemt sove trods dette. 
Alt i alt et fint hotel til pengene, idet vi brugte vores tid/penge på at opleve den skønne by :-) 
Hotellet arrangerede en taxa/bil til lufthavnen til 40$, det fungerede bare super.

title: Sucio y ruidoso. Bien ubicado.
text: En los alrededores hay mucha basura porque hay mercados muy cerca. El ruido del tren permanente es bastante molesto. El aseo de la habitación deja mucho que desear. A su favor que está en Manhattan y los empleados son muy amables.

title: not bad for price
text:
read some bad reviews but was not bad as i thought.
was bigger than i imagined, not as cold as i thought room will be.
subway was little annoying but bearable.
staff was friendly, bed and bathroom was clean enough. 
much cheaper than most ny hotels, could stay there again.

title: Good Find in Chinatown
text: This hotel was a good value for its cost, and exceeded my expectations. Our superior room was clean, comfortable, and quiet; we were on the corner and had nice views from our windows. The room was on the smaller side but could definitely accommodate two people. Overall I really liked the decor and look of the hotel. The shower was hot and had good water pressure. The staff were friendly and helpful and were available at all times. The location was good; there were lots of dining options around, and we were within walking distance to the WTC and multiple subway stations. I would stay here again!

title: Clean Affordable Place to Stay
text: This is a very clean place and very affordable in comparison with anything else in the city. It is close to train stations and great food all around. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The only complain I have is that the heater was off on our floor the first 2 days we were there. Not a huge deal I know if I would of asked they would of turned it on like they did the 3rd day we were there. I would stay there again.

title: "Small,Clean and Inexpensive "
text: Small, clean and inexpensive; what else do you need in NYC. This is a no frills establishment that offers you the necessities for an overnight stay in the city. The subway is a few blocks away and the area is safe. This is my new go to when staying in NYC.

title: This is definitely not a boring chain hotel
text: Yes, the hotel staff is Very friendly and very helpful. Yes, the room was small with a queen size bed and just enough room to walk around it. No closet, but there was a place to hang a few things. The bed was very nice. The furniture was decent. The carpeting was really terrible but seemed clean. There were worn holes in it everywhere. The room is only about 12'x14' so I can't imagine that it would be that much $$ to carpet. Also, be prepared for some very "retro" wallpaper . The location is great. It was a good value overall.

title: Inexpensive Micro rooms
text:
I love this hotel. The rooms are minimal  in size and the beds aren't soft but the rooms are very, very clean and the bathrooms are updated. The staff is friendly and professional. I stay here all the time because I love chinatown. I used to stay in the LES but since it's being heavily gentrified it's too pricy for me now.

I come into the city two or three times a month and this spot is my go-to.The tiny, tiny rooms have no mini-fridge, no microwave and no closet. If you don't care about luxury and just need a clean, basic room for a great price and you love Chinatown then you must surely go here, stay here and fall in love.

title: Friendly staff and owner
text: But if confusion when I came at first as Mayor Hotel isn't the actual hotel. The address is empty, the actual hotel is next door, the Mimosa. Other than the confusion it is very welcoming. The owner is very hands on and friendly

title: Great location 4 down town, Basic hotel, but ticks the boxes
text: My husband & i stayed here in march 16 for 5 night as our children had bhought us this trip 4 our joint 50th, the hotel reviews we read where not great but we found it absolutly fine. Yep its small but your in the big apple so didnt intend 2 spend a lot of time here, the rooms where cleaned everyday, hairdryer provide but no kettle & despite reviews the beds where comfy & big enough 4 us, its a great location 4 downtown but we had a real issue with the new york taxis they never knew where 2 go! Long gone r the tradtional yellow cab drivers, they could take a lesson  from london taxis drivers & the knowledge, long may it rein! The best way Getting around new york are the hop on hope off dark red buses, great value 4 money & the guides do an absolutly fab job, entertaining & imformative, true new yorkers. Although it is a great location but with hindsight midtown would b my choice, that said u would pay a lot extra 4 it, so mayor hotel gets my vote.
